Title: Junior - Data Analyst - Milano/Cagliari
Description:
Junior - Data Analyst Milano/Cagliari

Sei pronto a #MakeAnImpactThatMatters nel nostro team Audit & Assurance?

Entrando nel Team di Deloitte Data Analytics Audit&Assurance avrai l‚Äôoccasione di crescere e sviluppare forti competenze trasversali, lavorando su progetti sfidanti e collaborando con moltissimi clienti.

Con la supervisione dei colleghi e colleghe pi√π esperti, sarai responsabile delle attivit√† progettuali nelle quali sarai coinvolto, e della qualit√† del tuo lavoro e del tuo allineamento alle priorit√†, agli obiettivi e alle esigenze dei clienti.

Grazie a questa esperienza, potrai acquisire un bagaglio culturale utile e ampio in questo ambito operando in una realt√† leader nel settore.

#YourRole

In quanto Analyst avrai la possibilit√† di imparare dai colleghi pi√π Senior (attraverso il learning on the job) e sviluppare competenze tecniche e relazionali lavorando in un contesto stimolante, che comporta sfide impegnative con ottime prospettive professionali.

In Particolare, Ti Occuperai Di


Raccogliere, analizzare e interpretare dati provenienti da diverse fonti, mediante l‚Äôutilizzo di strumenti quali Excel, SQL, Python.
Sviluppare report e dashboard tramite i principali tool di BI (es. PowerBI, Qlik Sense, Qlik Cloud,‚Ä¶).
Supportare nell‚Äôorganizzazione e gestione dei dataset su database relazionali e NoSQL.
Analizzare, interpretare dati e fornire insights per il miglioramento dei processi aziendali


Grazie all‚Äôufficio Learning avrai modo di seguire corsi e attivit√† di formazione che ti permetteranno di ampliare e approfondire le tue conoscenze.

I colleghi del Talent invece, si occuperanno in maniera strutturata del tuo avanzamento di carriera con KPI e obiettivi definiti, che se raggiunti, ti garantiranno la revisione del grade e degli economics.

#WinningRequirements


Laurea in Ingegneria, Informatica, Matematica, Fisica, Data Science
Competenze di base in analisi dei dati, statistiche e metodologie di data mining
Conoscenza dei concetti di organizzazione di un Data Warehouse
Conoscenza di strumenti di analisi dati come Excel, SQL
Conoscenza dei linguaggi di programmazione per l'analisi dei dati (es. Python, R)
Spiccate capacit√† analitiche e attitudine al problem-solving
Propensione al lavoro in team
Ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese
Disponibilit√† a viaggiare in Italia e all‚Äôestero


#NiceToHave


Esperienza su strumenti quali SQL Server, Power BI, Qlik, PowerPlatform
Conoscenza delle principali tecniche di machine learning, deep learning e NLP
Esperienza nell‚Äôutilizzo di librerie di machine learning come Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch, etc.


#LoveWorkingAtDeloitteIf


Vorresti intraprendere una carriera professionale nel mondo della consulenza, dove la parola d‚Äôordine √®: crescita
L‚Äôidea di trasformare un problema in opportunit√† ti stimola
Ti ritieni una persona empatica e quindi disponibile ad accogliere le diverse esigenze dei tuoi colleghi e degli stakeholder interni ed esterni
Ti piacerebbe imparare ad avere una visione progettuale d‚Äôinsieme, tenendo sempre a mente l‚Äôoperativit√† per raggiungere gli obiettivi con integrit√† e rispetto degli standard Deloitte
Ti piace lavorare in un ambiente sfidante in cui le priorit√† possono cambiare quotidianamente
Ami lavorare in team


Si offre inserimento in stage di 6 mesi caratterizzato da un percorso di training ad alto valore formativo.

Sedi di lavoro: Milano o Cagliari

Saranno prese in considerazione tutte le candidature indistintamente, nel rispetto dei nostri valori ed in linea con la nostra cultura inclusiva

#MakeanImpactThatMatters

Deloitte √® un network leader nei servizi professionali alle imprese, presente in oltre 150 Paesi con 457 mila professionisti. Offriamo soluzioni innovative e sostenibili in Audit & Assurance, Strategy, Risk & Transaction Advisory, Tax & Legal e Technology & Transformation. Il nostro obiettivo √® supportare le aziende nello sviluppo e nell'implementazione di strategie al passo con il mercato.

In Deloitte la sostenibilit√† √® un tema centrale. Per questo, attraverso le strategie e le progettualit√† legate alle tematiche Environmental, Social e Governance (ESG), ci impegniamo a promuovere una crescita responsabile, sostenibile e inclusiva per il Pianeta, le nostre persone e la societ√†. Scopri di pi√π sulle nostre strategie di Corporate Sustainability, tra cui Well-being, la strategia volta a migliorare il benessere fisico, mentale e sociale delle nostre persone, affinch√© siano felici e piene di energia in tutti gli ambiti della loro vita e WorldClimate, la strategia globale di Deloitte per diventare un‚Äôorganizzazione Net Zero e per guidare scelte responsabili all‚Äôinterno e all‚Äôesterno dell‚Äôorganizzazione.

Se vuoi scoprire come sar√† il processo di selezione, guarda questo video.

Sei pront* a #MakeAnImpactThatMatter insieme? Candidati ora!

La ricerca rispetta il d.lgs. 198/2006, il D.lgs. 215/03 e il D.lgs. 216/03 ed √® aperta a candidat* di qualsiasi orientamento o espressione di genere, orientamento sessuale, et√†, etnia e credo religioso. Il presente annuncio √® stato ideato nel rispetto della diversity e dell‚Äôinclusivit√†.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
At Scalapay, we‚Äôre shaping a culture with high standards, independent and critical thought, innovation, ownership, and continuous learning. We operate in a fast-moving, tech-driven environment, and we‚Äôre looking for people who thrive in change, think boldly, and take initiative.

If you‚Äôre ready to put your potential to the test in a hiring process designed to spotlight exceptional talent, this is your chance to stand out and grow with one of Europe‚Äôs most ambitious fintech teams.

#MakeItHappen #PlayAsATeam #StayCurious #FocusOnCustomer.

Our data team seeks a Data Analyst who will champion a 'data-first' mindset, ensuring precise measurement and reporting of relevant metrics. This role collaborates closely with Scalapay‚Äôs key Business Units such as Product, Marketing and Sales, employing technical expertise to translate concepts into concrete outcomes.

You will:

  • Serve as the data point of reference for our key Business Units, providing them with necessary support;
  • Use advanced analytical tools to assess and interpret sales and marketing data, measuring the effectiveness of activities and pinpointing areas for improvement;
  • Build and maintain comprehensive reports and dashboards for our teams to facilitate data-driven decision-making;
  • Translate business questions into analytical solutions, providing actionable insights;
  • Ensure accuracy and reliability in measuring key performance indicators (KPIs) and the underlying data;
  • Identify trends, patterns, and areas for improvement in order to propose data-driven recommendations to optimise marketing strategies and sales processes;
  • Conduct hands-on work with data, including data cleansing, transformation, and validation;
  • Help us extend a data-driven mindset throughout Scalapay;
  • Be an active member of the Data team, helping to develop and enhance our suite of Business Intelligence tooling.

You‚Äôll be great for this role if:

  • You have a minimum of 3 years of experience in a data-driven role, ideally with a background in startups or fintech;
  • You have strong SQL skills, Python is a plus;
  • You are proficient in data visualisation tools and data storytelling;
  • You have a background in statistics and can conduct experiments or validate hypotheses;
  • You are fluent in Italian and English: you must be totally confident talking and sharing results in English in a sharp and concise way;
  • You demonstrate outstanding communication skills, both verbally and in writing. You excel at simplifying complex topics into straightforward solutions and ideas;
  • You‚Äôre more than data-driven, you are obsessed with data!

Why you should join Scalapay:

  • Attractive packages based on skills and experience - the salary we have for this position is up to 40'000‚Ç¨ (Gross Annual Base);
  • International environment with significant challenges to be met every day;
  • Lots of opportunities to work with a team of industry tech leaders who are focused on delivering products that offer exceptional user experiences;
  • Personalised support to accelerate your professional growth and take ownership of the products you deliver: we want to help you grow!
  • Latest technologies and being encouraged to bring your flair to the role.

Recruitment Process:

  • Initial Chat: A brief conversation with our Talent Acquisition team;
  • Hiring Manager Interview: A deep dive into your experience and motivation for the role;
  • Case Study: A skills-based test with a debriefing session involving key stakeholders;
  • Final Chat with Simone (CEO): An opportunity to discuss Scalapay‚Äôs values and assess cultural alignment.

Want to learn more? Don't hesitate to explore our Careers website, our LinkedIn and Glassdoor pages.

Pro tip: send your CV in English üòâ

Super Pro tip: we know that application processes can be scary and frustrating but‚Ä¶ we look for talent, not people that tick all our boxes.

We believe in the power of diversity: Scalapay is an Equal Opportunity Employer for any minority, disability, gender identity or sexual orientation.

Title: Junior - Data Analyst
Description:
The chance to build a better future is right in front of you

Do Work That Matters - Il tuo ruolo e le tue responsabilit√†

Vuoi fare un lavoro che sia davvero significativo e di impatto? In KPMG avrai l‚Äôopportunit√† di aiutare i clienti, la societ√†, le colleghe e i colleghi ad affrontare e risolvere le sfide pi√π attuali e complesse

Il Digital Assurance Team √® un team all‚Äôavanguardia di KPMG in cui diverse competenze collaborano per dare forma alla digitalizzazione del futuro dei servizi di assurance e revisione contabile. A vrai l‚Äôopportunit√† di lavorare a fianco di revisori esperti sviluppando, attraverso la formazione interna ma soprattutto il training on the job, la capacit√† di analizzare criticamente i processi aziendali a supporto dell‚Äôinformativa finanziaria e i dati elaborati dai sistemi informativi delle societ√† identificando elementi di anomalia ed interpretando le dinamiche alla base dei trend economico-finanziari.

Starting date: Settembre 2025

Tipologia di inserimento: Apprendistato

Ufficio: Milano

Nello specifico ti occuperai di:


Sviluppo di soluzioni di analytics a supporto dei team di audit (transactional analytics, dashboard di analisi di dati contabili, process mining, KPI di processo, ecc)
Sviluppo di tecniche di revisione basate sull‚Äôutilizzo di soluzioni tecnologiche innovative
Supporto ai team nell‚Äôutilizzo delle soluzioni proposte
Cura di eventi di comunicazione volti a far conoscere il progetto / le soluzioni


Come As You Are - Le tue competenze e caratteristiche

Questa opportunit√† √® perfetta per te se:


Hai una formazione di base economico-contabile
Hai spiccato interesse per l‚Äôarea del reporting finanziario e per i data analytics
Hai voglia di imparare e metterti in gioco
Vuoi crescere all‚Äôinterno di un Network Internazionale


Your Future With Us - Cosa troverai in KPMG


Un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, equo e che rispetta, incoraggia e valorizza le diversit√†
Un contesto stimolante e dinamico che incentiva la creativit√† e il lavoro di squadra
Modalit√† di lavoro ibrida, per promuovere un sano equilibrio tra vita lavorativa e personale
Programmi di formazione e sviluppo avanzati per rimanere sempre aggiornati
Mindset internazionale e progettualit√† innovative
Iniziative incentrate sul benessere psicofisico


Together for Better ‚Äì I nostri valori e il nostro impegno

Leadership, lavoro in team, rispetto di ogni individualit√†, approfondimento continuo, trasparenza, impegno verso la comunit√†, integrit√†: questi sono i Valori di KPMG che danno vita a un ambiente aperto allo scambio di idee e di conoscenza, che permette ai nostri professionisti di esprimere tutto il loro potenziale.

Grazie all‚Äôimpegno nel favorire un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, il nostro Network risulta conforme agli standard dei requisiti ISO 30415, sul Sistema di Gestione per la Diversit√† e l‚ÄôInclusione, e UNI PdR 125, relativa alla parit√† di genere.

Unisciti a noi!

I tuoi dati saranno trattati nel pieno rispetto delle disposizioni del Regolamento (UE) n. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - "GDPR") e successive modifiche. Per ulteriori informazioni, consultare l'informativa sulla privacy di KPMG .

KPMG S.p.A. garantisce le pari opportunit√†.

The chance to build a better future is right in front of you

Responsibilities

Do Work That Matters - Your Role and Responsibilities

Do you want to do work that is truly meaningful and impactful? At KPMG, you will have the opportunity to help clients, society, and your colleagues tackle and solve the most current and complex challenges.

The Digital Assurance Team is KPMG‚Äôs innovative team which brings together different skill sets to shape the digitalization of the future for assurance and audit services. You will have the opportunity to work alongside expert auditors ‚Äì through in-house courses and especially on-the-job training ‚Äì developing the ability to critically analyse the company processes used in financial reporting and the information processed by the companies‚Äô IT systems, identifying errors and interpreting the dynamics underlying financial performance.

Starting date: September 2025

Type of contract : Apprenticeship

Office: Milan

Specifically, you will be tasked with:


The development of analytics solutions for audit teams (transactional analytics, dashboards for the analysis of accounting data, process mining, process KPIs, etc.)
The development of audit techniques based on the use of innovative technological solutions
Assistance to the audit teams in using the new solutions
The organization of communication initiatives to raise awareness of the project/solutions.


Skills

Come As You Are - Your Skills and Characteristics

This is the perfect opportunity for you if:


You have a business/accounting background with a degree in business subject
You have a strong interest in financial reporting and data analytics
You have a desire to learn and challenge yourself
You want to grow within an International Network


Your Future With Us - What You Will Find at KPMG


An inclusive and equitable work environment that respects, encourages, and values diversity.
A challenging and dynamic environment that encourages creativity and teamwork. [NL1]
Hybrid work arrangements to promote a healthy work-life balance.
Advanced training and development programs to stay current.
International mindset and innovative projects.
Initiatives focused on physical and mental well-being.


Together for Better ‚Äì Our Values and Commitment

Leadership, teamwork, respect for individuality, continuous learning, transparency, community engagement, integrity: these are the values of KPMG that create an environment open to the exchange of ideas and knowledge, allowing our professionals to express their full potential.

As a result of our commitment to fostering an inclusive work environment, our Network complies with the standards of the ISO 30415 requirements, on the Diversity and Inclusion Management System, and UNI PdR 125, relating to gender equality.

Join us!

Your data will be processed in full compliance with the provisions of Regulation (EU) no. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - ‚ÄúGDPR‚Äù), as amended. For more information, please see KPMG‚Äôs privacy policy .

KPMG S.p.A. is an equal opportunity employer.

Title: JUNIOR DATA ANALYST - GIACOMO MILANO
Description:
Giacomo Milano nasce dal talento visionario e dalla passione per la buona cucina di Giacomo Bulleri, che nel 1958 fonda la Trattoria Da Giacomo, prima insegna di un Gruppo che oggi ne conta 10 tra ristoranti, botteghe e caff√®.

Luoghi unici, ambienti raffinati che accolgono gli ospiti in un salotto, dove farsi coccolare con piatti della tradizione culinaria italiana, preparati con materie prime d‚Äôeccellenza.

Per la nostra sede stiamo cercando un* Junior Data Analyst da inserire nel team Finance, con l‚Äôobiettivo di supportare l‚Äôanalisi dei costi e contribuire, con metodo e visione, al miglioramento continuo delle nostre performance.

Sarai parte di un team che lavora con precisione, passione e spirito collaborativo, a stretto contatto con colleghi e reparti diversi, per costruire ogni giorno un sistema solido, efficiente e trasparente.

Di cosa ti occuperai:


Supporterai la raccolta e l‚Äôaggiornamento dei dati economici dai sistemi gestionali
Collaborerai con il team Finance per generare report e analisi su costi, volumi e tempi
Creerai dashboard per monitorare KPI chiave (saving, tempi di consegna, efficienza operativa)
Lavorerai a stretto contatto con altri reparti per integrare dati e informazioni
Parteciperai alla produzione di analisi ad hoc per la direzione e le funzioni coinvolte



Chi stiamo cercando:


Hai una laurea in Economia, Ingegneria gestionale, Statistica o affini
Ti muovi con agilit√† su Excel e strumenti di analisi dati (Power BI, Google Sheets‚Ä¶)
Hai un occhio attento ai numeri e alle sfumature
Ti piace ragionare, capire, collegare
Sei curios* del mondo della ristorazione, dei suoi ritmi e delle sue logiche
Lavorare in squadra per te √® naturale, e la comunicazione √® uno dei tuoi punti di forza



Cosa offriamo:


Un gruppo motivato, al lavoro sul progetto di sviluppo di un marchio storico
Profonda attenzione al tuo work-life balance
Sistema di welfare aziendale
Sconto dipendenti nei nostri Ristoranti



Come si svolge l‚Äôiter di selezione:


Visioneremo il tuo cv e la lettera di presentazione;
Se la tua candidatura risulter√† in linea con le nostre aspettative, l‚ÄôUfficio Risorse Umane ti contatter√† per fissare un primo incontro.



Qualora il tuo profilo non dovesse risultare in linea con le nostre necessit√† o l‚Äôiter di selezione non dovesse concludersi con successo, sar√† nostra cura ricontattarti per esigenze future che riterremo potenzialmente interessanti per te.

√à possibile inviare la propria candidatura, con autorizzazione al trattamento dei propri dati, in ottemperanza al Regolamento UE 2016/679.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Satispay

Satispay was born to revolutionise everyday payments ‚Äì making them simple, fair, and accessible to everyone. Now, the focus has moved even further, aiming to shape the future of money.

We're a movement empowering millions of people, driven by a shared purpose to tackle big challenges. And we're just getting started. We move quickly, think boldly, and trust each other to challenge the norm, learning and growing as we go.

If you're looking for more than just your next job ‚Äì if you want to build something impactful with a talented team ‚Äì you're in the right place.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing

As a Data Analyst, you‚Äôll play a key role in enhancing our data-driven decision-making and optimizing product and business processes by researching, analyzing, and visualizing data to drive impactful solutions. Here‚Äôs what your day-to-day will look like:


Drive impact ‚Äì By researching and implementing rigorous data-driven solutions that bring concrete value to product and business lines.
Analyze data ‚Äì To interpret datasets, derive actionable insights, and support critical decision-making processes across various teams.
Design experiments ‚Äì To develop and manage A/B tests that optimize and guide product and process enhancements based on measurable results.
Create visualisations ‚Äì To track key metrics and assist in the creation of visual representations (dashboards, maps) for effective communication of analytical insights to stakeholders.
Manage analytic solutions ‚Äì By modernizing, standardizing, troubleshooting, and maintaining existing tools to ensure accuracy and reliability of our data infrastructure.


Expect challenges, collaboration, and the freedom to bring your ideas to life. Things change quickly here, so be ready to adapt, take initiative, and shape your role as we grow.

Who We‚Äôre Looking For

We need a problem-solver with a strong analytical mindset who thrives in a collaborative environment. If you‚Äôre detail-oriented and ready to take ownership in a dynamic setting, you‚Äôll fit right in! Does this sound like you?


Relevant experience ‚Äì 3+ years of experience in Business Intelligence or Data Analytics, demonstrating a strong understanding of data analysis principles.
Strong analytical skills ‚Äì With proven analytical, statistical, and quantitative problem-solving skills to tackle complex data challenges.
Technical proficiency ‚Äì Advanced knowledge of SQL, including query optimization techniques for efficient data retrieval and manipulation.
Programming skills ‚Äì Extensive knowledge of Python or R for statistical analysis, data manipulation, and automation of analytical tasks.
Data visualization skills ‚Äì Experience with Looker, Tableau, or similar visualization tools to create insightful and easily understandable data representations.


Don't worry if you don't tick every box. We believe in the power of different viewpoints and strengths. Your unique perspective is important as we build something special. If you're passionate and can make a difference, we truly encourage you to apply.

Our Benefits & Perks

We believe high commitment, effort, and impact deserve to be highly rewarded and supported. That‚Äôs why we created Satispay CareAbout, our way of making sure you‚Äôre supported in your well-being, growth, and finances:

üë®‚Äçüë©‚Äçüëß CareAbout health & well-being


Unlimited paid time off
Psychological support & mental health webinars with Serenis
Flexible hybrid working system
Extended parental leave
Childcare leave


üìö CareAbout growth & development


Professional development programmes
Internal mobility program
Language classes with Preply
Internal workshops & training


üí∞ CareAbout financial support


Stock Option Plan (with additional grants often provided based on performance)
International relocation support
Competitive salary
Flexible Benefit budget
Meal vouchers


Equal-Opportunity Employer

At Satispay, we're proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and inclusion, welcoming individuals of all backgrounds. This opportunity is open to everyone, regardless - for instance - of race, colour, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, and national origin. Join us in a workplace where everyone belongs!

Learn More About Us

Curious if our way of working clicks with yours? Our values and pillars aren‚Äôt just fancy words on a page - they really shape everything we do. Explore them here.

Sounds like your kind of place? Awesome!

We‚Äôd love to hear your story.

Title: JUNIOR DATA ANALYST
HTML:
Nell'ambito di un ampliamento del nostro team Amministrazione Finanza e Controllo cerchiamo un:

JUNIOR DATA ANALYST

  • Zona: Milano Sede;
  • Disponibilit√† di inserimento: da subito.

Attivit√†

La risorsa lavorer√† a stretto contatto con il Resp. AFC e con il Sales Controller nell‚Äôanalisi dei dati di sell-in e sell- out sapendo commentare in modo critico e strutturato il loro andamento ed in particolare confrontando budget actual e forecast nonch√© le performance operative della forza vendita per fornire utili visioni previsionali.

Dovr√† contribuire positivamente alla strutturazione di un sistema di reporting aziendale settimanale e mensile ed offrire supporto al Team Marketing e Commerciale nel corretto utilizzo e valorizzazione del CRM aziendale.

Requisiti

  • Pregressa esperienza nel ruolo di circa 2 anni, saranno ritenute valide anche candidature provenienti da un‚Äôesperienza di stage;
  • Capacit√† di elaborare informazioni aziendali complesse e di presentarle con sensibilit√† agli stakeholder aziendali;
  • Pensiero analitico e problem-solving, precisione e attenzione ai dettagli, curiosit√† e voglia di imparare, adattabilit√† e flessibilit√†, propensione al lavoro di team;
  • Esperienza pregressa, anche breve, nell'utilizzo di qualsiasi sistema CRM (TrueBlue, Veeva, OCE, Salesforce, ecc.) e nella creazione di dashboard in Power BI.

Si Offre

  • Assunzione a tempo indeterminato;
  • Un percorso di carriera strutturato, volto alla valorizzazione e al potenziamento delle competenze.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst ‚Äì Monitoring & Support (Apprendistato)




Per vincere le sfide del futuro e affrontare al meglio i grandi cambiamenti che stiamo vivendo, Agos vuole investire su persone dotate di entusiasmo, creativit√† e che condividano i nostri valori di INNOVAZIONE, VICINANZA, IMPEGNO, SPIRITO DI SQUADRA E PASSIONE.




Il ruolo

Agos, realt√† leader nel credito al consumo, √® alla ricerca di un giovane talento per potenziare l‚Äôanalisi quantitativa.

Entrerai nella Direzione Crediti, nel team Monitoring & Support della divisione Acceptance, dove sarai affiancato per imparare a monitorare la produzione generata dai partner commerciali, seguire attivit√† progettuali e analizzare i processi di credito in linea con la normativa.

Un'opportunit√† concreta per lavorare con i dati reali del business, approfondire i meccanismi del credito e contribuire direttamente al miglioramento dei processi aziendali. Sarai affiancato da tutor e seguirai un piano formativo che ti porter√† gradualmente e coprire la posizione

Le tue attivit√† principali

Analisi statistica avanzata dei portafogli e dei KPI di credito
Costruzione e gestione di dashboard per il monitoraggio continuo
Query e modellazione quantitativa con SQL, SAS (e, se presente, Python)
Individuazione di segnali critici per azioni preventive/correttive
Trasformazione dei dati in insight strategici per il business




Profilo ideale

Hai una laurea in discipline statistico-economiche, matematiche o affini, e sei appassionato/a di dati, analisi e processi decisionali. Ti piace lavorare in squadra, hai spirito critico e voglia di metterti in gioco.




Competenze richieste

Ottima conoscenza di Excel e costituir√† titolo preferenziale la conoscenza di SAS (preferibile anche Python e SQL)
Conoscenza del pacchetto Office, in particolare Excel e PowerPoint
Capacit√† analitica, precisione e sintesi
Competenze statistiche di base
Buona conoscenza dell‚Äôinglese (min. livello B1)
Ottime doti relazionali, organizzative e orientamento agli obiettivi

¬∑

Cosa offriamo

Contratto di apprendistato CCNL Credito.
Formazione costante e personalizzata con assegnazione di un Tutor.
Modalit√† di lavoro ibrida: 50% in fisico c/o sede di Milano e 50% da remoto.
Mensa aziendale e buoni pasto.
Formazione continua con l‚ÄôAcademy Agos e LinkedIn Learning




Sede di lavoro sita in Milano, Viale Fulvio Testi 280.

I colloqui saranno effettuati in modalit√† remota.







Le persone interessate possono inviare la propria candidatura con autorizzazione ai sensi del dlgs. 196/2003. La ricerca rispetta il d.lgs. 198/2006 ed √® aperta a candidati/e di qualsiasi orientamento o espressione di genere, orientamento sessuale, et√†, etnia e credo religioso. Il presente annuncio √® stato ideato nel rispetto della diversity e dell‚Äôinclusivit√†.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At Mollie, we‚Äôre on a mission to make payments and money management effortless for every business in Europe. We started 20 years ago when we launched a more direct, affordable way for companies to get paid. That provided an alternative to the frustrating, overpriced solutions that banks offered at the time.

Today, we serve more than 250,000 businesses across Europe with an all-in-one solution that simplifies payments and money management. And we‚Äôre a 850-strong team of product, finance, support, commerce, and engineering specialists working across Europe ‚Äì from Lisbon to London.

Your Opportunity

We're looking for an experienced and motivated Data Analyst to lead the analytical efforts of our Real-time Fraud Monitoring Team.

Working within one of Mollie's newest verticals, our team is dedicated to protecting our account holders from financial crimes. We're on the front lines, developing scalable, automated risk decision-making tools that operate in milliseconds. Here, real-time data meets real-world security.

This role isn't just about technical expertise; it's about addressing critical business challenges. You'll use your technical skills to design, build, and optimise intricate data pipelines and analytical solutions for fraud detection. You'll work with Mollie's complex, real-time data flows, transforming raw data into actionable insights that directly combat financial crime and enable swift risk decisions.

You'll play a key role in driving impactful solutions from concept to deployment, partnering closely with our engineering, product, and operations teams to ensure our analytical capabilities are seamlessly integrated. Your efforts will directly contribute to protecting our account holders, turning data into the shield that safeguards our business.

What You‚Äôll Do


Data product development: Build and maintain robust, performant, easy-to-use data products and dashboards to monitor key fraud metrics and help us make decisions
Data analysis & interpretation: Analyse merchant behaviour and transaction data to detect patterns, anomalies, and potential fraud indicators to inform Mollie's risk strategy.
Data visualisation & storytelling: Create compelling data visualisations and narratives to effectively communicate your findings to technical and non-technical audiences using various mediums, e.g. presentations, reports, memos, etc.
Documentation & knowledge sharing: Create and maintain comprehensive documentation for data products, processes, and analyses to facilitate knowledge sharing and onboarding of new team members.
Data quality assurance: Implement data quality checks and processes to ensure the accuracy, completeness, and reliability of data used for analysis and decision-making.
Experimentation & prototyping: Develop and test new analytical approaches and models through experimentation and prototyping to improve fraud detection and risk assessment.


What You Bring


Proven experience in analytics within a complex risk, fintech, or payments environment
Strong technical foundation in SQL and Python; experience with data modelling and automation
Deep understanding of one or more risk areas: fraud, AML/CFT, credit risk
Experience leading analysts or analytics engineers, with a track record of raising the bar
Ability to zoom out and to zoom in to support implementation, often on the same day
Skilled at stakeholder management, especially across technical and non-technical teams
Business-aware, impact-driven, and curious
Show more

Title: HR DATA ANALYST
HTML:
Azienda Trasporti Milanesi S.p.A.

Overview

ATM √® alla ricerca di professionisti appassionati ed innovativi per la nostra Direzione Risorse Umane.

Se desideri lavorare su progetti all'avanguardia e collaborare con un team dinamico, questa √® l'opportunit√† che fa per te.

Principali attivit√†

  • Raccolta, strutturazione, analisi e reporting dei processi e dei dati utili alla funzione Risorse Umane;
  • Utilizzo del sistema informativo per le esigenze di interazione, interrogazione, controllo, simulazione di interesse della funzione;
  • Elaborazione periodica della reportistica HR per le societ√† del Gruppo (forza, budget, assenteismo, straordinari, mobilit√† orizzontale/verticale, ecc.);
  • Analisi dati relativi al personale;
  • Sviluppo e monitoraggio di indicatori HR relativi al personale.

Requisiti richiesti

  • Laurea in ambito economico, informatico, statistico o affini;
  • Ottima dimestichezza dei programmi Office ed in particolare conoscenza avanzata di MS Excel, MS Access o altri sistemi di gestione dei dati;
  • Conoscenza moduli SAP HR - HCM;
  • Buona conoscenza di SQL, programmi utili per lo sviluppo di reportistica e creazione dashboard ad-hoc;
  • Capacit√† di gestire informazioni confidenziali in modo professionale;
  • Capacit√† di operare su scadenze predefinite mantenendo una forte attenzione al dettaglio e agli obiettivi;
  • Costituisce titolo preferenziale avere operato in ambito HR in aziende strutturate o avere una esperienza pregressa in ruolo analogo.

Cosa troverai

Formazione e Sviluppo: investiamo nella crescita professionale e nello sviluppo di competenze dei nostri colleghi, attraverso programmi di induction, formazione continua e iniziative di learning ad hoc proposte dal nostro Campus Formazione ATM.

Ambiente di Lavoro: operiamo in un settore dinamico e in forte cambiamento, che ci stimola a garantire e innovare un servizio fondamentale per la Citt√† di Milano e non solo! Promuoviamo un ambiente lavorativo ispirato dall‚Äôimpronta dei nostri valori: Passione, Cura, Inclusione, Innovazione e Sostenibilit√†.

Wellbeing: ‚ÄúNoi siamo ATM‚Äù, il programma che racchiude numerose iniziative di welfare aziendale, tra cui assistenza sanitaria integrativa, servizi di counseling, campagne di screening, piattaforma flexible benefit, oltre 250 convenzioni per beni di consumo, tempo libero, servizi finanziari e molto altro.

Modalit√† di lavoro: smart working, flessibilit√† di orario in ingresso e in uscita.

Opportunit√† di Carriera: studiamo percorsi di carriera per i nostri talenti, che si concretizzano in opportunit√† di crescita interna o di job rotation interdipartimentale.

__________________________________

Costituiscono inoltre titoli preferenziali il possesso dei requisiti di cui all'art. 1 o l'appartenenza alle categorie protette di cui all'art. 18 della legge 68/99.

Il rapporto di lavoro sar√† regolato dal R.D. 148/1931 e dal CCNL Autoferrotranvieri.

Title: Business Data Analyst | AdKaora
HTML:
AdKaora


AdKaora √® una digital company del Gruppo Mondadori, leader nell‚Äôinnovazione mobile, che offre strumenti e soluzioni efficaci in ottica multicanale ai brand e ai publisher per raggiungere, coinvolgere e influenzare il proprio target, portando risultati concreti e misurabili.


AdKaora √® una digital company leader nell‚Äôinnovazione. Offriamo strumenti e soluzioni multicanale efficaci per brand e publisher, mirati a raggiungere, coinvolgere e influenzare il target, ottenendo risultati concreti e misurabili.


AdKaora Value Network √® la nostra innovativa concessionaria pubblicitaria, che fa dell'innovazione tecnologica il suo cavallo di battaglia. Con oltre 1500 partner globali, realizziamo e proponiamo al mercato formati pubblicitari innovativi, utilizzati dai pi√π grandi publisher italiani e internazionali.



Di cosa ti occuperai

Stiamo cercando una/un Business Data Analyst che voglia essere una figura chiave nell‚Äôanalisi dei dati di business. In questo ruolo contribuirai in modo attivo alla definizione delle strategie aziendali, interpretando dati complessi provenienti da media, digital marketing e finance. Ti occuperai di:


  • analisi avanzata dei dati provenienti da campagne media, mobile, web e proximity, con l‚Äôobiettivo di monitorare performance e individuare insight strategici;
  • sviluppo di reportistica automatizzata e dashboard interattive per i team interni (Sales, Product, Marketing) e per i clienti, utilizzando strumenti come Power BI, Tableau o Looker;
  • definizione e monitoraggio dei KPI di business legati a campagne advertising e customer behavior, con focus su conversioni, engagement e ROI;
  • integrazione e pulizia dei dati provenienti da fonti eterogenee (DMP, DSP, CRM, piattaforme di advertising, SDK di terze parti);
  • collaborazione con il team tecnico e di prodotto per strutturare flussi di dati ottimizzati e supportare progetti di data governance e tracking;
  • supporto alla definizione di modelli predittivi o segmentazioni comportamentali con tecniche statistiche avanzate (machine learning opzionale);
  • produzione di analisi ad hoc su esigenze strategiche interne o richieste cliente, con capacit√† di sintesi e storytelling data-driven.



Il tuo profilo

Professionalmente hai:

  • Laurea in Statistica, Economia, Matematica, Ingegneria gestionale o discipline affini.
  • almeno 5 anni di esperienza come Business Data Analyst;
  • Conoscenza avanzata di strumenti di analisi dati e BI (Excel, SQL, Google Analytics, Google BigQuery, Power BI, Looker, etc. )
  • competenze avanzate del pacchetto Office (in particolare Excel);
  • Competenza in ambito di lettura dei principali indicatori economico-finanziari;
  • capacit√† di lavorare in team cross-funzionali (marketing, sales, finance);
  • ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese (parlata e scritta);
  • mentalit√† data-driven, precisione e curiosit√† intellettuale.


Plus

  • Esperienza in agenzie digitali o in contesti adtech/martech;
  • conoscenza di linguaggi di programmazione statistica (Python, R);
  • familiarit√† con ambienti cloud (GCP, AWS).



Cosa ti offriamo

  • Inquadramento e retribuzione commisurati in base alla tua esperienza;
  • Possibilit√† di smartworking, buoni pasto nei giorni di presenza in sede, accesso al welfare e a tutti i servizi aziendali.


Sede di lavoro: Via San Gregorio 1, Milano


Siamo felici di ricevere candidature da profili diversi per genere, et√† e cultura, perch√© crediamo nelle pari opportunit√†, ma ancor pi√π nel valore aggiunto che ogni individuo, con la propria unicit√†, pu√≤ apportare al nostro Gruppo.

(Il presente annuncio √® rivolto ad entrambi i sessi, ai sensi delle leggi 903/77 e 125/91 e a persone di tutte le et√† e tutte le nazionalit√†, ai sensi dei decreti legislativi 215/03 e 216/03)

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
Seniority Level:

Role Overview

We are seeking a motivated and curious Data Analyst Intern to join our Operations team and help us build and enhance reporting, dashboards, and analytical tools across our logistics and supply chain operations. You‚Äôll work closely with regional leaders in Commercial, Sales and Logistics to support visibility, identify inefficiencies, and enable data-driven decisions in a dynamic, multinational environment.

Key Responsibilities


Support the design, development, and automation of operational reports and KPIs across countries
Analyze logistics performance data (e.g., transportation, warehousing, order fulfillment)
Create dashboards (Power BI or Excel-based) that provide actionable insights for the operations team
Partner with supply chain, planning, and logistics stakeholders to gather requirements and deliver solutions
Support ad hoc analysis and deep dives into operational bottlenecks or cost drivers
Identify opportunities to streamline data processes and improve data accuracy


What We‚Äôre Looking For


Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs student in Engineering, Business Analytics, Statistics, Data Science, or related field
Strong analytical and problem-solving mindset
Solid skills in Excel (advanced functions, pivot tables, etc.)
Familiarity with Power BI or other dashboarding tools will help a lot
Basic knowledge of SQL is a big plus
Strong communication skills and ability to collaborate in an international team
Proactive attitude, willingness to learn, and ability to work independently

Title: Data analyst
Description:
Dentsu Creative is a global creative agency network designed to unlock exponential growth for clients. We use Transformative Creativity as a differentiating, driving force to bring our capabilities together to positively impact people, business and society.

Established in 2022, Dentsu Creative is integrated with dentsu‚Äôs Media and CXM businesses in over 145 countries and regions, to offer Integrated Growth Solutions.




We are looking for a Data Analyst to be employed in our Milan office.




Role Description




We are looking for Data Analyst with boundless curiosity and a deep passion for data and innovation. Someone who not only sees the numbers, but also understands the people behind them ‚Äî a professional who blends analytical rigor with a humanistic lens on the world.




As a Data Analyst within Dentsu Creative‚Äôs award-winning strategy team, you will dive deep into numbers to decode what‚Äôs really happening around us. With a sharp analytical eye and the ability to see connections beyond the numbers, you read and interpret data to uncover the forces shaping culture, behaviours, and brands ‚Äî turning complex information into clear, strategic insights that inspire bold and impactful thinking and creativity.




You will work closely with all the Dentsu Creative verticals (Brand Strategy, Advertising, Events, Luxury, Gaming, Social, Influencer Marketing, and more) as a true 360¬∫ expert of consumer, industry and cultural trends & insights, developing insights and point of views for some of the biggest Global and Italian brands.

From insight reports to sweeping innovation projects, we're looking for someone who‚Äôs curious about the world ‚Äî someone who questions assumptions, challenges conventions, and uses data to reframe challenges and find unexpected answers.




Key Responsibilities




Analyze and present reports on digital and social performance, turning data into clear, actionable insights.
Conduct social listening analysis to identify conversation patterns, audience and brand insight.
Support the design and development of ad hoc surveys to uncover strategic insights and inform brand decision-making.
Monitor key trends and shifts, providing analysis that supports teams across dentsu with culturally informed thinking.
Help develop analysis packages for clients, supporting the creation of tailored research proposals in collaboration with different Dentsu teams.




Who we are looking for




Strategic thinker with a strong analytical mindset and a deep curiosity constantly exploring trends, conducting desk research, and scouting for cultural signals and emerging behaviors.
Skilled at translating complex datasets into clear, actionable insights that inform creative thinking and shape brand relevance ‚Äî both for people and algorithms.
Strong communicator who knows how to get to the point ‚Äî making data feel accessible, relevant, and compelling in both written and spoken form.
Proficient in PowerPoint, with the ability to craft presentations that inform, persuade, and guide strategic decisions.
Collaborative and proactive, with a strong sense of ownership and a habit of going beyond task execution to find smarter solutions.
Strong team player with a talent for listening, mediation, and leading teams and clients with clear, substantiated rationales.
Comfortable working across data tools and platforms, with advanced Excel skills (formulas, pivot tables, worksheets).
Fluent in Italian (written and spoken) and fluent in written English ‚Äî good spoken English is a strong plus.
Bonus: experienced in data visualization, presenting insights in elegant, visually engaging formats.




Skills & Experience




2+ Years of proven experience with data and reporting
Skilled in processing and managing data through Excel and pivot tables
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, combined with strong expertise in data visualization and presentation
Obsessive attention to detail
Ability to effectively balance high quality with strict deadlines
Team working and collaborative attitude
Self-motivation and a problem-solving attitude
Your mother tongue is Italian, but you‚Äôre fluent in English
Proficiency with data & analytics platforms (e.g. Brandwatch) is a plus




Working with us




Joining Dentsu Creative, you will be part of a creative network, delivering ideas that are brought alive in new ways. Along the way, you will team up with inspiring people across the world and become part of a truly inclusive culture where everyone is given the opportunity to thrive and create the best work of their careers; always learning and always listening to shape ideas, create culture and change behaviour. By bringing together the capabilities, experience and relationships of our collective experts, the opportunities for personal growth and development are endless.




We are united by four signature strengths:




Boundless Creativity ‚Äì Kitsune Fox: In Japanese culture ‚Äì the Kitsune Fox sees the future. We run towards the future, forever asking: what‚Äôs next? Our imagination has no limit. Our clients seek us out because we believe there is no problem we cannot solve with the power of modern creativity.




Intelligent Scale - Ryujin Dragon: The Ryujin Dragon controls the ocean and the tides. We flow the right talent around the right brief in the right moment, wherever it sits in the world. We scale our unique ideas with precision, using intelligent technology to make personal connections with millions around the world.




Obsessive Craft - Orizuru Crane: The Orizuru Crane carries the soul up to paradise. It inspires the most classic and iconic Japanese origami. We elevate the soul of our work with an obsessive focus on craft, nurturing the next-gen craft skills needed to soar in a modern world.




Radical Collaboration - Kohaku Koi: The Koi swim upstream against the tide, united as one. We chart new territory through the power of radical collaboration. We seamlessly connect Creativity, Media and CXM to imagine new solutions at the intersection of craft, data, culture, and innovation.




Our Values




We believe our work can only resonate in the modern world if the people behind it reflect the modern work. We can only be truly relevant when we create a truly inclusive culture where everyone can thrive. That means ‚Äì we are tough on the work but gentle with each other. We lead with empathy and are always listening and always learning. We support each other, we cheer for each other, we win together. We celebrate difference as the only way to make the work that makes a difference.

We believe our work can only resonate in the modern world if the people behind it reflect the modern work. We can only be truly relevant when we create a truly inclusive culture where everyone can thrive. That means ‚Äì we are tough on the work but gentle with each other. We lead with empathy and are always listening and always learning. We support each other, we cheer for each other, we win together. We celebrate difference as the only way to make the work that makes a difference.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Join FrieslandCampina as a Business Intelligence Specialist ‚Äì Agrate Office

At FrieslandCampina, we‚Äôre more than a global dairy company ‚Äî we‚Äôre a purpose-driven organization committed to nourishing the world with high-quality, nutritious products. With over 18,000 employees across 100+ countries, we are united by a passion for innovation, sustainability, and excellence.

We‚Äôre currently looking for a Business Intelligence Specialist to join our team in Agrate. If you're passionate about turning data into actionable insights that make a real impact across departments, this is your opportunity to be a strategic partner in a business that values smart decisions and data-led growth.

What We Ask

What You Bring

To succeed in this role, you‚Äôll bring both technical depth and business acumen. We‚Äôre looking for someone who has:


A Master‚Äôs degree in Applied Sciences, Economics, Statistics, or a related field.
Three to Five years of proven experience in a Business Intelligence or Data Analytics role.
Advanced Excel skills and hands-on experience with SQL and Python.
Expertise in building and maintaining data models.
Strong communication skills in English ‚Äî able to simplify complex data for various stakeholders.
A proactive, detail-oriented mindset and a collaborative approach to problem-solving.



What We Offer

We believe in supporting our people to do their best work. Here‚Äôs what you can expect:


A competitive salary based on your experience and skills .
A hybrid working model that supports work-life balance.
Lunch vouchers and practical benefits that make a difference in your day-to-day.
Access to in-house training and continuous learning opportunities.
A collaborative, inclusive culture rooted in respect, diversity, and sustainability.



Vacancy Description

In this dynamic role, you‚Äôll collaborate closely with teams across Sales, Marketing, Supply Chain, and Finance, using your expertise to transform complex datasets into clear, decision-driving insights.

You will:


Collect, clean, and analyze data from multiple sources to identify trends and opportunities.
Build intuitive dashboards and visualizations using tools like Power BI or Tableau.
Design and maintain data models that support strategic planning and operational excellence.
Provide actionable recommendations that guide business decisions across the organization.
Champion data quality, governance, and standardization across systems and teams.
Stay ahead of the curve by identifying new BI tools, trends, and best practices.



Staying true to who you really are, that is your starting point at FrieslandCampina. Because it is precisely by embracing our differences that we can grow together. We want to create a working environment that allows all employees to bring their best and authentic selves. If who we are suits you, but you're not sure if you're the best fit for the role, we still encourage you to apply so we can help you find the role that fits you best.

Team Details

Why FrieslandCampina?

FrieslandCampina is a unique employer ‚Äî our farmer-owned cooperative model empowers us to prioritize people, planet, and profit equally. We foster a culture of equality and inclusion, where every voice matters and every individual can thrive. We are constantly evolving, embracing innovation, and working toward a sustainable future ‚Äî together.

Title: Data Warehouse Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Fineco Bank is a leading European bank with a 20 years history and a fully digital DNA with a branchless approach since the start. Fineco is one of the banks with the widest products range available. We have developed a truly one-stop-solution which includes trading, investment and payment services. We have developed a 100% proprietary platform for trading and investment which covers all customer needs from trading listed and OTC product to investment product such as mutual funds and ETF. In addition to this we also offer banking and payment solution for domestic and international demand.

Position

La funzione ICT sviluppa e gestisce le applicazioni software e l'infrastruttura tecnologica della Banca. Promuove la razionalizzazione in azienda di tutti i processi di lavoro, a supporto delle linee di business, tramite la rilevazione delle esigenze di servizi informatici e promozione delle opportunit√† tecnologiche offerte dall'evoluzione del sistema informativo.

Descrizione dell'attivit√†

Inserita all'interno dell'area Data Warehouse, la persona da noi ricercata sar√† chiamata a svolgere le seguenti attivit√†:


Analizzare le esigenze degli utenti interni in termini di reporting e analisi.
Esplicitare i fabbisogni informativi.
Disegnare e implementare le procedure di integrazione dati dai sistemi alimentanti.
Definire e implementare i reports e le analisi sui dati.



Requirements


Laurea in Ingegneria Informatica, Informatica o Statistica/Matematica.
Interesse verso le tematiche di modellazione dati, sviluppo e gestione database, business intelligence.
Conoscenza di almeno un database fra MS SQL Server, MS Access, Oracle, Sybase, MySQL.



Costituiscono Titolo Preferenziale


Esperienza con Analysis Services (SSAS).
Conoscenza di un qualche tool di business intelligence (per esempio PowerBI).



Si desidera entrare in contatto con persone che si distinguono per le ottime capacit√† relazionali, affidabilit√† ed autonomia organizzativa.

Completano il profilo una forte determinazione ed orientamento al risultato, una personalit√† vivace e proattiva, con ottime capacit√† organizzative e doti di riservatezza e affidabilit√†.

Other information

Sede di lavoro: Milano (alternanza presenza in sede e smart working)

Tipo di contratto: CCNL credito, tempo indeterminato

Il Gruppo Fineco √® orgoglioso di essere un Equal Opportunity Employer e si impegna a creare un ambiente di lavoro sicuro e inclusivo, fondato sul rispetto reciproco e la valorizzazione di qualsiasi diversit√†, offrendo pari opportunit√† di lavoro. Fineco ‚ÄúThe Place To Be‚Äù

Title: Customer Data Analyst
HTML:
Trasforma le tue aspirazioni professionali in una storia di successo, entra in PwC come:

Customer Data Analyst

Your Perspectives

Ti unirai al gruppo di Customer Transformation di PwC su sfidanti progetti di Customer Advance Analytics e Data Science in ambito Consumer Markets, Financial Services, Energy&Utilities e Telco&Media, per supportare le organizzazioni nel valorizzare il patrimonio informativo sulla propria clientela, utilizzando i dati a disposizione per sviluppare soluzioni innovative basate su Machine Learning.

Grazie all‚Äôaccesso alle vaste competenze del nostro network internazionale, potrai dare spazio alle tue idee e fornire il contributo innovativo che hai sempre desiderato.

Sarai coinvolto con crescenti responsabilit√† nelle seguenti attivit√†:

  • Disegno, sviluppo, test e misurazione delle performance di modelli di Machine Learning e di modelli statistici in ambito Marketing: segmentazioni, Customer scoring, modelli di classificazione, modelli predittivi, modelli di propensione/raccomandazione;
  • Analisi dati avanzate sul comportamento della clientela sia su canale fisico che digitale attraverso esplorazione di dati strutturati e destrutturati, al fine di derivare insight di business;
  • Sviluppo di analisi quantitative e modelli di Machine Learning a supporto di progettualit√† di data-driven Strategy & Decision Making;
  • Attivit√† di targeting evoluto e valutazione quantitativo-statistica delle campagne di Marketing;
  • Raccolta dei requisiti progettuali a diretto contatto con la clientela per il disegno e l‚Äôelaborazione di soluzioni data-driven;

Your unique strengths

  • Stai concludendo o hai concluso il percorso di studi o possiedi una laurea magistrale preferibilmente ad indirizzo scientifico (es. Data Science, Informatica, Statistica, Matematica, Fisica);
  • Hai un‚Äôottima conoscenza di almeno uno tra i linguaggi Python ed R;
  • Possiedi una buona conoscenza dei database relazionali e del linguaggio SQL;
  • Hai forti competenze analitiche e ti interessa usare i dati per trovare soluzioni funzionali, creative ed innovative a problemi complessi;
  • Parli e scrivi in inglese fluentemente;
  • Ti interessa lavorare in team e crescere in un ambiente di lavoro stimolante e positivo;
  • Sei flessibile e hai forte motivazione ad intraprendere una carriera professionale in consulenza;


Saranno considerate un plus, le conoscenze, anche a livello base di:

  • Framework Spark e piattaforme Cloud come Amazon Web Services, Azure e Google Cloud Platform;
  • Artificial Intelligence in ambito Speech Analytics, Natural Language Processing o Computer Vision;

Set your expectation higher:  

Il tuo talento e la tua curiosit√† avranno tutto lo spazio che meritano e, attraverso l‚Äôidentificazione delle migliori risorse, contribuirai a garantire la qualit√† dei servizi che offriamo ai nostri clienti. In questo percorso di crescita sarai accompagnato da colleghi esperti e da una formazione continua e su misura grazie alla quale potrai mettere le tue competenze a disposizione dei clienti interni.  
  

 Feel at home:  

 Ci prendiamo cura delle nostre persone mettendole nelle condizioni di crescere ed esprimere al meglio il proprio potenziale. Ci impegniamo a creare valore per i clienti, le persone e la comunit√†, nel rispetto dell'ambiente.  

 

GIVE YOUR LIFE A DIFFERENT PERSPECTIVE

Title: Business & Data Analyst
HTML:
Dove lavorerai

Per la nostra sede di Milano cerchiamo candidati interessati ad un percorso professionale all'interno della Direzione Generation & Energy Management.

Su cosa lavorerai

La persona che stiamo cercando avr√† la responsabilit√† per le seguenti attivit√†:

  • analizzare i dati;
  • identificare inefficienze di processo;
  • proporre soluzioni e monitorare i progressi;
  • collaborazione con le altre aree di business nei progetti di sviluppo di modelli, strumenti e applicazioni volti al continuo miglioramento dei processi.

Cosa pu√≤ esserti utile per valutare se candidarti

  • Laurea in Informatica, Economia, Ingegneria materie STEM;
  • Perfetta conoscenza del pacchetto Office;
  • Gradita la conoscenza di strumenti di programmazione (R, Python, Qlik, ...);
  • Conoscenza dell‚Äôinglese;
  • Spirito di iniziativa;
  • Capacit√† di lavoro in team;
  • Ottime capacit√† relazionali.

La tua sede di lavoro

Lavorerai nel nostro HQs di Milano in Via A. Algardi 4 insieme al resto del tuo team di riferimento. Ci impegniamo a favorire il tuo work-life balance e quindi avrai la possibilit√†, se lo desideri, di lavorare anche in modalit√† ibrida organizzandoti con il tuo team.

Sorgenia

Nati nel 1999, siamo una Green Tech Energy Company e oggi il principale operatore energetico privato nazionale.

Scopri di pi√π su Sorgenia su www.sorgenia.it.

Cosa significa far parte di Sorgenia

Cerchiamo nuovi colleghi che, con spirito pionieristico e innovativo, siano pronti a gestire con proattivit√† e concretezza progetti sfidanti contribuendo alla continua crescita di Sorgenia.

In Sorgenia offriamo l‚Äôopportunit√† di imparare ogni giorno attraverso percorsi di formazione continua e eventi interni informali; siamo attenti al benessere delle nostre persone e per questo offriamo flessibilit√† oraria, smart working e una palestra aziendale se vuoi tenerti in forma.

Se vuoi scoprire cos‚Äôaltro offriamo in Sorgenia, candidati, non vediamo l‚Äôora di conoscerti!

Il presente annuncio √® rivolto ad entrambi i sessi, ai sensi del decreto legislativo 11 aprile 2006 n. 198 ‚ÄúCodice delle pari opportunit√† tra uomo e donna‚Äù e a persone di tutte le et√† e nazionalit√†, ai sensi della Direttiva 2000/78/CE ‚ÄúParit√† di trattamento in materia di occupazione‚Äù

Title: Junior Finance/Data Analyst
Description:
Fler is on a full-time mission to reshape the way consumer goods are perceived with the customer and the experience in focus. We are an innovative and fast-growing startup that wants to innovate the shaving and body-care industry and that loves to break today's standards.




We are currently looking for a Junior Finance / Data Analyst to support our financial planning and performance analysis efforts. In this role, you will transform raw data into valuable insights, helping the team make informed, fast decisions across the business landscape.




To apply, please complete the form at the link below ‚Äì it is a mandatory step of our hiring process. Candidates who do not submit the form will not be considered.




üëâ https://flerworld.typeform.com/to/O1815jD0


Tasks



Support the development of comprehensive monthly reports and detailed performance analysis, including but not limited to P&L, cash flow, and product margins, ensuring accuracy and timeliness in all financial documentation.


Organize, clean, and validate data gathered from various internal sources, and build insightful dashboards using tools such as Google Sheets, Excel, and Looker Studio to facilitate data-driven decision-making.


Analyze performance metrics across products, channels, and campaigns to identify trends and opportunities for optimization.


Contribute to the development of internal and investor reporting materials, ensuring clarity and precision in all communications.


Assist in translating complex bookkeeping data into actionable operational insights and accurate forecasts, aiding strategic planning.


Collaborate closely with marketing, retail, and product teams to support informed business decisions, leveraging financial insights to drive growth and efficiency.



Requirements



Degree in Economics, Statistics, Engineering, or related field


Analytical thinker, strong with numbers and spreadsheets


Curious, tech-savvy, and eager to learn new tools


Detail-oriented, proactive, and organized


Hands-on self-starter comfortable with fast turnarounds


Bonus: familiarity with SQL, Google BigQuery, or data visualization tools



Benefits


Our philosophy is simple: we dream big, move fast and enhance each other's talents. As a brand, we are only as strong as the people who surround us. In this role you will:





Work on real business analysis from day one, with tangible impact


Collaborate across functions in a fast-paced, purpose-driven environment


Join an incredible early-stage company where your decisions have immediate impact





To apply, please complete the form at the link below ‚Äì it is a mandatory step of our hiring process. Candidates who do not submit the form will not be considered.




üëâ https://flerworld.typeform.com/to/O1815jD0




If we believe there‚Äôs a potential match and your form meets our expectations, you will be contacted within 10 days for the next step of the process. We review every submission with care ‚Äî thank you for your time and interest in Fler!

  • Degree in Economics, Statistics, Engineering, or related field

  • Analytical thinker, strong with numbers and spreadsheets

  • Curious, tech-savvy, and eager to learn new tools

  • Detail-oriented, proactive, and organized

  • Hands-on self-starter comfortable with fast turnarounds

  • Bonus: familiarity with SQL, Google BigQuery, or data visualization tools


Benefits

Our philosophy is simple: we dream big, move fast and enhance each other's talents. As a brand, we are only as strong as the people who surround us. In this role you will:



  • Work on real business analysis from day one, with tangible impact

  • Collaborate across functions in a fast-paced, purpose-driven environment

  • Join an incredible early-stage company where your decisions have immediate impact


To apply, please complete the form at the link below ‚Äì it is a mandatory step of our hiring process. Candidates who do not submit the form will not be considered.


üëâ https://flerworld.typeform.com/to/O1815jD0


If we believe there‚Äôs a potential match and your form meets our expectations, you will be contacted within 10 days for the next step of the process. We review every submission with care ‚Äî thank you for your time and interest in Fler!

Title: Junior Analyst CS
Description:
Job Description

ABOUT THIS JOB

NielsenIQ works with clients to provide insights, thought leadership to drive their business and grow their portfolios. Our work helps our clients set growth strategies and determines what products you ultimately see on the shelf. Our team members are experts across various categories and are viewed as trusted partners by our clients. Analysts within the Customer Success Team are responsible for the execution of projects with limited supervision by compiling, analyzing, and interpreting sales data, writing client reports, and constructing presentations, and are expected to manage client relationships independently.

Responsibilities


Summarizes data in tables, charts, and graphs; analyzes and interprets sales data and consumer data + basic portfolio knowledge. Occasionally sets-up and refreshes cyclical reports
Prepares and delivers quantitative analysis and presentations (category overview as well as issue based) building a story and finalizing conclusions and proposes recommendations. Proposes calculation of Quantified Business Opportunity
Uses internal tools and data sources, coaching Interns and Juniors
Discusses advanced quantitative analysis design to best answer client questions with Client Business Partner/client with the support of senior team members, following and fully owning Center of Excellence (COE) ways of working process
Autonomously interacts with client staff both on basic client needs; leads client meetings and presentations over the phone and in person
Acts in line with the Service level of the client assigned
Catches sales opportunities at client meetings/during quantitative analysis and alerts CBP


Requirements


1/2 years of strong client-facing and communication/presentation experience ‚Äì deliver research results to stakeholders on the client‚Äôs side in a clear, consistent manner
Good analytical skills, ability to interpret sales and consumer data
Ability to work in a Team within a dynamic environment
Good interpersonal skills
Organizational skills: understanding of business priorities; ability to adapt to complex and changing organization; ability to manage time schedules
Passionate in FMCG and client dynamics
Good project management skills, specifically for SPOC or Champion roles
Interested in financial and business environment of the clients and the industry
Full proficiency in PowerPoint & Excel
Italian: Mother Tongue or Fluent, written and spoken
English: Fluent, written and spoken


What we can offer:


Work in dynamic environment engaging with local and global companies.
Benefits & flexible working hours, hybrid work options.
Internal trainings will be provided together with detailed onboarding agenda.
Access to learning platforms
Staff and team events


Additional Information

Our Benefits


Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


About NIQ

NIQ is the world‚Äôs leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights‚Äîdelivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms‚ÄîNIQ delivers the Full View‚Ñ¢. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world‚Äôs population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion

Title: Transport Data Analyst
Description:
Before you apply to a job, select your language preference from the options available at the top right of this page.

Explore your next opportunity at a Fortune Global 500 organization. Envision innovative possibilities, experience our rewarding culture, and work with talented teams that help you become better every day. We know what it takes to lead UPS into tomorrow‚Äîpeople with a unique combination of skill + passion. If you have the qualities and drive to lead yourself or teams, there are roles ready to cultivate your skills and take you to the next level.

Job Description

Descrizione del ruolo:

Siamo alla ricerca di un/a Transport Data Analyst appassionato/a e preciso/a, che supporti il nostro team logistico attraverso l‚Äôanalisi e l‚Äôinterpretazione dei dati relativi al trasporto. Il/La candidato/a ideale utilizzer√† dati quantitativi per ottimizzare le operazioni di trasporto, migliorare i tempi di consegna e ridurre i costi, contribuendo ad implementare l‚Äôefficienza aziendale.

Responsabilit√† Principali


Raccogliere, consolidare ed analizzare dati relativi a spedizioni, percorsi, tempi di consegna e costi di trasporto
Effettuare analisi predittive dei volumi, in base alle stagionalit√†, per stabilire i mezzi e gli autisti necessari per il trasporto
Sviluppare report e dashboard per monitorare KPI logistici (es. puntualit√†, utilizzo mezzi, costi per spedizione) e per la condivisione dei dati nelle business reviews
Supportare il team operativo e di pianificazione con insight basati sui dati per ottimizzare rotte e carichi
Collaborare con il management per implementare le modifiche necessarie a raggiungere la riduzione dei costi e il miglioramento del servizio desiderati
Individuare criticit√† e proporre soluzioni data-driven per migliorare l‚Äôefficienza del trasporto, attraverso simulazioni e dati previsionali


Requisiti


Laurea in Statistica, Matematica, Economia, Ingegneria Gestionale o discipline affini.
Esperienza pregressa in ruoli di Data Analysis, preferibilmente nel settore logistico o dei trasporti.
Competenze informatiche avanzate (ottima conoscenza del pacchetto Office con focus su Excel, Power BI - nice to have SQL)
Capacit√† di interpretare grandi volumi di dati e sintetizzare informazioni complesse.
Ottime capacit√† analitiche e problem solving.
Attitudine proattiva e orientata al risultato.
Conoscenza della lingua inglese, almeno B2.


Cosa Offriamo


Ambiente dinamico e in crescita nel settore della logistica.
Opportunit√† di crescita professionale e formazione continua.
Contratto a tempo indeterminato
Buoni Pasto


Per questa posizione non √® previsto smart working.

Employee Type

Permanent

UPS is committed to providing a workplace free of discrimination, harassment, and retaliation.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst Intern
Description:
The Challenge

An exciting opportunity has arisen at Haier Europe. The Company is on a journey to achieve ambitious business growth and leadership objectives in the region, and we need someone who is passionate, proactive, self-driven and motivated to join a team of open-minded individuals.

We are looking for an individual who demonstrates the core values of the Haier‚Äôs attitude: entrepreneurship and innovation, zero distance to consumers and IoT & Ecosystem thinking. A true change agent with an agile approach thriving for idea contamination and with a hyper-collaborative approach that breaks silos and creates an open ecosystem.

What you will do

We are looking for a Marketing Data Analyst Intern to join our team and support the analysis of sales and market performance data. In this role, you will help transform data into actionable insights that support commercial and marketing decision-making. You‚Äôll have the opportunity to work on a wide range of business-relevant topics, from market share trends to pricing and distribution dynamics, across all Product Lines and European markets.

You may also contribute to strategic projects aimed at evaluating marketing effectiveness, including advanced analytical methods and performance tracking.

Key responsibilities:

Analyze market share evolution and sales performance (sell-in/sell-out tracking)
Support distribution and pricing analysis across different markets
Conduct competitor benchmarking and performance comparisons
Assist in the preparation of dashboards and reports for internal stakeholders
Contribute to marketing effectiveness initiatives, such as: Marketing Mix Modeling (MMM), Media performance analysis, KPI tracking across paid, owned, and earned media channels

What you need to succeed

- Neolaureate or student in Statistics, Mathematics, Data Science, Economics, or related field.

- Good knowledge of Microsoft Office proficient user of Excel

- Fluent in Italian and English

We offer a six-month paid internship

800 euro, smart working, free company shuttle, ticket meals

Place of work: Vimercate (MB)

Are you ready to join us?

Title: Financial Data Analyst Trainee
Description:
We are looking for a brilliant and tech-savvy Financial Data Analyst Trainee to join our Milan HQ. The Financial Data Analyst Trainee will support the Manufacturing Controller Team team in ensuring accurate financial and operational data management through advanced reporting, dashboarding, and analytics. He/she will contribute to transforming data into actionable insights to support strategic decisions.

Do you match this profile?


Bachelor/Master‚Äôs degree in Business Analytics and Big Data, possibly with Finance and Economics insights
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel and Power BI; experience with ERP systems (SAP) is a strong plus.
Strong analytical and quantitative skills, with a structured and data-driven mindset
Previous experience (or internship) in Finance, Data Analysis, or similar finance roles with strong exposure to data tools is a strong plus
Ability to manage large datasets and extract business insights through data visualization and storytelling
Proactive, detail-oriented, and eager to work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment
Fluency in Italian and English (spoken and written).


If so, apply for this job!

What do we expect from you?


Contribute to the automation and digitalization of Controlling processes, improving efficiency and data accuracy through data modeling, automated reports and dashboard creation
Deliver ad hoc and structured analysis leveraging data science techniques to identify trends, anomalies, and opportunities.


The Recruitment Process


Apply online
If your profile matches our search, you will be contacted by our HR team for a first exploratory interview. Otherwise, you will receive an e-mail to inform you that we will not proceed with your application.
If the first interview turns out to be successful, you‚Äôll meet the Manufacturing Controlling Manager

  • Individuare opportunit√† strategiche per migliorare customer experience ed efficienza operativa
  • Monitorare i principali indicatori di performance per ottimizzare le strategie di vendita
  • Supportare il team Content Creator nel monitoraggio dell‚Äôandamento del piano editoriale,campagne social e piani di lancio di nuovi prodotti



COME TI IMMAGINIAMO?

  • Hai esperienza pregressa in ruoli similari
