Title: Graduate Data Analyst
Description:
At Bending Spoons, we‚Äôre striving to build one of the all-time great companies. A company that serves a huge number of customers. A company where team members grow to their full potential. A company that functions at unparalleled levels of effectiveness and efficiency. A company that creates value for shareowners at an extraordinary rate. And a company that does so while adhering to high ethical standards.

To achieve this objective, we execute the following strategy: We acquire a digital business with untapped potential and make it as successful as we can by leveraging our platform‚Äîwhich comprises our expertise, technologies, data, brand, talents, and company culture. Then, we invest the proceeds into making our platform more powerful, and into acquiring new businesses. Thus, our strategy sees us combine an investor‚Äôs attention to capital allocation with the hands-on approach of an operator.

For a talented, driven, and collaborative individual, working at Bending Spoons is an opportunity to learn, make an impact, and progress their career at an exceptionally high rate. That‚Äôs our promise to such a candidate.

A few examples of your responsibilities
Collaborate with Product and Business teams to determine the most pressing questions that big data can help answer, and then figure out how to uncover those insights.
Query and analyze massive sets of usage data to identify product-improvement opportunities and actionable insights to profoundly impact our product strategy and roadmap.
Create brief, high-quality reports to explain your findings and discuss their implications with the relevant team members.
Screen the app stores and study competing products in search of insights and ideas we could learn from.
Help direct the development of our technologies devoted to the acquisition, storage, and manipulation of big data, supporting our efforts to constantly break new ground in this field.


What we look for
Reasoning ability. Given the necessary knowledge, you can solve complex problems. You think from first principles, and structure your ideas sharply. You resist the influence of biases. You identify and take care of the details that matter.
Drive. You‚Äôre extremely ambitious in everything you do‚Äîand your initiative, effort, and tenacity match the intensity of your ambition. You feel deeply responsible for your work. You hold yourself to a high‚Äîand rising‚Äîbar.
Team spirit. You give generously and without the expectation of receiving in return. You support the best idea, not your idea. You're always happy to get your hands dirty to help your team. You‚Äôre reliable, honest, and transparent.
Proficiency in English. You read, write, and speak proficiently in English.


What we offer
Incredibly talented, entrepreneurial teams. You‚Äôll work in small, result-oriented, autonomous teams alongside some of the brightest people in your field.
An exceptional opportunity for growth. We go to great lengths to hire individuals of outstanding potential‚Äîthen, our priority is to put them in the ideal position to thrive. Spooners in their 20s lead products worth hundreds of millions of dollars. And if you‚Äôve got what it takes, you‚Äôll soon be playing an essential role in major projects, too.
Competitive pay and access to equity in the company. Typically, we offer an individual at the start of their career a salary of ¬£66,779 in the UK and ‚Ç¨63,965 elsewhere. If they possess a few years of relevant experience, the salary on offer tends to be between ¬£110,389 and ¬£149,636 in the UK, and ‚Ç¨105,737 and ‚Ç¨143,330 elsewhere. Pay grows rapidly as you accumulate experience and translate it into greater impact. You can also receive some of your pay in company equity at a discounted price, thus participating in the value creation we achieve together. If relocating to Italy, you may enjoy a 50% tax cut.
All. These. Benefits. Flexible hours, remote working, unlimited backing for learning and training, top-of-the-market health insurance, a rich relocation package, generous parental support, and a yearly retreat to a stunning location. We help each Spooner set up the conditions to do their best work.


Commitment & contract
Permanent or fixed-term. Full-time or part-time.

Location
Milan (Italy), London (UK).

The selection process
If you pass our screening, we‚Äôll ask you to take on a few tests designed to assess how you approach unfamiliar problems. They‚Äôre challenging and may take several hours to complete. If you‚Äôre successful with those, we‚Äôll invite you to a series of interviews.

We set the bar high and won't extend an offer until we're convinced we've found the right candidate. This is why a job may stay open for months or be reposted several times.

Studies suggest that women tend not to apply for a job if their CV isn‚Äôt a perfect fit. Here, talent takes precedence over experience. So if you like the role and think you could be awesome at it in time, go ahead and apply.

Bending Spoons is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We consider for employment any applicant and provide reasonable accommodations for an individual with disabilities‚Äîjust let us know through this form.

Before you apply
If you‚Äôve applied before but didn't receive an offer, we recommend waiting at least one year before applying again.

Bending Spoons is a demanding environment. We‚Äôre extremely ambitious and we hold ourselves‚Äîand one another‚Äîto a high standard. While this tends to lead to extraordinary learning, achievement, and career growth, it also requires significant commitment.

To help you ramp up quickly and set yourself up for success, we recommend spending your first few months working from our Milan office, regardless of your long-term work location. It‚Äôs the best way to rapidly absorb our company culture and build trust with your new teammates. We‚Äôll support you with generous travel and accommodation assistance. After that, you‚Äôre welcome to work from our offices in Milan or London, or remotely from approved countries‚Äîdepending on what we agree at the offer stage.

If the role speaks to you and you‚Äôre excited to give your best, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Apply now‚Äîwe can‚Äôt wait to meet you.

Title: Planning Data Scientist
Description:
Country: Italy

City: Milan, Piazza Luigi Einaudi 4

Contract Type: Regular

Department: Central Planning

Experience Required: At least 1 year preferred

Mode: Hybrid




Versace is one of the most recognizable names in the world. The luxury House immediately became a leader in fashion and culture following its founding in 1978.

Versace is led by Emmanuel Gintzburger as CEO and the design team is under the leadership of the Chief Creative Officer, Dario Vitale. Donatella Versace remains the Chief Brand Ambassador for Versace since April 1st, 2025.




Your Opportunity:

Within the Demand and Supply planning function based in the HQ in Milan the role will have the responsibility of collecting, processing, and performing statistical analyses on large sets of data, maintaining data flows and the data quality and provide the relevant and most reliable information to all related functions within the areas of Demand Planning and Inventory Planning.




Your Contribution:

Create and implement data models
Present visual data information
Synthesize data and information
Participate in multi-area AI projects in collaboration with other data scientists
Maintain and improve the Demand and Inventory Planning tools ensuring data quality and consistency
Secure reliable actionable databases for the Demand & Inventory Planners
Enrich the variety of data available to the team
Partner with other team members and managers in framing operational problems, conduct mathematical/statistical analysis of exiting operational processes, and validate data-driven solution alternatives.
Analyse and support Demand and Inventory planning processes and operations with the primary objective of increasing efficiency and effectiveness. Gather and process systematic data to support and define consistent and informative quantitative analysis.
Think of, develop, prepare and maintain relevant reports/dashboard/KPI‚Äôs/tools pertaining to Demand and Inventory planning processes
Develop prototype reporting and metrics that evaluate correctly Planning operations, S&OP flow and management system performance. Troubleshoot failures and handle questions and requests on existing reports.
Be the team's point of reference for all development activities of current tools and the introduction of new ones
Develop, support and maintain documentation and standard operating procedures




Your Skills:

Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in statistics, mathematics, engineering, computer data science (Big Data, Analytics and Machine Learning fundamentals) or related subjects
Statistical Knowledge
Data Wrangling
Programming Proficiency: knowledge of programming language like SQL, Python, R etc..
Knowledge of MS Access, Excel and database applications
Understanding business context
Experience with Business Intelligence reporting applications
Strong analytic skills, data mining and quantitative techniques;
Proven analytical and quantitative problem-solving skills
Excellent planning, organizational skills and strong attention to detail
Team building skills with positive attitude to collaboration
Flexible and approachable attitude
Strong organizational and presentation skills to effectively interact with all teams and business levels;
Excellent verbal and written in Italian and English;
Ability to learn quickly and to think creatively;
Proactivity and flexibility, driving sense of urgency;
Continuous improvement mindset;
Results-driven and goal-oriented person;
Experience in Management/Operational consulting and Fashion/Retail companies as a plus







Diversity and inclusion are integral to Versace's DNA. We promote an inclusive environment where employees and customers from diverse backgrounds are welcomed, valued, and celebrated. We take pride in our commitment to diversity, equality, and inclusion, and will continue to uphold these principles wherever we do business. Our doors are open to all.

WE ARE AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER M/D/F

Title: Data Analyst - stage extracurriculare
Description:
Company Description

Publicis Groupe

Fondata nel 1926 da Marcel Bleustein-Blanchet, Publicis Groupe √® oggi il primo gruppo di comunicazione al mondo. Presente in Italia con tre sedi - Milano, Torino e Roma - e oltre 1500 professionisti, il Gruppo agisce come partner strategico per la crescita dei propri clienti, offrendo un‚Äôampia gamma di competenze e soluzioni integrate nelle aree della creativit√†, media, produzione e business transformation.

Overview

La/Il Data Analyst - stage extracurriculare far√† parte del Team Buying e fornir√† supporto nella gestione dei dati di tutte le campagne media delle agenzie.

Responsibilities


Raccogliere, elaborare e analizzare grandi quantit√† di dati provenienti da diverse fonti (CRM, campagne digitali, social media, ecc.)
Supportare il team nella creazione di reportistica chiara e dettagliata per il monitoraggio delle performance
Collaborare con i team di marketing e comunicazione per fornire insight utili a migliorare le strategie di business
Utilizzare strumenti di data visualization (Power BI) per rappresentare i dati in modo efficace
Contribuire all‚Äôautomazione dei processi di raccolta e analisi dati
Mantenersi aggiornato sulle tecnologie e best practice di data analysis


Qualifications

Title: Internship - Data Science
Description:
At ION

We want to innovate the financial services offered by commercial/retail banks in Italy in the areas of wealth management, credit lending, risk management and compliance. Building on our consolidated expertise and product offering in the Capital Markets domain, we want to scale our solutions and frameworks to the commercial/retail banking industry. To do so, we start from the quantitative modelling and analysis of the current processes put in place by our customers, so that we can profile opportunities of automation and prioritize client needs on manual/painful workflows. The resource will be involved in business process analyses of Italian commercial/retail financial institutions and is expected to integrate structured information extracted from interviews with the analysis of literature and documentation to build a quantitative picture of the AS-IS. The analysis will then be complemented with a consequent implementation analysis and product roadmap definition to design the TO-BE and drive product evolutions and developments. The project entails modelling complex business contexts, extracting structured information from unstructured sources, performing quantitative analyses, presenting findings and recommendations to external clients and internal stakeholders, contributing to the definition of product backlogs.

What You Will Learn During Your Intern


Quantitative modelling of business processes
Codification of customer requirements, needs, activities
Business intelligence with PowerBI/Excel - Packaging high-quality deliverables for external clients ‚Äì
Data manipulation with Pandas or Spark/Hive


What You Need To Know


Hands-on experience with BI tools (Excel, PowerBI)
Experience with Python data science libraries (pandas, pyspark, sklearn) is nice to have
Fluent English


We Are Looking For Someone Who


is passionate about modelling unknown business contexts with a quantitative approach
can find a good trade-off between quality and speed of delivery
proactively contribute your insights and ideas in a way that fits existing frameworks of the firm
is fond of sharing knowledge with colleagues and documenting your work

Title: BI & Data analyst
Description:
Alti Profili, divisione del Gruppo Umana specializzata nella ricerca e selezione di profili di middle management per il mercato italiano e internazionale, ricerca per conto di un‚Äôimportante realt√† multinazionale attiva nel settore della componentistica oleodinamica, parte di un gruppo con oltre 90 anni di storia e una presenza consolidata in pi√π di 15 Paesi, una/un:




BI & DATA ANALYST




La figura ricercata, che risponder√† direttamente al GROUP BI AND DATA ANALYTICS MANAGER, avr√† le seguenti mansioni:

Collaborare con gli stakeholder aziendali per raccogliere e analizzare i requisiti di business, traducendoli in soluzioni analitiche e tecniche efficaci;
Progettare, sviluppare e mantenere dashboard e report interattivi in Power BI, garantendo l‚Äôaccuratezza dei dati attraverso attivit√† di validazione e controllo qualit√†;
Analizzare trend, KPI e performance aziendali per supportare le decisioni strategiche e ottimizzare le attivit√† operative delle business unit;
Contribuire al miglioramento dei processi di data governance, assicurando qualit√†, tracciabilit√† e sicurezza del dato;
Aggiornarsi costantemente su strumenti e metodologie BI, proponendo soluzioni in linea con le best practice di settore.




La risorsa ideale si presenta con i seguenti requisiti:

Percorso di studi in ambito STEM, con priorit√† per candidati in possesso di laurea triennale o magistrale e con autonomia nell‚Äôutilizzo dell‚Äôinglese in contesti professionali;
Consolidata esperienza in ambito Business Intelligence, analisi dati e reporting, con capacit√† di analizzare KPI e produrre insight a supporto delle decisioni di business.
Buona conoscenza di Power BI per la creazione di dashboard e report interattivi; costituisce un plus la familiarit√† con strumenti analoghi come Tableau o Qlik e l‚Äôutilizzo di DAX.
Competenza nell‚Äôinterrogazione e gestione dei dati tramite SQL; verr√† data priorit√† a candidati con esperienza su fonti dati SAP e piattaforme Microsoft BI (es. SQL Server, Azure).
Conoscenza, anche di base, di data modelling, concetti ETL e principi di data governance.
Ottime capacit√† di comunicazione e collaborazione con stakeholder tecnici e non tecnici, con attitudine alla traduzione dei requisiti di business in soluzioni analitiche efficaci.




Completano il profilo l‚Äôattitudine al lavoro in team, proattivit√† e interesse per l‚Äôaggiornamento continuo su strumenti e best practice di settore.




Luogo di Lavoro: Vimodrone (MI)




Inserimento con contratto a tempo indeterminato e offerta economica in linea con l‚Äôeffettiva seniority ed esperienza maturata.




Alti Profili √® una divisione di Umana S.p.A., Agenzia per il Lavoro - Aut. Min. Lav. Prot n. 1181 ‚Äì SG del 13/12/2004. Ai sensi della normativa vigente, il presente annuncio √® rivolto a candidati di entrambi i sessi (L. 903/77 e 125/91, D.lgs. 198/2006). Il trattamento dei dati personali dei candidati avverr√† nel rispetto della vigente normativa in materia di protezione dei dati personali.

La relativa informativa, resa ai sensi degli artt. 13 e 14 del Reg. UE 2016/679, √® consultabile al seguente indirizzo: http://www.altiprofili.it/privacynew.asp

La risorsa si occuper√† principalmente di:

Reperire e trasformare i dati da fonti eterogenee (ERP, database, API, file)

Garantire coerenza e qualit√† del dato lungo tutto il processo informativo

Conoscenza di Board o strumenti simili di BI (Qlik, Power BI, Tableau, Analysis Services)
Eccellente padronanza di SQL e dei principali database relazionali
Capacit√† di modellare e interpretare i processi aziendali
Conoscenza dei processi ERP, preferibilmente Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central
Familiarit√† con architettura dati e pipeline informativa




Costituiscono un plus:




Conoscenza dei seguenti linguaggi e tecnologie: .NET, Power Apps, JavaScript, CSS, SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS)
Esperienza con pipeline ETL, in particolare SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) o tecnologie equivalenti
Esperienza in Power Query per trasformazione dati Microsoft Tech Community+15Wikipedia+15Microsoft Learn+15
Familiarit√† con nuovi strumenti Microsoft per l'integrazione ETL e gestione dati:
Microsoft Fabric (pipelines ETL/ELT, Data Factory integrato, lakehouse, Dataflows Gen2) Stridely Solutions+3Microsoft Tech Community+3Microsoft Fabric Community+3
Microsoft Dataverse collegato a Fabric tramite ‚ÄúLink to Fabric‚Äù/Synapse Link, per integrazione in real‚Äëtime senza duplicazione dati Microsoft Learn+8Microsoft+8Microsoft Learn+8
OneLake come data lake unificato e supporto a pipeline T‚ÄëSQL e Spark notebooks dynatechconsultancy.com+15Microsoft Learn+15Agora Tech+15
Esperienza in data analysis o data engineering

Title: Junior Digital Analyst
Description:
Chaberton Professionals, divisione di Chaberton Partners dedicata alla ricerca e selezione di profili di Middle Management, √® attualmente alla ricerca di un/una Junior Digital Analyst per un nostro importante cliente, publisher internazionale leader nel mondo dell'editoria e dell'intrattenimento.




Descrizione del lavoro:

Siamo alla ricerca di un/a Digital Analyst motivato/a da inserire nel nostro team Data & Strategy, che si occupa della strategia digitale del gruppo, lavorando con le redazioni, la gestione degli abbonamenti, del CRM e di una parte di attivit√† consumer.




Questa figura si dovr√† occupare delle audience digitali del gruppo, utilizzando tool di analisi avanzati per fornire insight strategici al team editoriale e all'azienda. Il ruolo prevede un lavoro di analisi continuo sui trend di traffico del gruppo, rispondendo alle esigenze sia dei team editoriali che aziendali, all'interno della pi√π ampia strategia digitale, andando ad affiancare un‚Äôaltra risorsa.

Sar√† cruciale la collaborazione con i team internazionali, con i quali si lavora stabilmente per implementare nuove funzionalit√† e miglioramenti, oltre che con altre realt√† esterne per la gestione di progetti locali.




Responsabilit√†:

- Monitorare le performance dei nostri siti web utilizzando strumenti come Google Analytics, Marfeel e Looker.

- Fornire insight e raccomandazioni basate sui dati per ottimizzare la strategia digitale.

- Analizzare i trend di traffico per rispondere alle esigenze dei team editoriali e aziendali e costruzione di forecast.

- Collaborare con il team tech e prodotto internazionale per migliorare la salute tecnica e SEO dei siti.

- Gestire e aggiornare la reportistica, sviluppando nuove analisi per supportare le redazioni e il marketing.

- Coordinarsi con i team internazionali per implementare nuove funzionalit√† e miglioramenti.

- Seguire lo sviluppo di nuovi eventuali progetti digitali seguendone le fasi di implementazioni con i relativi team operativi.




Requisiti minimi:

- 2 anni di esperienza in ruoli simili.

- Esperienza di 2 anni nell'uso di sistemi di analisi delle audience come Google Analytics o similari.

- Capacit√† di interpretare le richieste degli sviluppatori.

- Competenze SEO e conoscenza delle best practice tecniche per i siti web.

- Capacit√† di interpretare e comunicare dati complessi in modo chiaro e conciso.

- Esperienza nella collaborazione con team tecnici e internazionali.

- Competenze analitiche eccezionali e capacit√† di problem solving.

- Familiarit√† con Looker, Looker Studio, GSheet.




Qualifiche preferite:

- Esperienza nel settore editoriale o dell'intrattenimento.

- Esperienza con BigQuery.

- Eccellenti capacit√† comunicative e attitudine al lavoro di squadra.




Sede di lavoro: Milano

Modalit√† di lavoro: ibrida

Title: MPIM Analytics Intern
Description:
Job Description

Calling all originals: At Levi Strauss & Co., you can be yourself ‚Äî and be part of something bigger. We‚Äôre a company of people who like to forge our own path and leave the world better than we found it. Who believe that what makes us different makes us stronger. So add your voice. Make an impact. Find your fit ‚Äî and your future.

About The Job

We're seeking for a motivated, data-driven Intern to join us at the Analytics team in Italy for our Merchandising Planning and Inventory Management (MPIM) Department.

Are you excited to learn more about Supply Chain and the Fashion industry? About using your analytic and problem-solving skills to tackle real life data problems? Do you want to be part of a young and dynamic team, while working for one of one of the most iconic global apparel brands? If so, do not hesitate to apply!

Key Responsabilities


Being point of contact for analytics and data inquiries
Creating data pipelines, dashboards and reports for use across Europe‚Äôs business
Cooperating with cross-functional partners to reach resolutions on data topics and build data products
Performing data wrangling and exploration in support of ad-hoc analysis requests and to feed predictive modelling.
Providing assistance to the extended team


About You


You speak fluently English (any other EU language is a plus)
You have excellent analytical and communication/presentation skills
You hold a Degree in Statistics / Mathematics / Engineering / Operational research / Econometrics/Economics and Business Management
You have knowledge in SQL and/or R/Python
Self-motivated, problem solver, team player
Organized with meticulous attention to detail, ability to prioritize work to meet deadlines
You are flexible and able to perform in a fast-paced environment
Comfortable learning new tools. (Dataiku, Tableau, Excel, SAS etc.)


Start date: Asap for 6 months, renewable.

This is a hybrid position based in our Milano office. You will be expected in office minimum 3 days per week. Time in office can vary depending on business needs.

LS&Co. is an affirmative action and equal employment opportunity employer. We welcome and value people from diverse cultures, backgrounds, and experiences to make LS&Co. a collective success.

LOCATION

Milan, Italy

FULL TIME/PART TIME

Full time

Current LS&Co Employees, apply via your Workday account.

Title: JUNIOR FORECASTING & REPORTING
HTML:
Chi cerchiamo

Per la nostra sede di Milano (Piazza Trento) siamo alla ricerca di una risorsa da inserire all‚Äôinterno della struttura Portfolio Planning e Indagini Autorit√† all'interno della Direzione Sales Planning, Contract Management & Certification. 

Per quale Societ√† 

A2A Energia. Societ√† del Gruppo A2A che fornisce energia a oltre 2,5 milioni di clienti, costantemente ai vertici delle rilevazioni nazionali per il livello di soddisfazione. Presenza costante per i cittadini, in casa e nella citt√†, porta nel loro mondo comfort e servizi innovativi per favorire l‚Äôefficienza energetica e la mobilit√† elettrica. Si impegna ogni giorno per offrire un servizio di qualit√†, che risponda alle esigenze pi√π diverse, dal singolo alla grande azienda.

Ti occuperai di
  • Analizzare le richieste di dati provenienti dalle Autorit√† di regolazione, in particolare da ARERA, e organizzare le attivit√† necessarie per la loro corretta gestione e finalizzazione;
  • Gestire in modo proattivo le richieste di ARERA, collaborando con le strutture interne di A2A Energia, A2A Spa e in particolare con l‚Äôarea Regolazione;
  • Estrarre ed elaborare i dati richiesti per le raccolte ufficiali, garantendo accuratezza e tempestivit√†;
  • A fronte di evoluzioni normative, formulare i requisiti business verso i Fornitori IT per l‚Äôevoluzione degli applicativi utilizzati per l‚Äôelaborazione di determinati dati, seguendo l‚Äôiter di approvazione BBP, test UAT e rilascio in produzione;
  • Contribuire alla gestione dell‚Äôapprovvigionamento di Energia Elettrica, Gas e Garanzie d‚Äôorigine di A2A Energia attraverso la gestione dei flussi massivi verso gli Uffici di Trading della Capogruppo;
  • Supporto nella produzione di reportistiche periodiche verso le Strutture di A2A Energia;


Sei la persona giusta se ti riconosci in questo profilo
  • Laurea in discipline economiche, ingegneria o titolo di studio equivalente;
  • Competenze analitiche nell‚Äôelaborazione ed interpretazione dei dati;
  • Conoscenza avanzata del pacchetto Office (in particolare Excel/Power Point);
  • Rappresenta un plus l‚Äôesperienza pregressa di 1-2 anni nel campo dell‚Äôanalisi dati in aziende del settore Energy/Utility o in aziende di consulenza per clienti finali in questi settori;
  • Rappresenta un plus la conoscenza degli applicativi Qlik View, Qlik Sense, Google Cloud Platform, Power BI o altri applicativi di BI;
  • Completano il profilo: flessibilit√†, dinamicit√†, orientamento al teamworking, capacit√† relazionali con stakeholder interni ed esterni, concretezza e spirito collaborativo, problem solving, proattivit√† e iniziativa, autonomia, gestione dello stress e delle priorit√†, capacit√† di analisi e di pianificazione/organizzazione del lavoro.


Cosa offriamo
  • Flessibilit√†: settimana lavorativa con venerd√¨ a orario ridotto, flessibilit√† negli orari di entrata/uscita e pausa pranzo; Smartworking sino al 60% dell‚Äôorario di lavoro su base bimestrale
  • Buoni pasto elettronici
  • Salute e benessere: assistenza sanitaria integrativa, supporto psicologico attraverso counseling, webinar dedicati al benessere psicofisico e vaccino antinfluenzale
  • Famiglia: A2A Life Caring, iniziativa a supporto della genitorialit√† attraverso un mese aggiuntivo retribuito al 100% per maternit√†/paternit√†, rimborsi spese per figli, convenzioni con asili nido, team coaching per neogenitori; spazio caregiver, offriamo webinar e uno spazio di ascolto dedicati a chi si prende cura di persone fragili o non autosufficienti
  • Formazione e sviluppo: programma di induction dedicato ai nuovi assunti, gestione dei talenti, corsi di formazione e possibilit√† di crescita interna e job rotation tramite candidatura interna
  • Risparmio e tempo libero: oltre 300 convenzioni, tra cui trasporti pubblici, attivit√† sportive, viaggi, eventi culturali, e offerte speciali per luce e gas. Opzioni per il car sharing e la conversione del premio di risultato in benefit di welfare
  • Ambiente di lavoro: promuoviamo una cultura che valorizza la diversit√†, l‚Äôequit√† e l'inclusione (DE&I); potrai inoltre avere la possibilit√† di unirti a un team dedicato allo sviluppo di iniziative e progetti su queste tematiche. Sosteniamo l'evoluzione tecnologica e offriamo strumenti e risorse per promuovere il lavoro digitale.


 

Scopri di pi√π sul Gruppo a2a

Opportunit√† di lavoro   https://t.ly/CiTRn

Le nostre persone   https://t.ly/djoa3

Formazione   https://t.ly/Nr5Fr

Title: Power BI Analyst
Description:
Kepleria sta cercando Power BI Analyst per le sedi di Milano, Torino, Casalecchio di Reno, Roma.

Sei la persona giusta? Leggi l‚Äôannuncio e aiutaci a conoscerti inviandoci il tuo curriculum.

Il contesto di cui farai parte

Kepleria si configura cos√¨ come uno dei principali player italiani in questo settore, azienda appartenente ad Altea Federation con una profonda esperienza pluriennale in progetti di Data Management, Business Intelligence e Planning

Attraverso strumenti avanzati di elaborazione dei dati, accompagna i propri clienti nel viaggio per diventare ‚Äúdata driven company‚Äù. Tramite soluzioni Analytics, expertise di industry e processo, utilizza le tecnologie pi√π solide e innovative per estrarre valore dai dati e metterli a disposizione a tutti i livelli dell‚Äôorganizzazione, al fine di liberare nuove potenzialit√† e orientare le decisioni in un‚Äôottica ispirata alla massima efficacia ed efficienza, oltre che al cost-saving.

Ogni progetto di trasformazione digitale intrapreso utilizza modelli di business agili, sostenibili e adattivi.

Siamo una FREE PLACE COMPANY, quindi operiamo da dove √® pi√π opportuno lavorare (casa, ufficio, cliente), in funzione degli obiettivi da perseguire, condividendoli con i propri riferimenti di progetto o di unit√† organizzativa.

3 cose che devi sapere in 3 hashtag

#PowerBI

Sarai impiegato, all‚Äôinterno di un team di specialisti Microsoft e collocato in una delle sedi italiane di Altea Federation, nello sviluppo di soluzioni basate su tecnologia Power BI.

La Tua Mission Sar√†


diffusione in azienda delle cultura del dato;
modellare e implementare i requisiti funzionali forniti;
fornire supporto al cliente nel processo di adozione di Power BI;
disegno report e visualizzazioni grafiche navigabili;
relazionarsi attivamente con gli stakeholder di progetto.


Il ruolo richiede una conoscenza basilare dei servizi Microsoft legati al mondo della ‚ÄúData Intelligence‚Äù e delle pi√π diffuse metodologie di Project Management (Waterfall, Agile) applicate attraverso l‚Äôutilizzo degli strumenti di configuration management come Azure DevOps. Sarai affiancato da profili senior che ti aiuteranno nel gestire le criticit√† e potrai dare il tuo contributo avendo una certa autonomia nel ruolo, assicurandoti che il lavoro svolto sia in linea con i piani di progetto, gli standard di qualit√† e la sicurezza aziendale.

Competenze Richieste

PowerBI

Azure Synapse

Power BI (Dax)


#it‚Äôs about you

Il WorkLifeBalance √® un continuo impegno per ogni uno di noi; pertanto, Vedrai Data Intelligence promuove una politica del lavoro ‚Äúsostenibile‚Äù ponendo attenzione sia all‚Äôecologia sia alla dimensione sociale. Lo smartworking concorre al raggiungimento di questo intento, dando la possibilit√† ad ognuno di noi di gestire al meglio la necessit√† di lavoro individuale.

Avrai l‚Äôopportunit√† di accedere tramite la piattaforma interna di eLearning a piani formativi personalizzati e dedicati allo sviluppo delle competenze (hard & soft) per aiutarti ed accompagnarti nel tuo percorso di crescita professionale.

E ancora molto altro ‚Ä¶ ready to join us?

Ôªø

Title: Analyst CS
Description:
Job Description

ABOUT THIS JOB

NielsenIQ works with clients to provide insights, thought leadership to drive their business and grow their portfolios. Our work helps our clients set growth strategies and determines what products you ultimately see on the shelf. Our team members are experts across various categories and are viewed as trusted partners by our clients. Analysts within the Customer Success Team are responsible for the execution of projects with limited supervision by compiling, analyzing, and interpreting sales data, writing client reports, and constructing presentations, and are expected to manage client relationships independently.

Responsibilities


Summarizes data in tables, charts, and graphs; analyzes and interprets sales data and consumer data + basic portfolio knowledge. Occasionally sets-up and refreshes cyclical reports
Prepares and delivers quantitative analysis and presentations (category overview as well as issue based) building a story and finalizing conclusions and proposes recommendations. Proposes calculation of Quantified Business Opportunity
Uses internal tools and data sources, coaching Interns and Juniors
Discusses advanced quantitative analysis design to best answer client questions with Client Business Partner/client with the support of senior team members, following and fully owning Center of Excellence (COE) ways of working process
Autonomously interacts with client staff both on basic client needs; leads client meetings and presentations over the phone and in person
Acts in line with the Service level of the client assigned
Catches sales opportunities at client meetings/during quantitative analysis and alerts CBP


Requirements


Native in Italian and Good in English Languages
Ideally 3 to 4 years as a quantitative Market Researcher, in a Research Agency (Ad hoc researches) strong client-facing and communication/presentation experience ‚Äì deliver research results to stakeholders on the client‚Äôs side in a clear, consistent manner
Good analytical skills, ability to interpret sales and consumer data
Ability to work in a Team within a dynamic environment
Good interpersonal skills
Organizational skills: understanding of business priorities; ability to adapt to complex and changing organization; ability to manage time schedules
Passionate in FMCG and client dynamics
Good project management skills, specifically for SPOC or Champion roles
Interested in financial and business environment of the clients and the industry
Full proficiency in PowerPoint & Excel


What we can offer:


Work in dynamic environment engaging with local and global companies.
Benefits & flexible working hours, hybrid work options.
Internal trainings will be provided together with detailed onboarding agenda.
Access to learning platforms
Staff and team events


Additional Information

Our Benefits


Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


About NIQ

NIQ is the world‚Äôs leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights‚Äîdelivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms‚ÄîNIQ delivers the Full View‚Ñ¢. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world‚Äôs population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion

Title: Stage ‚Äì Business Intelligence CRM
HTML:
Per il nostro team CRM cerchiamo una risorsa da inserire in stage con il ruolo di Business Intelligence CRM


Attivit√† previste

Durante il periodo di stage, la risorsa selezionata affiancher√† il team CRM nelle attivit√† di analisi e reportistica, contribuendo in particolare a:

  • Supportare l‚Äôelaborazione e l‚Äôinterpretazione dei dati provenienti dal sistema CRM, al fine di approfondire la conoscenza del comportamento dei clienti;
  • Analizzare le performance delle iniziative di marketing e fidelizzazione (DEM, attivit√† nei punti vendita, programma loyalty);
  • Collaborare all‚Äôindividuazione di trend di consumo, integrando dati interni e insight di mercato.


Profilo ideale

Il profilo che ricerchiamo presenta le seguenti caratteristiche:

  • Iscrizione a un corso di laurea in discipline statistiche, economiche o affini;
  • Spiccata attitudine analitica e forte interesse per l‚Äôanalisi dei dati;
  • Interesse per l‚Äôanalisi del Cliente tramite l‚Äôuso dei dati;
  • Precisione, curiosit√† e orientamento all‚Äôapprendimento di strumenti e metodologie di business intelligence, data visualization e analisi predittiva.


Competenze tecniche (preferenziali ma non vincolanti)

Nel corso dello stage sar√† possibile approfondire o sviluppare competenze nei seguenti ambiti:

  • Conoscenze di base di SQL e di linguaggi di programmazione statistica (es. Python, R, SAS);
  • Interesse per strumenti di visualizzazione dei dati (es. Tableau CRM / Salesforce Einstein Analytics);
  • Familiarit√† con strumenti di web analytics (es. Google Analytics);
  • Conoscenza di base o interesse per tecniche di segmentazione e clustering.

Title: Data analyst - AI Expert
Description:
Siamo un gruppo di aziende specializzato nel settore Technical & Energy Management Services, con una presenza consolidata in Italia e sedi operative anche in Arabia Saudita.

Grazie alla nostra esperienza, abbiamo sviluppato un modello integrato che copre l‚Äôintero ciclo di vita degli asset immobiliari: dalla progettazione MEP alla costruzione, manutenzione, ottimizzazione energetica e gestione digitale.

Promuoviamo la decarbonizzazione del Real Estate, attraverso lo sviluppo e l'implementazione di piani di riduzione della carbon footprint.

Posizione:

Siamo alla ricerca di un* Data Analyst con competenze in AI per unirsi alla nostra divisione "AI", un'unit√† dinamica e strategica dedicata allo sviluppo di soluzioni intelligenti per l'efficientamento energetico e la manutenzione predittiva.

Ruolo e responsabilit√†:


Analisi di grandi volumi di dati provenienti da sistemi di monitoraggio energetico e ambientale.
Progettazione e sviluppo di modelli predittivi (ML/AI) per l‚Äôidentificazione di anomalie e il forecasting di malfunzionamenti (failure prediction).
Collaborazione con data scientist, ingegneri e team di prodotto per trasformare insight analitici in soluzioni operative.
Contributo nella creazione di dashboard e report intelligenti per il supporto decisionale.
Validazione e miglioramento continuo dei modelli, adottando un approccio data-driven e iterativo.


Requisiti:

Requisiti:


Laurea in Ingegneria, Statistica, Data Science, Matematica o discipline affini.
Almeno 2 anni di esperienza come data analyst o data scientist.
Conoscenza dei principali linguaggi per l‚Äôanalisi e la modellazione (Python, SQL, R).
Esperienza concreta con librerie di machine learning (scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Familiarit√† con tecniche di anomaly detection e predizione del guasto (failure prediction).
Conoscenza di strumenti di visualizzazione (Tableau, Power BI o simili).
Ti piace sperimentare, ma sempre con un occhio alla robustezza del risultato.
Lavori bene in team multidisciplinari e comunichi in modo chiaro.


Altri requisiti:


Essere automuniti, il luogo di lavoro √® difficilmente raggiungibile con i mezzi pubblici


Altre informazioni:

Cosa troverai in Fervo:


Un ambiente giovane e orientato all‚Äôinnovazione
Progetti ad alto impatto nel campo della sostenibilit√† e dell‚Äôefficienza energetica
Opportunit√† di crescita professionale nella nuova divisione "AI", strategica per il futuro dell‚Äôazienda
Formazione continua su AI, ML e DataOps
Modalit√† di lavoro flessibile e possibilit√† di smart working 1 gg alla settimana
Pacchetto retributivo in linea con le tue competenze e con il mercato

Title: Business intelligence
Description:
BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE SPECIALIST




Job Description

The candidate will become the leading member of the Business Intelligence Team and will collaborate with the rest of the IT Team on projects for companies of the Elemaster group.

He/She will design, develop and maintain Business Intelligence solutions to support Business Processes; collaborating transversally with Finance, Operations, HR, Sales, Facilities and Project Management departments.

The desired methodology is ‚Äúdesign once, run everywhere‚Äù since Elemaster is a group of multinational companies.

The Candidate will also guide the Artificial Intelligence Projects Elemaster is implementing internally and partners; efforts aimed at improving daily productivity on key Business Processes.

He/She will become part of a young, multicultural and skilled team where we welcome new ideas and skillsets. We prefer quality over quantity and try to implement long-term solutions that help the business thrive.




Technical Skills

Extensive knowledge of SQL language and Tools; in particular SqlServer and Oracle
Proven experience with OLAP solutions; DAX language and SSAS are considered a plus
ETL tools and techniques
Experience with cloud and on-premise integration
Business Intelligence Tools; PowerBI and Board preferred




Responsibilities

Focus on data quality and standardization
Analyze, create and maintain reporting or business intelligence solutions to help understand and improve the work of other business functions:
Production Planning
Logistics
Sales and Customer Relationship Management
Human Resources
Environmental,Social and Governance
Accouting
Controlling
Implement and monitor application integrations and interfaces




Other desired skills

Financial skills (basic):
Consolidated financial statements
Economic and financial KPIs
Budgeting, forecasting, and ESG reporting processes
Ability to communicate with Finance and Sustainability functions to translate requirements into technical solutions
Advanced AI and analytics (plus)
Interest or knowledge of Artificial Intelligence applied to BI, for example:
Forecasting algorithms
Customer or supplier segmentation
Automated data analysis




Softskills

Strong focus on results and continuous improvement
Ability to work in cross-functional teams
Autonomous project management
Ability to communicate with business users and technicians




Direct supervisor

IT Manager

Title: Intern Research & Data Intelligence
Description:
Company Description

At Colliers, we help leaders succeed by helping them build amazing workplaces, businesses, and communities around the world. We do this by thinking differently, sharing innovative ideas, and offering a unique and collaborative workplace where you can succeed.

BE creative. BE the expert. BE a team player. Be all that and more at Colliers International.

Colliers is a listed real estate advisor active in 66 countries with more than 18,000 employees. We contribute to a better society by solving real estate issues and accelerating the sustainability transition in the built environment. In 2025 we will be completely climate neutral.

We connect global market developments and data with the needs of property owners, property investors, and property tenants. This enables us to understand the sector of tomorrow and to provide forward-looking advice. These insights help us add value to all phases of the real estate cycle and build long-lasting customer relationships. We offer creative solutions that are not only attractive today, but also remain relevant and sustainable later on.

In Italy, we work with 170 professionals in an organization where entrepreneurship, expertise, and doing the right thing are important. Together we shape the future of real estate.

Job Description

Is Data Intelligence & Research your passion? Do you feel ready to analyse the real estate market and macro-economic trends?

The resource in the Data Intelligence & Research Department will have a cross-team role. This is a resource with enthusiasm, a propensity for team working, strong analytical and communication skills, an aptitude for analysis and technology, and good language skills.

As the Intern Data Researcher you will be in charge of:


Cross-support all activities of the research team
Collecting and analysing property market data through the management of datasets
Develop market outputs through the production of market maps and reports
Supporting the data analytics teasm in the automation of database research


Qualifications


Degree in urban planning, economics, statistics, and similar disciplines.
Researching, collecting, reporting and detailing abilities
Native Italian speaker and proficient in English
Familiar with Office Package especially with Excel and Power Point
Team working orienting
Creativity and curiosity
Availability to travel across the main Italian cities.
Show more
HTML:
Company Description

At Colliers, we help leaders succeed by helping them build amazing workplaces, businesses, and communities around the world. We do this by thinking differently, sharing innovative ideas, and offering a unique and collaborative workplace where you can succeed.

BE creative. BE the expert. BE a team player. Be all that and more at Colliers International.

Colliers is a listed real estate advisor active in 66 countries with more than 18,000 employees. We contribute to a better society by solving real estate issues and accelerating the sustainability transition in the built environment. In 2025 we will be completely climate neutral.

We connect global market developments and data with the needs of property owners, property investors, and property tenants. This enables us to understand the sector of tomorrow and to provide forward-looking advice. These insights help us add value to all phases of the real estate cycle and build long-lasting customer relationships. We offer creative solutions that are not only attractive today, but also remain relevant and sustainable later on.

In Italy, we work with 170 professionals in an organization where entrepreneurship, expertise, and doing the right thing are important. Together we shape the future of real estate.

Job Description

Is Data Intelligence & Research your passion? Do you feel ready to analyse the real estate market and macro-economic trends?

The resource in the Data Intelligence & Research Department will have a cross-team role. This is a resource with enthusiasm, a propensity for team working, strong analytical and communication skills, an aptitude for analysis and technology, and good language skills.

As the Intern Data Researcher you will be in charge of:

  • Cross-support all activities of the research team
  • Collecting and analysing property market data through the management of datasets
  • Develop market outputs through the production of market maps and reports
  • Supporting the data analytics teasm in the automation of database research

Qualifications

  • Degree in urban planning, economics, statistics, and similar disciplines.
  • Researching, collecting, reporting and detailing abilities
  • Native Italian speaker and proficient in English
  • Familiar with Office Package especially with Excel and Power Point
  • Team working orienting
  • Creativity and curiosity
  • Availability to travel across the main Italian cities.

Title: Information Technology Support Intern
Description:
WithumSmith+Brown, P.C., is a forward-thinking, technology-driven advisory and accounting firm, helping clients to Be in a Position of StrengthSM in today‚Äôs modern business landscape. Withum empowers clients with innovative tools and solutions to address their accounting, tax and overall business management needs. Withum is a place where talent thrives. We recruit only the best and brightest people, with a genuine passion for the business.

Withum‚Äôs brand is a reflection of our people, our culture and our strength. Withum has become synonymous with teamwork and client service excellence. The cornerstone of our success can truly be accredited to the dedicated professionals who work here every day, whose mission is to help our clients grow and thrive - to be in a position of strength. But our commitment goes beyond our clients as we continue to live the Withum Way, promoting personal and professional growth for all team members, clients, and surrounding communities.




Withum is currently seeking an interns to work in our Providence office from August to Winter open to intern to full time position.

This position requires you to be in the office approximately 3 times a week.




Under supervision of the Services Manager of Information Technology, the IT Services Intern of Withum provides operational support to the entire IT Organization and, potentially, first and second level hardware, software, and networking support. Supported by IT team members and management in other Withum offices, this individual is accountable for providing outstanding customer service and technical support to staff in the local office as well as remote team members throughout the Firm.




Responsibilities Include:

Primarily support our offices, with occasional travel to local firm offices and provide operational assistance to the IT support staff
Work with local resources and external vendors to ensure shipment and delivery of assets
Document, track, and monitor tasks to ensure a timely resolution and effective communication to all parties involved
At the discretion of the local Service Representative, act as a supplemental resource for technology initiatives
Assists management in proactively meeting the technology needs of the office by keeping IT management abreast of issues and activities
Work closely with members of the IT team to ensure successful completion of technology projects throughout the Firm
Traveling to other offices as needed
Other responsibilities may be assigned as needed




Position Requirements:

Understanding of end-user support in a Microsoft environment required - experience
Knowledge of Windows 10 and/or Windows 11, hardware and the MS Office Suite
Java, HTML and SQL coding experience
Knowledge of mobile devices, phones, tablets, laptops, etc.
Knowledge of mobile technology including mobile OS platforms and hardware functionality
Knowledge of and the ability to troubleshoot computer hardware and peripherals (networking fundamentals a plus)
Must be self-motivated and dedicated to continual personal and professional improvement
Strong ability to work within a team environment
Strong verbal and written communication skills are imperative for documentation and the translation of technical subjects to non-technical staff
Ability to lift up to 50lbs
Ability to travel to remote offices as needed

Withum will not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, marital status, genetic information, disability, or because he or she is a protected veteran.

Title: Assistant Case Manager
Description:
Gemma Law Associates is seeking a motivated and detail-driven Assistant Case Manager to support our personal injury team. In this vital role, you will help safeguard client recoveries by managing all aspects of medical liens and subrogation claims. Your responsibilities will include identifying, monitoring, and resolving claims related to Medicare, Medicaid, health insurance, MedPay, and PIP. You'll maintain accurate lien records, coordinate with providers and insurers, and work to negotiate reductions to ensure fair and timely settlement disbursements.

Compensation: $34,000 - $36,000 yearly

Title: BI Data Analyst
Description:
job summary:

Location: Smithfield, RI Only

Required Skills:


Bachelor's or equivalent Degree with 6+ years of experience working with business intelligence solutions
Passion for using data in creative ways that tell a story and drive an impactful result


location: Smithfield, Rhode Island

job type: Contract

salary: $58 - 59 per hour

work hours: 8am to 5pm

education: Bachelors

responsibilities:


Demonstrated experience in analytical thinking, influencing, and problem solving
Expertise with data workflow tools, solid understanding of data and database concepts, tools, and technologies with ability to optimize and drive scale
Solid understanding of the BI product life cycle and proven experience working with large data sets


qualifications:


Experience serving as a change agent and influencer helping end users adopt innovative approaches to business intelligence and data driven culture
Proven knowledge and applied professional experience with multiple BI (Business Intelligence) and analytical tools such as Alteryx, Tableau, and Power BI
Experience with writing and decoding SQL
Takes a consultative approach understanding needs of others and regularly communicating ideas or suggestions in terms that lead to actionable outcomes and building lasting partnerships with stakeholders


skills:


Using fact-finding, effective questioning techniques, and diagnostic tools to identify and analyze problems
Developing and implementing quick turnaround ad-hoc queries to research and understand factors that may be impacting business performance
Agile experience, preferred
Presentation experience to Executive and Senior Leadership, preferred
Financial services experience, preferred


Equal Opportunity Employer: Race, Color, Religion, Sex, Sexual Orientation, Gender Identity, National Origin, Age, Genetic Information, Disability, Protected Veteran Status, or any other legally protected group status.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
ONLY W2 NO C2C




We are currently sourcing for a Data Engineer to work at our client's location in Smithfield, Rhode Island.




The Expertise and Skills You Bring

Design, develop, and maintain data pipelines and ETL processes using Oracle SQL/PLSQL, Snowflake, AWS batch, and Python.
Responsible for System analysis, including analyzing system requirements and identifying system specifications.
Implement and manage data integration solutions to ensure seamless data flow across systems.
Develop and optimize Unix shell scripts for automation and data processing tasks.
Utilize AWS Batch for scheduling and executing ETL pipelines and batch processing jobs.
Implement CI/CD pipelines using tools like Jenkins, Git, and Artifactory to automate deployment and integration processes.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and deliver solutions that meet business needs.
Ensure data quality, integrity, and security across all data platforms.
Troubleshoot and resolve data-related issues in a timely manner.
Document data engineering processes and maintain comprehensive technical documentation.
Strong experience with Oracle databases and Snowflake data warehousing.
Proficiency in Unix and shell scripting.
Hands-on experience with AWS Data Engineering services, including AWS Batch, S3, EMR, EC2
Expertise in Informatica for data integration and ETL processes.
Solid understanding of data modeling and data architecture principles.
Strong SQL skills for data querying and manipulation.
Familiarity with CI/CD tools such as Jenkins, Git, and Artifactory.
Knowledge of data governance and data quality best practices.
Knowledge of Python for data processing and automation.
Experience with big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark).
Solid understanding of data warehousing concepts and ETL processes.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment.
Strong communication and collaboration skills.
Ability to translate business requirements into data-driven solutions.
Strong communication skills to convey data insights to non-technical stakeholders
Ability to analyze large datasets to identify trends and insights.
Proficiency preferred in developing and maintaining dashboards and reports using data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).

Title: Cookie Crew
Description:
As a member of the Cookie Crew at our Downtown Providence store located at 263 Weybosset St. Providence, RI 02903, you are the ultimate Insomniac. Not only are you the point person at the front of the store for interacting with our customers, but you also get to bake all of our awesome Warm and Delicious cookies as well!

SOME OF OUR SWEET PERKS:


Flexible part-time work schedules
Free cookies & Employee Discount
Paid Time Off
Pet insurance for your furry loved ones
Excellent training
Job stability with a rapidly growing and reputable company
Achievable growth/promotion opportunities
You get to work in a fun, exciting team environment





WHAT ELSE WILL I DO AS A MEMBER OF THE COOKIE CREW?


Promptly greet guests entering the store and take their orders according to procedure
Help customers understand menu items, answer clarifying questions, and repeat orders for accuracy
Give each customer a warm experience with a smile in person & over the phone
Bake our delicious cookies to perfection & a scoop of ice cream
Ensure fast, warm, and correct delivery orders are packaged and sent out
Handle cash and payments accurately and have no shortages or overages
Cleaning, sanitizing, and maintaining the bakery





DESIRED SKILLS/EXPERIENCE:


Prior experience in a customer service focused role - preferred
Personable, genuine, outgoing demeanor
Ambitious nature
Great communication and organizational skills
Must be 18 years or older to be employed
Must be able to work nights, weekends and holidays
Legally eligible to work in the United States





About us:

Insomnia Cookies was founded in a college dorm room by then-student, Seth Berkowitz. Fast forward 20 years and so... many....cookies... later, our innovative bakery + delivery concept has become a cult brand known for its rabid following of cookie lovers who crave Insomnia‚Äôs warm, delicious delivery all day and late into the night. With an expanding footprint of over 300 stores globally, an experiential, ‚Äúsweet-easy‚Äù concept as the brand‚Äôs flagship in Philadelphia, Pa. (where Insomnia Cookies is headquartered), and a rapidly-growing nationwide shipping and gifting portfolio... Insomnia Cookies is revolutionizing the cookie game by truly "Imagining What‚Äôs Possible"!

Title: Logistician (CMILS)
Description:
PURVIS Systems is a technology solutions partner that develops, implements and maintains mission-critical solutions for federal and local governments. We‚Äôve been committed to sustainable growth since our inception in 1973, striving for continual improvement without ever losing sight of our core values: transparency, integrity, and teamwork. We provide the tools and path for each employee to be successful ‚Äì and in return, ask you to play a pivotal role in helping your peers and clients be successful, providing top-notch teamwork and service. Peace of Mind at PURVIS Systems means knowing your work provides immeasurable value to our team, our partners and our clients.

PURVIS is looking for a Logistician to be part of a team working on-site at client location. We are seeking a motivated individual to join a fast-paced and exciting work environment.

The day-to-day responsibilities of this role include:


Review acquisitions data for accuracy and submit recommendations for improvement of the material purchasing process
Generate Universal Material Masters, if requested
Research material information and orders through Haystack, OneTouch, ERP, OSP/WARP, etc
Enter customer provided data into the material management system to initiate the acquisitions process
Utilize WARP to generate Material Transfer Requests (MTR) for deliveries and shipments
Provide data analysis and collection for compilation of multiple reports as required by the customer
Use and update locally built database for tracking applicable data
Review and update data daily to track all material acquisitions to delivery
Provide material order status updates to customers
Assist in other areas of material management as needed to include but not limited to analyzing inventory levels or participating in physical inventories



Qualifications/Experience:


Bachelor's Degree is required
Experience with Haystack, One-Touch, N-ERP, SAM and OSP/WARP is a plus
Intermediate skills with MicroSoft Word, and PowerPoint is required
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel preferred
MS Access database construction experience is a plus
Sharepoint PowerBI experience is a plus
Ability to follow Standard Operating Procedures, meet deadlines, and multi-task
Ability to communicate, both orally and in writing, to all levels of the customer organization. Candidate must have effective communication skills and develop relationships with customers
Attention to detail is a critical required skill to support accuracy, and quality standards
Must be able to successfully work independently as well as in a team environment with customers, peers, and support personnel



Candidate must have or be able to obtain a government security clearance to the level of SECRET.

The PURVIS Team values the health and financial security of every employee. This is why we have chosen to offer all full‚Äêtime employees a comprehensive package of group benefit programs with enrollment options intended to offer flexibility ‚Äì in both plan selection and level of coverage to maximize the value of your benefits as cost effective and affordable without compromising quality.

PURVIS values the diversity of our team. We provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibit discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

Title: Systems Administrator
Description:
INDUS is a 100% employee-owned, customer-focused government services provider with expertise in Engineering, Information Technology, Cybersecurity, Program/Financial Management, Logistics, and Data Analytics. At INDUS, we believe in the value of the INDUS team. Together we deliver exceptional customer service, foster a growth and support-centered work environment, and focus on how we can give back to the communities that we serve. Empowering our employees starts on day one and creates an environment full of innovation and promise. By offering mentorship and robust Training and Development opportunities, INDUS continues its pursuit to be the Employer of Choice.

Reporting to the Program Manager, the Systems Administrator will provide comprehensive Systems Administration and technical support of NUWC Newport Code 25 Advanced Interactive Management Technology Center (AIMTC) systems, network, workstations, support equipment hardware and software.. This is a contingent position expected to be located in Newport, RI.


Perform routine system updates, patches, and configuration changes to ensure the security and integrity of the systems, which shall be completed as dictated by the severity of the vulnerability based on vulnerability reports provided from scanning tools.
Create, modify, and deactivate user accounts and permissions as necessary to maintain access control and ensure that all user accounts are properly managed and authorized, upon notification of a personnel change.
Monitor system performance, troubleshoot issues, and optimize system operations for systems every 4 hours.
Upon notification of an outage, automated monitoring services, or notification from customers, immediately monitor, troubleshoot, and optimize systems.
Implement and maintain backup and recovery procedures to prevent data loss and ensure business continuity.
Enforce security policies, monitor security breaches, and respond to incidents in accordance with defined best practices and DoD policies.
Conduct cyber analysis and make recommendations on cyber tools, processes, and procedures to enhance the security of individual platforms, systems, or networks.
Implement security settings and resolve any hardware and software interface and interoperability issues that occur during the implementation in accordance with defined best practices and DoD policies.
Install and integrate updates, fixes, and enhancements of operating systems, databases, and application software, as updates become available from manufacturers.
Manage system assets to ensure performance, capacity, and availability for systems.
Document systems administration and technical support for establishment, test, upgrade, and operational support of systems, network, workstations, and support equipment hardware and software.
Provide recommendations for systems administration and technical support for establishment, test, upgrade, and operational support of systems, network, workstations, and support equipment hardware and software.
Install, configure, and maintain web servers using Internet Information Services (IIS) or Apache, upon receipt of webserver change request.
Bid and proposal support if requested.
Other duties as assigned.



Required Qualifications


An active secret clearance is required to be considered for this position.
HS Diploma required.
Must possess an IAT Level II certification per the DoD 8570 requirements (one of the following)
CompTIA CySA+
CompTIA Security+
CCNA Security
GICSP
GSEC
SSCP
At least five (5) years of experience as a system administrator in a cloud environment.
At least two (2) years of experience in installing and configuring web servers.
At least one (1) year of experience with PKI (Public Key Infrastructure) implementation and best practices.
Must possess basic computer literacy and data entry skills.
Demonstrated proficiency in Microsoft Office applications (to include MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.).
Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Demonstrated problem-solving skills.
Must possess strong time management skills.
Must be able to work in a fast-paced, changing, and challenging environment.
Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future.


Desired Qualifications


At least one (1) year of experience with Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) pipeline.



Physical Requirements


Must be able to remain seated in a stationary position 50% of the time. Must also be able to alternate between sitting, standing, and walking.
The work requires some physical exertion, such as long periods of standing, or recurring and considerable walking, stooping, bending, crouching, and climbing such as performing regular shop activities, inspections, or to observe and study operations in an industrial or comparable work area, or on-board ships, submarines, and/or in weapon facilities.



INDUS is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, seeking to create a welcoming and diverse environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, marital status, genetics, age, or veteran status or any other applicable legally protected status or characteristic.

Show more
HTML:
INDUS is a 100% employee-owned, customer-focused government services provider with expertise in Engineering, Information Technology, Cybersecurity, Program/Financial Management, Logistics, and Data Analytics. At INDUS, we believe in the value of the INDUS team. Together we deliver exceptional customer service, foster a growth and support-centered work environment, and focus on how we can give back to the communities that we serve. Empowering our employees starts on day one and creates an environment full of innovation and promise. By offering mentorship and robust Training and Development opportunities, INDUS continues its pursuit to be the Employer of Choice.

Reporting to the Program Manager, the Systems Administrator will provide comprehensive Systems Administration and technical support of NUWC Newport Code 25 Advanced Interactive Management Technology Center (AIMTC) systems, network, workstations, support equipment hardware and software.. This is a contingent position expected to be located in Newport, RI.

  • Perform routine system updates, patches, and configuration changes to ensure the security and integrity of the systems, which shall be completed as dictated by the severity of the vulnerability based on vulnerability reports provided from scanning tools.
  • Create, modify, and deactivate user accounts and permissions as necessary to maintain access control and ensure that all user accounts are properly managed and authorized, upon notification of a personnel change.
  • Monitor system performance, troubleshoot issues, and optimize system operations for systems every 4 hours.
  • Upon notification of an outage, automated monitoring services, or notification from customers, immediately monitor, troubleshoot, and optimize systems.
  • Implement and maintain backup and recovery procedures to prevent data loss and ensure business continuity.
  • Enforce security policies, monitor security breaches, and respond to incidents in accordance with defined best practices and DoD policies.
  • Conduct cyber analysis and make recommendations on cyber tools, processes, and procedures to enhance the security of individual platforms, systems, or networks.
  • Implement security settings and resolve any hardware and software interface and interoperability issues that occur during the implementation in accordance with defined best practices and DoD policies.
  • Install and integrate updates, fixes, and enhancements of operating systems, databases, and application software, as updates become available from manufacturers.
  • Manage system assets to ensure performance, capacity, and availability for systems.
  • Document systems administration and technical support for establishment, test, upgrade, and operational support of systems, network, workstations, and support equipment hardware and software.
  • Provide recommendations for systems administration and technical support for establishment, test, upgrade, and operational support of systems, network, workstations, and support equipment hardware and software.
  • Install, configure, and maintain web servers using Internet Information Services (IIS) or Apache, upon receipt of webserver change request.
  • Bid and proposal support if requested.
  • Other duties as assigned.


Required Qualifications

  • An active secret clearance is required to be considered for this position.
  • HS Diploma required.
  • Must possess an IAT Level II certification per the DoD 8570 requirements (one of the following)
    • CompTIA CySA+
    • CompTIA Security+
    • CCNA Security
    • GICSP
    • GSEC
    • SSCP
  • At least five (5) years of experience as a system administrator in a cloud environment.
  • At least two (2) years of experience in installing and configuring web servers.
  • At least one (1) year of experience with PKI (Public Key Infrastructure) implementation and best practices.
  • Must possess basic computer literacy and data entry skills.
  • Demonstrated proficiency in Microsoft Office applications (to include MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.).
  • Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Demonstrated problem-solving skills.
  • Must possess strong time management skills.
  • Must be able to work in a fast-paced, changing, and challenging environment.
  • Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future.

Desired Qualifications

  • At least one (1) year of experience with Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) pipeline.


Physical Requirements

  • Must be able to remain seated in a stationary position 50% of the time. Must also be able to alternate between sitting, standing, and walking.
  • The work requires some physical exertion, such as long periods of standing, or recurring and considerable walking, stooping, bending, crouching, and climbing such as performing regular shop activities, inspections, or to observe and study operations in an industrial or comparable work area, or on-board ships, submarines, and/or in weapon facilities.


INDUS is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, seeking to create a welcoming and diverse environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, marital status, genetics, age, or veteran status or any other applicable legally protected status or characteristic.
