Title: IT - Administrator
Description:
Description

IT - Administrator (PeopleSoft DBA)

This position implements and maintains complex PeopleSoft databases, including installations, upgrades, and maintenance of PeopleSoft software and providing internal technical support with the ability to work unsupervised in a 24x7 environment. This position also requires considerable technical experience and knowledge of PeopleSoft (9.x) tables and data structures, and is responsible for managing and planning the overall maintenance and upgrade schedules of PS applications, will ensure that all patches, fixes and upgrades are fully researched and tested before being applied to the production environment, and will perform impact analysis across multiple applications where necessary.

Job Type:Exempt

Pay: Salary

Benefits:


Benefits Available and vary per position and location.


Are you a real go-getter looking for an amazing opportunity with a nationwide full-service utility contractor offering competitive wages and incredible benefits? Keep reading because this job might be for you!

Since 1928, Asplundh has been dedicated to safe, efficient, and innovative line clearance services for the utility industry. Reliable, uninterrupted power is an important service provided by the world's electrical utilities and Asplundh has the expertise to help keep the power flowing. Diversification over the years has opened up vegetation management services to other specialized markets such as municipalities, railroads, pipelines, helicopter vegetation services, and departments of transportation.

A family-owned and operated corporation headquartered near Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, Asplundh has grown to employ over 36,000 service professionals throughout the United States, Canada, Australia, and New Zealand.

Essential Functions & Responsibilities:


Designs, implements and maintains complex systems with respect to modeling, quality control, access, auditing, development, etc.
Designs, implements and maintains reporting environments and data warehouses from base PeopleSoft data sources.
Researches and helps implement more advanced modules and features of the databases (e.g., replication, clustering, partitioning, etc.)
Develops and documents standards for proper PeopleSoft database administration.
Leads complex projects.
Controls and monitors database and application security and integrity.
Troubleshoots all database and/or application-related performance issues.
Monitors database/application transaction activity and utilization.
May assist Application Developers with performance tuning of SQL, queries and database objects.
May assist Application Developers in developing stored procedures and/or triggers.
Formulates and documents policies, procedures, and standards relating to PeopleSoft management.
Prescribes user access requirements based on analysis of system function and end user service needs.
Provide advice, support, and guidance to the programmers, developers and other DBAs regarding code review, design and problems.
Reviews database design and integration of systems and makes recommendations regarding enhancements and/or improvements.
Installs and upgrades PeopleSoft systems.
Creates and maintains PeopleSoft Application Servers and Web Server.
Creates and maintains PeopleSoft Process Schedulers.
Provides 24x7 problem management support when needed.
Communication - be readily accessible in order to respond to all reactive calls/emails. Attend scheduled departmental and business unit calls/ meetings as required. Provide appropriate and timely feedback to all stakeholders.
Independent/effective output
Deliver high quantity/quality of work at all times. Request assistance when appropriate. Present thoughtful solutions for consideration.
Trouble Management.
Troubleshoot basic to complex problems taking full ownership of problem until resolved - manage trouble and report status to end users according to guidelines Special Projects.
Integrate into project team according to assignment.
Participate/lead internal meeting sessions providing project status updates and track open tasks for confirmed completion.
Provide back-up for IT team members as assigned.


Minimum Qualifications:


Must be 18 years of age or older.
Experience with the following:
Oracle 10g
UNIX with shell scripting (IBM/AIX preferred)
Oracle programming/development (or related)
PeoplSoft 9.x implementation/administration
application server administration (Web Logic preferred)
Data Communication
MS SQL

Education & Experience


Bachelor's degree with a technical major, such as engineering or computer science.


Pre-Screen


Upon offer, employees may be required to complete and pass a pre-employment drug screen, background, and/or MVR check.


Travel Requirements

Physical Requirements:


Rarely:walking, kneeling, squatting, crawling, seeing distant, climbing on/off truck, climbing, lifting over 10 lbs. to 50 lbs., depth perception, color vision, lifting, carrying, pushing, pulling, climbing ladders, balancing, lifting up to 10 lbs., lifting up to 50 lbs.
Occasionally: standing, stooping, body twisting, gripping, reaching, range of motion, climbing stairs.
Frequently: sitting, sense of touch, manual dexterity, speaking clearly, reading, hearing-speech range.
Constantly:seeing.


Benefits

We offer a competitive range of benefits to support our employees‚Äô health, well-being, and financial security. Medical, dental, and vision benefits are available to all eligible employees on the first day of employment. For more information on the benefits available for this role, please contact the recruiter or hiring manager.

Individuals with a disability who desire a reasonable accommodation can contact the ADA Coordinator by calling 1-833-222-3066. We partner with the Department of Homeland Security/U.S. Customs and Immigration Service to e-Verify all newly hired employees.

An Equal Opportunity Employer.

Please Note:


All job offers are subject to pre-employment drug screening and a background check.
Unless otherwise noted, we do not sponsor employees for work authorization in the U.S. for this position.


Notice to Agencies: We only accept resumes from recruiters, employment agencies, or staffing services if a Service Agreement has been signed and we have requested recruitment/staffing services for the specific position. Any unsolicited resumes will become the property of the company, and no fees or compensation will be paid to the recruiter, employment agency, or staffing service.

Title: Warehouse Associate
Description:
Ryan Herco Flow Solutions is the leading nation-wide distributor of fluid handling products providing ultrapure, corrosion-resistant fluid handling systems and expertise. We sell to a broad base of customers in industries such as electronic component and equipment manufacturers, chemical manufacturers, water & waste treatment, metal finishing, pollution control and life sciences companies. We also serve the construction market through mechanical contractors.

Ryan Herco offers a competitive, comprehensive medical, dental, and vision insurance, vacation, sick, and holiday pay, life insurance, tuition reimbursement, and a 401(k) with Company match. Our greatest benefit is the opportunity for career advancement! We strive to promote from within and value employees who contribute to our companys growth.

We need a talented individual for a Warehouse Associate for Ryan Herco Flow Solutions.

Responsibilities


Provide frontline customer service at Will-Call" counter, entering orders and answers questions and sells parts using friendly customer service skills
Pulls, packages and ships orders accurately and cost effectively for customers
Organizes stock and maintains locations on computer.
Drives company owned truck and delivers orders to customer
Provide excellent customer service when engaging with Ryan Herco Flow Solutions customers
Load and unloads truck deliveries.


Requirements


One to three years warehousing, business, or physical distribution experience
Driving/Delivery experience
Valid drivers license with clean driving record
Knowledge of PVC fittings or plumbing industry is a plus
Excellent customer service skills. Interacts effectively and works productively with a wide range of people
Solid interpersonal skills, able to maintain cooperative working relationship with all levels of personnel
Reliable and effective communicator
Strong teamwork and professional demeanor


Text "SunSource" to 25000 to Apply!!

Ryan Herco Flow Solutions is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment is contingent on successful completion of background investigation and drug screen.

Title: AI Research Intern
Description:
Location:

Providence, RI, US, 02903

Requisition ID: 17796

Brightstar is an innovative, forward-thinking global leader in lottery that builds on our renowned expertise in delivering secure technology and producing reliable, comprehensive solutions for our customers. As a premier pure play global lottery company, our best-in-class lottery operations, retail and digital solutions, and award-winning lottery games enable our customers to achieve their goals, fulfill player needs and distribute meaningful benefits to communities. Brightstar has a well-established local presence and is a trusted partner to governments and regulators around the world, creating value by adhering to the highest standards of service, integrity, and responsibility. Brightstar has approximately 6,000 employees. For more information, please visit www.brightstarlottery.com.

Responsibilities

Job Summary:

We are seeking a motivated AI Research Intern to join our dynamic team. This role is ideal for individuals passionate about artificial intelligence and eager to explore cutting-edge technologies. The intern will contribute to research on upcoming AI features, Microsoft Azure technologies, MS Copilot, and MS Power BI. Additionally, exposure to Python programming and experience with large language models (LLMs) like ChatGPT or Gemini is highly desirable.

Key Responsibilities


Conduct research on emerging AI features and technologies.
Explore and analyze Microsoft Azure technologies, MS Copilot, MS Power BI, and RAG (Retrieval Augmented Generation) architecture.
Collaborate with team members to develop insights and recommendations.
Assist in the documentation and presentation of research findings.
Engage in continuous learning to enhance technical skills and knowledge.
Support the team in various tasks related to AI initiatives.


Qualifications


Currently pursuing or recently completed a degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
Basic understanding of AI and machine learning concepts.
Familiarity with Microsoft Azure, MS Copilot, and MS Power BI.
Experience with Python programming is a plus.
Exposure to ChatGPT, Gemini, or equivalent LLM products is advantageous.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and teamwork abilities.


What You'll Gain


Gain hands-on experience in AI research and development.
Opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies.
Mentorship from experienced professionals in the field.
Flexible working hours to accommodate academic commitments.


Application Process

Interested candidates should submit their resume and a brief cover letter outlining their interest in the role and relevant experience.

Success Profile


Building collaborative relationships
Decision making
Drive results
Foster innovation
Personal energy
Self-leadership


At Brightstar, we consider a wide range of factors in determining compensation, including background, skills, experience, and work location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary. The estimated starting compensation range is $23/hr - $26/hr. The actual pay offered may end up being higher or lower. The Company will comply with all local pay requirements and collective bargaining agreements, where applicable.

Base pay is only one part of our Total Rewards program. Sales roles may be eligible for commission payments, while other roles are eligible for discretionary bonuses. In addition, we offer employees a 401(k) Savings Plan with Company contributions, health, dental, and vision insurance, life, accident, and disability insurance, tuition reimbursement, paid time off, wellness programs, and identity theft insurance. Note: programs are subject to eligibility requirements.

All Brightstar employees have a role in information security. Annual training will be assigned and required as appropriate.

Nearest Major Market: Providence

Nearest Secondary Market: Rhode Island

  • Excellent communication and teamwork abilities.

What You'll Gain

  • Gain hands-on experience in AI research and development.
  • Opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies.
  • Mentorship from experienced professionals in the field.
  • Flexible working hours to accommodate academic commitments.

Application Process

Interested candidates should submit their resume and a brief cover letter outlining their interest in the role and relevant experience.

Keys to Success

  • Building collaborative relationships
  • Decision making
  • Drive results
  • Foster innovation
  • Personal energy
  • Self-leadership

At Brightstar, we consider a wide range of factors in determining compensation, including background, skills, experience, and work location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary. The estimated starting compensation range is $23/hr - $26/hr. The actual pay offered may end up being higher or lower. The Company will comply with all local pay requirements and collective bargaining agreements, where applicable.

Base pay is only one part of our Total Rewards program. Sales roles may be eligible for commission payments, while other roles are eligible for discretionary bonuses. In addition, we offer employees a 401(k) Savings Plan with Company contributions, health, dental, and vision insurance, life, accident, and disability insurance, tuition reimbursement, paid time off, wellness programs, and identity theft insurance. Note: programs are subject to eligibility requirements.

All Brightstar employees have a role in information security. Annual training will be assigned and required as appropriate.

Nearest Major Market: Providence

Nearest Secondary Market: Rhode Island

Title: Technical Analyst - HealthEdge/HealthRules Expert
Description:
Technical Analyst - Experienced HealthEdge / HealthRules Expert




Job description




Our client in the Providence, RI area continues to expand their IT team and are currently looking for a talented Technical Analyst with¬†strong HealthEdge¬†platform:¬†HealthRules experience¬†.¬†2 to 3 years of direct, hands-on experience with HealthRules is 100% required for this position - please do not apply if you do not have HealthRules skills as your resume will not be consider.¬†Day 1, the candidate will be put to the test to discover the extent of Health Rules understanding and practices at our clients corporate offices.

This is a¬†contract-to-hire position. The candidate will work for¬†3 to 6 months as a consultant¬†and then will need to transition into a¬†full-time employee¬†of our client.

Local candidates¬†will receive top priority as the consultant role will¬†require a few days in the corporate offices¬†in the¬†Providence, Rhode Island area. Once the candidate is hired full-time, it is then required to work 4-days at the corporate office and 1-day remote.

Compensation: $50 per hour W2 / $55 per hour 1099

U.S. Citizen or Green Card holder only (absolutely no exceptions)

Weekly hours: 40 hours

On-site in the Providence, RI area (Friday's remote)

Contract-to-Hire

HealthRules candidates will only be considered

Other Skills: SQL, Jira, PowerBI




Position Overview

The Technical Analyst serves as the liaison between software development staff, IT infrastructure, planning teams, business unit stakeholders, on and offshore testing, and operations support team. This position is responsible for the creation and maintenance of technical documentation that support various design and development processes within the client's environment. The position will collaborate with multiple business lines during the design phase, delivers comprehensive solution documentation, including but not limited to architecture diagrams, process flows, technical requirements, functional design specifications, and data dictionaries. The Technical Analyst understands the solution being built at a low level and collaborates with IS staff to create a work breakdown in various planning tools such as¬†JIRA and MS Project. At times, the position may work upstream from design and development to define business requirements for projects and initiatives.




Qualifications

¬∑ Bachelor‚Äôs degree and/or years of relevant work experience and background to equate to the degree

¬∑ Two (2) + years of technical analysis experience -¬†strong Health Rules experience

¬∑ Exhibit analytical thinking skills, breaking down complex technical issues and identifying optimal solutions

¬∑ Intermediate to advanced skills in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, Visio)

Prior experience building data dictionaries using Dataedo or other automated tools

Prior experience coding or scrum experience on a .NET/SQL development team and PowerBi

Four (4) + years of technical analysis experience




Duties and Responsibilities:

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to the following:

Assessment of systems, data sources, interfaces, and processes, including participation in recommendations based on the current-state assessment.
Analyze and interpreting business data to creating better business insight and outcomes
Evaluate system changes affecting existing systems, workflows, and users. Identify potential risks, compatibility issues, and required updates. Assess benefits and drawbacks of the changes and prepare a mitigation plan for any identified risks.
Maintains a moderate understanding of the technical and functional architecture of assigned systems and integration

Gather and translate business requirements into technical specifications. Develop and enhance systems documentation.

Perform business process mapping and documents system flows using Visio and other design tools.
Attend project status meetings or standups and facilitate meetings as needed to surface roadblocks including business requirements clarifications, technical hurdles, project risks, and working cross-functionally to reach resolution and move the project forward.
Candidates should be comfortable working in a fast-paced and dynamic environment, contributing to innovative solutions, while demonstrating personal leadership, technical competence, and attention to detail
Liaison with business stakeholders, IT teams, and project managers to ensure clear communication of project objectives and deliverable
Responsible troubleshooting issues and preparing technical documentation for defects
Responsible for working with the QA team to make sure testing is performed for system issues
Knowledge of System Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and Azure DevOps CI/CD
Advise management about system innovations to improve productivity
Perform data analysis and advise on data issues

Identify and promote continuous improvements to both internal IS and business processes.

¬∑ Coordinate multiple simultaneous projects and initiatives

¬∑ Can function independently with minimal oversight and direction




Other duties as assigned

Corporate Compliance Responsibility - As an essential function, responsible for complying with client's Corporate Compliance Program, Standards of Business Conduct, applicable contracts, laws, rules and regulations, policies and procedures as it applies to individual job duties, the department, and the Company. This position must exercise due diligence to prevent, detect and report unlawful and/or unethical conduct by fellow co-workers, professional affiliates and/or agents.




Core Company-Wide Competencies:

Communicate Effectively
Respect Others & Value Diversity
Analyze Issues & Solve Problems
Drive for Customer Success
Manage Performance, Productivity & Results
Develop Flexibility & Achieve Change




Job Specific Competencies:

Build Relationships & Cultivate Networks
Attend to Detail & Improve Quality
Implement Strategy & Achieve Business and Financial Success
Exercise Sound Judgement & Decision Making

Title: Budtender

Reports directly to Dispensary Manager
Also reports to Assistant Dispensary Manager(s), and Dispensary Shift Supervisor(s)

Provide each patient/customer with best-in-class customer service

Accurately processes and dispenses cannabis to customers/patients
Stock/restock product

Maintain cleanliness of display cases and store
Operate POS system and efficiently and accurately process payments
Other duties and special projects as assigned

Minimum of 21 years of age
Possess valid driver‚Äôs license or state ID
Retail experience preferred
Cannabis knowledge preferred

Must pass all required background checks
Must be proactive, have strong work ethic and pay great attention to detail
Organizational and time management skills required
Ability to work nights, holidays, and weekends
Must be and remain compliant with any and all legal or company regulations for working in the industry
Occasionally moves up to 30+ pounds of equipment/materials/product within rooms (100 pounds with assistance)
This job function may include being in a stationary position, or moving for extended periods of time

Title: Workday Reporting Data Analyst, HR
Description:
You could be the one who changes everything for our 28 million members. Centene is transforming the health of our communities, one person at a time. As a diversified, national organization, you‚Äôll have access to competitive benefits including a fresh perspective on workplace flexibility.

Position Purpose Analyze integrated and extensive datasets to extract value, which directly impacts and influences business decisions. Work collaboratively with key business stakeholders to identify areas of value, develop solutions, and deliver insights to reduce overall cost of care for members and improve their clinical outcomes.


Interpret and analyze data from multiple sources including healthcare provider, member/patient, and third-party data.
Support execution of large-scale projects with limited direction from leadership.
Identify and perform root-cause analysis of data irregularities and present findings and proposed solutions to leadership and/or customer.
Manage multiple, variable tasks and data review processes under direct supervision within targeted timelines.
Support the design, testing, and implementation of process enhancements and identify opportunities for automation.
Support multiple functions and levels of the organization and effectively, both verbally and visually, communicate findings and insights to non-technical business partners.
Performs other duties as assigned.
Complies with all policies and standards.


Education/Experience


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in business, economics, statistics, mathematics, actuarial science, public health, health informatics, healthcare administration, finance or related field or equivalent experience.
0-2 years of experience in working with large databases, data verification, and data management.
Workday report writing experience strongly preferred.
Working knowledge of SQL/query languages.
Preferred knowledge of programmatic coding languages such as Python and R.
Knowledge of statistical, analytical, or data mining techniques including basic data modeling, trend analysis, and root-cause analysis preferred.
Preferred knowledge of modern business intelligence and visualization tools.


Centene offers a comprehensive benefits package including competitive pay, health insurance, 401K and stock purchase plans, tuition reimbursement, paid time off plus holidays, and a flexible approach to work with remote, hybrid, field or office work schedules. Actual pay will be adjusted based on an individual's skills, experience, education, and other job-related factors permitted by law, including full-time or part-time status. Total compensation may also include additional forms of incentives. Benefits may be subject to program eligibility.

Centene is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity, and values the ways in which we are different. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or other characteristic protected by applicable law.

Qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered in accordance with the LA County Ordinance and the California Fair Chance Act

Title: Junior Data Analyst ‚Äì Starcasino
Description:
Location: Grimbergen

Employment type: Full-time




About Us

Welcome to Starcasino ‚Äì Pioneers in Casino Entertainment

With over 30 years of experience, Starcasino is a leading, family-owned Belgian company in the casino and iGaming industry. Our brands‚Äîincluding Starcasino.be, Hotwin.be, Solcasino.es, and Starcasino.nl‚Äîare well known across Belgium, Spain, and the Netherlands. With more than 10 physical locations and a vibrant online presence, we're always looking for fresh energy to support our mission of delivering next-level gaming experiences.




The Role

We are looking for a Junior Data Analyst to join our data & insights team. Your primary responsibility will be to support business stakeholders with clear and actionable insights using Metabase. You'll play a key role in helping our teams make smarter decisions based on real data.




What You‚Äôll Do

Create and maintain dashboards and reports in Metabase
Work closely with marketing, product, and operations teams to provide insights and performance tracking
Analyze customer behavior, campaign performance, and platform trends
Assist in A/B testing and experiment evaluation
Ensure data quality and help optimize internal reporting processes




What We‚Äôre Looking For

A degree in a relevant field (e.g. statistics, computer science, economics, or related)
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Experience with Metabase (personal projects or internships are welcome)
Good knowledge of SQL
Eagerness to learn, ask questions, and grow within a data-driven environment
Fluent in English; Dutch or French is a plus
Must be based in Belgium and able to work in our office in Grimbergen




What We Offer

A dynamic and collaborative work environment in a growing industry
Competitive salary package with benefits
Full training and guidance from our marketing team.
A look behind the scenes of a fast-growing international company.
Work on-site in Grimbergen, with:
Free lunch every day
Unlimited snacks & drinks
A young, dynamic, and welcoming team




Ready to join the game?

Want to gain real-world data analyst experience and build your portfolio? Join our team and help shape the voice of Starcasino!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Ready to dive deep into data and make an impact as a Data Analyst?

Are you a Data Analyst with 2 to 5 years of experience? We‚Äôre looking for you!

At darwind, we welcome motivated professionals who are eager to grow and develop their skills. You'll join an environment where people, learning, and impact come first.




What will you do?

You collect, clean, and analyze large datasets to uncover trends, patterns, and insights
You create dashboards and reports that help stakeholders make better decisions
You work closely with data engineers, business teams, and other analysts to translate questions into actionable analyses
You apply statistical methods or machine learning models to support business forecasting and planning
You ensure data quality and reliability through validation and documentation
You keep learning about new tools, technologies, and methods in the world of data




Who are we looking for?

You have 2 to 5 years of experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role
You know your way around Python, SQL, and Excel, experience with R or Azure is a plus
You‚Äôve worked with data visualization tools like Power BI or Tableau
You combine analytical thinking with strong communication skills
You speak fluent Dutch and have a good knowledge of French and English
You‚Äôre curious, eager to learn, and ready to take ownership of your work




What can you expect?

Projects that match your skills and help you grow
Coaching and mentoring by experienced data professionals
Training and certifications based on your ambitions
An attractive salary package with hospitalization and group insurance, meal allowance, and the choice between a company car with fuel card or the federal mobility budget
Flexibility: work at the client‚Äôs site, at the darwind office, or from home
And most of all: joy at work, autonomy, and a team you can count on




Sounds like something for you?

Let‚Äôs talk, we‚Äôre looking forward to meeting you!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
LACO is geen doorsnee IT-bedrijf. We zijn een Belgische pionier in Data & AI, al meer dan 35 jaar. Als trotse partner van zowel SAS als Microsoft (Data & AI Solutions Partner) en specialist in Data Governance bouwen we dagelijks mee aan de groei van data-gedreven organisaties.

Wat ons √©cht onderscheidt, zijn onze mensen. Bij LACO geloven we in mensen. In connectie. In de kracht van data. Met meer dan 120 consultants begeleiden we bedrijven uit zowel de publieke als private sector in het slim inzetten van data. We geloven in lange termijn relaties met klanten √©n collega‚Äôs en werken in een business domein dat de wind in de zeilen heeft.




üõ†Ô∏è Wat je gaat doen:

Je wordt een sleutelfiguur in het realiseren van end-to-end data-oplossingen:

Je analyseert de businessbehoeften en vertaalt ze naar datagedreven oplossingen.
Je verzamelt, verwerkt en optimaliseert data uit verschillende bronnen.
Je bouwt visueel sterke en functionele dashboards in Power BI die bedrijven √©cht vooruithelpen.
Je werkt nauw samen met stakeholders en collega‚Äôs uit verschillende disciplines.
Je lost data-uitdagingen op en zet complexe datasets om in heldere inzichten.
Je blijft up-to-date met de nieuwste features binnen Power BI & Microsoft Fabric.




üéØ Wat wij zoeken:

Je hebt een bachelor of master in (toegepaste) informatica of een gelijkaardig domein.
Minstens 3 jaar ervaring als Power BI Developer of vergelijkbaar.
Je denkt analytisch, werkt oplossingsgericht en bent een teamspeler.
Je beheerst SQL, DAX en Power BI tot in de puntjes.
Je bent vertrouwd met datamodellering (Kimball, Dimensional Modeling, Data Vault).
Je weet hoe je complexe data omzet naar heldere visualisaties.




Extra punten als je ook ‚Ä¶

Ervaring hebt met Azure Synapse, Data Factory of Databricks.
Comfortabel bent met verschillende soorten datastorage.
Zowel in het Nederlands als Engels vlot communiceert.




üí° Wat wij bieden:

Een aantrekkelijk loonpakket met o.a. 32 vakantiedagen, bedrijfswagen, ‚Ä¶
Een persoonlijke opleidings- en groeitraject (met focus op certificeringen).
Flexibiliteit: of je nu als werknemer of freelancer werkt ‚Äî wij staan open voor beide.
Uitdagende projecten in een moderne Microsoft-omgeving.
Een warme bedrijfscultuur waar ook ruimte is voor fun: skitrips, familiedagen, sportactiviteiten, spelavonden ‚Ä¶




üì© Interesse of benieuwd naar meer info?

Solliciteer direct of stuur een berichtje ‚Äì ook als je gewoon vrijblijvend wil kennismaken.

We horen graag van je!

Wat ons √©cht onderscheidt, zijn onze mensen. Bij LACO geloven we in mensen. In connectie. In de kracht van data. Met meer dan 120 consultants begeleiden we bedrijven uit zowel de publieke als private sector in het slim inzetten van data. We geloven in lange termijn relaties met klanten √©n collega‚Äôs en werken in een business domein dat de wind in de zeilen heeft.


üõ†Ô∏è Wat je gaat doen:

Je wordt een sleutelfiguur in het realiseren van end-to-end data-oplossingen:

  • Je analyseert de businessbehoeften en vertaalt ze naar datagedreven oplossingen.
  • Je verzamelt, verwerkt en optimaliseert data uit verschillende bronnen.
  • Je bouwt visueel sterke en functionele dashboards in Power BI die bedrijven √©cht vooruithelpen.
  • Je werkt nauw samen met stakeholders en collega‚Äôs uit verschillende disciplines.
  • Je lost data-uitdagingen op en zet complexe datasets om in heldere inzichten.
  • Je blijft up-to-date met de nieuwste features binnen Power BI & Microsoft Fabric.


üéØ Wat wij zoeken:

  • Je hebt een bachelor of master in (toegepaste) informatica of een gelijkaardig domein.
  • Minstens 3 jaar ervaring als Power BI Developer of vergelijkbaar.
  • Je denkt analytisch, werkt oplossingsgericht en bent een teamspeler.
  • Je beheerst SQL, DAX en Power BI tot in de puntjes.
  • Je bent vertrouwd met datamodellering (Kimball, Dimensional Modeling, Data Vault).
  • Je weet hoe je complexe data omzet naar heldere visualisaties.


Extra punten als je ook ‚Ä¶

  • Ervaring hebt met Azure Synapse, Data Factory of Databricks.
  • Comfortabel bent met verschillende soorten datastorage.
  • Zowel in het Nederlands als Engels vlot communiceert.


üí° Wat wij bieden:

  • Een aantrekkelijk loonpakket met o.a. 32 vakantiedagen, bedrijfswagen, ‚Ä¶
  • Een persoonlijke opleidings- en groeitraject (met focus op certificeringen).
  • Flexibiliteit: of je nu als werknemer of freelancer werkt ‚Äî wij staan open voor beide.
  • Uitdagende projecten in een moderne Microsoft-omgeving.
  • Een warme bedrijfscultuur waar ook ruimte is voor fun: skitrips, familiedagen, sportactiviteiten, spelavonden ‚Ä¶


üì© Interesse of benieuwd naar meer info?

Solliciteer direct of stuur een berichtje ‚Äì ook als je gewoon vrijblijvend wil kennismaken.

We horen graag van je!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Permanent position only




WHAT IS CREAM ALL ABOUT?

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency‚Ä¶but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.




CREAM‚ÄôS SPECIAL RECIPE:

1/3 of Personal development
1/3 of Collective Intelligence
1/3 of Intrapreneurship

And Bonus ingredient: ‚Ä¶ Some passionate colleagues :-)




WHAT IS A DATA ANALYST AT CREAM?

As Benjamin, Data Analyst, you participate in the construction of the data strategy of our clients. You have a key role by helping them to deliver valuable insight based on their data. You are part of a challenging and multidisciplinary team.




YOUR TASKS :

You understand the business request
You dive into a large amount of data :
Collecting and interpreting data
Analyzing results
Identifying patterns and trends in data sets
Producing strategic data analysis and reporting to the business
You contribute to the selection and implementation of the different data analysis tools
In the end, you help the business to optimize the use of their data




HOW WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT:

You have at least 2-years experience in data analysis
You are passionate about data and you bring out concrete analysis to help the business
You are used to work with different data tools such as SQL, SAS, Python, R, Tableau, QlikView, PowerBI, ‚Ä¶
You have an analytical mind and inclination for problem-solving
You pay attention to details
You are fluent in French and English; good knowledge of Dutch is an asset




WHY SHOULD YOU TASTE CREAM/THE LIME FLAVOR?

A broad diversity of career options, you‚Äôre not stuck in a box
You evolve in a learning environment where you can challenge your knowledge with your colleagues
You grow in a company that is at the leading edge of technology
You have the opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving company
We have values we share, live with and experiment every day




We just hire great people and give them the playing field to become awesome!




"THE LITTLE THING THAT CAN MAKE THE DIFFERENCE,

CREAM IS DEVELOPING A DIVERSITY PLAN AND WOULD LIKE THAT ALL ITS MEMBERS REFLECT THE SOCIETY IN ALL ITS DIVERSITY"

Title: Product Data Analyst Junior
Description:
Product Data Analyst Junior




Your mission

As a Product Data Analyst, you play a key role in structuring and ensuring the quality of product data at Facq. In the short term, you will actively contribute to our strategic migration project to SAP S/4HANA, ensuring data quality, consistency, and proper integration. In the medium term, you will help implement a PIM (Product Information Management) system in collaboration with IT, e-commerce, marketing, and product teams.

This position is a great opportunity for a recent graduate who is detail-oriented, structured, and comfortable with numbers and digital tools.




Your responsibilities

Collect, structure, and analyze data from supplier contracts, pricing grids, and sales history.
Identify inconsistencies, duplicates, and anomalies in existing databases.
Create dashboards and reports (Excel, Power BI) to support decision-making.
Work closely with business and IT teams to ensure a smooth SAP migration.
Participate in data validation tests (UAT) before go-live.
Document data governance rules and cleansing processes.
Contribute to the development of new Product Data Management processes with internal teams (IT, e-commerce, product & marketing).




Your profile

Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree, ideally in business, IT, supply chain, or equivalent.
Analytical mindset, structured and quality-oriented.
Excellent command of Excel.
Comfortable with digital tools and quick to learn (SAP, AS400, Copilot AI, etc.).
Accuracy, attention to detail, and error detection skills.
Fluent in French or Dutch, with professional English.




Why join Facq?

A strategic role at the heart of the company‚Äôs digital transformation.
A supportive and dynamic team.
A stimulating environment to learn and grow.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Nexeo is currently looking for a Data Analyst (Freelance or permanent) for a market leader in the banking industry in Belgium.




Nexeo Belgium is a consultancy company that supports its clients in the banking, finance and insurance sectors in all phases of their transformation projects: from business consulting to the implementation of IT solutions.¬†




As a consultant you will have the opportunity to be part of Nexeo:

International environment ( Offices in France, Belgium, Luxembourg, Switzerland & Canada)
+ 450 employees
over 20% growth each year




The ideal candidate will use their passion for big data and analytics to provide insights to the business covering a range of topics. They will be responsible for conducting both recurring and ad hoc analysis for business users.¬†

¬†

Responsibilities

Understand the day-to-day issues that the bank faces
Performs cleansing of data quality issues through the analysi
Monitors the data quality based on data quality dashboards, supports redesign & upgrade
Contributes to designing, monitoring and reporting on common reference tools
Contributes to raising awareness of the importance of data quality
Will be involved in all the topics related to Customer Data
Business Analysis
Work in collaboration with other technical teams to share data
Data extraction with SAS
Industrialize the process to run define periodicity
Document the project (functional and technical part)
Contribute to the achievement of the team objectives

Bachelor's or Master's degree

Working in Agile environnement (Jira & Scrum)
Good experience working with SQL Queries & SAS
English Fluent & French or Dutch native

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
BettingJobs is currently working with a fast-growing iGaming company who are seeking a Business Intelligence Analyst to join their team in Cyprus.




Responsibilities:

Support internal stakeholders with appropriate data analysis and help them making decisions
Translate business needs into data requirements and closely collaborate with data engineers to ensure the right data sets are in place
Build, improve or redesign dashboards that provide stakeholders with key insights
Follow best practices in terms of data manipulation and visualisation
Answer ad hoc questions and proactively identify opportunities to drive marketing strategies and insights
Maintain & improve existing dashboards & reports
Present findings in a clear and compelling manner to both technical and non-technical audiences
Consult and train end-users to ensure high adoption of developed reports
Continuously improve reporting processes and identify opportunities for automation or optimisation




Requirements:

University degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or related field
2+ years of experience working with in analytics and data
Hands-on experience with data visualisation tools (PowerBI preferably)
Hands-on experience with SQL (database interrogation, data manipulation)
Knowledge of cloud-based data storage and processing is a plus
Understanding of KPIs and performance drivers in online businesses (iGaming experience is a must)
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to convey clear and concise messages
Detail-oriented and focused on results
Excellent communication and storytelling skills, able to influence decision-makers with data
High attention to detail, critical thinking and strong business acumen
Self-learning with a can-do attitude

Title: Data Analyst F/M/X
Description:
Who are we?

Amaris Consulting is an independent technology consulting firm providing guidance and solutions to businesses. With more than 1,000 clients across the globe, we have been rolling out solutions in major projects for over a decade ‚Äì this is made possible by an international team of 7,600 people spread across 5 continents and more than 60 countries. Our solutions focus on four different Business Lines: Information System & Digital, Telecom, Life Sciences and Engineering. We‚Äôre focused on building and nurturing a top talent community where all our team members can achieve their full potential. Amaris is your steppingstone to cross rivers of change, meet challenges and achieve all your projects with success.

At Amaris, we strive to provide our candidates with the best possible recruitment experience. We like to get to know our candidates, challenge them, and be able to give them proper feedback as quickly as possible. Here's what our recruitment process looks like:

Brief Call: Our process typically begins with a brief virtual/phone conversation to get to know you! The objective? Learn about you, understand your motivations, and make sure we have the right job for you!

Interviews (the average number of interviews is 3 - the number may vary depending on the level of seniority required for the position). During the interviews, you will meet people from our team: your line manager of course, but also other people related to your future role. We will talk in depth about you, your experience, and skills, but also about the position and what will be expected of you. Of course, you will also get to know Amaris: our culture, our roots, our teams, and your career opportunities!

Case study: Depending on the position, we may ask you to take a test. This could be a role play, a technical assessment, a problem-solving scenario, etc.

As you know, every person is different and so is every role in a company. That is why we have to adapt accordingly, and the process may differ slightly at times. However, please know that we always put ourselves in the candidate's shoes to ensure they have the best possible experience.

We look forward to meeting you!

Job Description

Are you a skilled Data Analyst ready for your next adventure? Amaris Consulting is on the lookout for a motivated individual with a strong background in data analysis and interpretation to join our Data & AI Center of Excellence in Brussels. This is a great opportunity for professionals with keen analytical abilities, a strong technical sense, and excellent communication skills.

üî• Your Responsibilities:



Collect, process, and analyze large datasets to uncover insights and trends that drive business decisions.
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to visualize data and communicate findings to stakeholders.
Collaborate with data engineers, data scientists, and business leaders to understand data needs and translate them into actionable insights.
Perform data validation and quality checks to ensure accuracy and reliability of data.
Utilize statistical methods and machine learning techniques to analyze data and predict future trends.
Provide recommendations based on data analysis to support strategic planning and operational improvements.
Maintain comprehensive documentation for data analysis processes, methodologies, and findings to support transparency and knowledge sharing.
Stay current with industry trends and emerging technologies in data analysis and business intelligence.



üéØ Your Profile:

We are seeking a candidate with a strong background in data analysis and excellent problem-solving skills. Your attention to detail and ability to simplify complex information will set you apart. You thrive in collaborative environments but can also work independently when needed.



Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Proven experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role, with a strong track record of analyzing and interpreting complex datasets.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and languages such as SQL, Python, R, and Excel.
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) and reporting solutions.
Strong understanding of statistical methods and machine learning techniques.
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and critical thinking skills.
Strong communication and presentation skills with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Proven ability to work collaboratively in a multicultural and dynamic team environment.



üöÄ Advantages:



An international learning environment.
Extensive training and certifications.
A R&D laboratory where you can develop your skills on innovative projects.
The opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving business.
Individual coaching and mentoring, as well as the chance to learn from experts for your professional and personal growth.
An attractive, tailor-made, and evolving career path.



üí° We are an independent company that values:



Agility: thrive in a flexible, dynamic, and stimulating environment.
International scope: enjoy daily international exchanges and numerous mobility opportunities in over 60 countries.
Intrapreneurship: engage in related topics or develop your own Business Unit.
Attentive management: with a limited number of consultants, your manager will adapt to your profile and support you throughout your professional journey.



Amaris Consulting is proud to be an equal-opportunity workplace. We are committed to promoting diversity within the workforce and creating an inclusive working environment. For this purpose, we welcome applications from all qualified candidates regardless of gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, beliefs, age, marital status, disability, or other characteristics.

  • Individual coaching and mentoring, as well as the chance to learn from experts for your professional and personal growth.
  • An attractive, tailor-made, and evolving career path.


üí° We are an independent company that values:


  • Agility: thrive in a flexible, dynamic, and stimulating environment.
  • International scope: enjoy daily international exchanges and numerous mobility opportunities in over 60 countries.
  • Intrapreneurship: engage in related topics or develop your own Business Unit.
  • Attentive management: with a limited number of consultants, your manager will adapt to your profile and support you throughout your professional journey.


Amaris Consulting is proud to be an equal-opportunity workplace. We are committed to promoting diversity within the workforce and creating an inclusive working environment. For this purpose, we welcome applications from all qualified candidates regardless of gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, beliefs, age, marital status, disability, or other characteristics.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
What if you could shape the future of HR decision-making?¬†

With us, your expertise won‚Äôt just sit in dashboards - it will actively support HR innovation across the entire organization.

To strengthen our HR IS team, we‚Äôre looking for a Data Analyst who thrives in a dynamic, agile environment and is eager to turn complex HR data into powerful insights.

You‚Äôll get to work on varied, business-critical HR projects with real impact - all while collaborating with a supportive and passionate team. If you love working at the intersection of data, people, and technology, this job was made for you.

Your work location: our Equans-site in Brussels

As our HR Data Analyst, you will:
translate business needs into clear analysis and reporting actions
collaborate closely with analysts with different expertise within HR
work in an agile team
act as the bridge between business and the developers
collect, clean and prepare data from multiple sources (databases, systems...)
prototype Power BI reports
evaluate results and help steer improvements
document processes, solutions and user guides
support the business during testing phases and guide them through test scenarios

Job requirements What you bring to the table
5+ years of experience in data analysis,
2+ years of experience working in agile teams
hands-on knowledge of Power BI and MS Office
experience with Azure DevOps, MS Visio, DAX or SAP BI is a plus
strong communication & social skills and a proactive mindset
analytical, independent and focused on solutions
customer-oriented and eager to keep learning
fluent in Dutch, French and English

Ready to shape the way data drives HR?

Terms of employment Want to tackle tomorrow‚Äôs multi-technical challenges with us?¬†

At Equans, you find an exciting career within a stable and financially sound company. You work on challenging, diverse projects and assist our clients with today‚Äôs three major transitions: the energy transition, the industrial transition, and the digital transition.¬†

You have the opportunity to discover cutting-edge technologies and further develop your skills.¬†

Joining Equans is more than that! You also get:¬†

a competitive salary in line with your education and experience¬†
interesting training and career opportunities¬†
group-, hospitalization-, disability insurance¬†
eco & meal vouchers, 13th month, holiday pay
concessionary travel, lease car (with fuel/charging card), parking, bicycle lease plan¬†
smartphone with subscription, internet fee¬†
additional paid leave, seniority leave, homeworking¬†
discounts through Benefits@Work (culture, sports, travel, and more)¬†

Add to that the contagious warm atmosphere at Equans, and what are you waiting for?¬†
We look forward to welcoming you!¬†

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
A leading company in the online gaming and betting industry is looking for a mid-to-senior level

Product Analyst to join their team remotely. This role focuses on supporting product teams with

analytics, reporting, and actionable insights to drive strategic decisions.




‚Ä¢ Contract: B2B in Europe or regular employment in the UK/Gibraltar

‚Ä¢ Up to ‚Ç¨70,000 / ¬£60,000




Desired experience:

‚Ä¢ 5+ years in data roles

‚Ä¢ 2+ years in iGaming or sportsbook.

‚Ä¢ Experience with R, Python, or similar for data analysis and manipulation.

‚Ä¢ Excellent SQL skills and experience building dashboards in Tableau.

‚Ä¢ Effective communicator with the capability to explain technical analyses and insights to nontechnical audiences.




Main Responsibilities:

‚Ä¢ Actively participate in business initiatives from the product perspective, including evaluating potential business impact, defining data and reporting needs, and developing frameworks to measure success.

‚Ä¢ Design and implement reporting solutions in Tableau and other tools to analyze the performance of product features, customer journeys, and behavioral metrics.

‚Ä¢ Scope, plan, and perform A/B tests and various analyses, translating results into clear, actionable recommendations for product stakeholders.

‚Ä¢ Contribute to the development and deployment of a robust analytics layer for A/B testing processes.

‚Ä¢ Take ownership of maintaining and enhancing reporting systems and dashboards used by product teams.

Title: Business & Data Analyst Healthcare
Description:
About

Functieomschrijving

HR Rail zoekt nieuwe collega's, Wil jij onze teams versterken? Ontdek de vacature hieronder en solliciteer.

Opmerking

Bedankt om te solliciteren via deze link.

Wat is jouw rol bij HR Rail?

Het team Project & IT Management (PIT) van de KGV is op zoek naar een Business & Data Analyst Healthcare om het team te versterken. Je bent verantwoordelijk voor de implementatie en het beheer van diverse projecten op het gebied van digitalisering van de geneeskundige verzorging.


Als Business & Data Analist Healthcare werk je mee aan de digitalisering van de sector geneeskundige verzorging door deel te nemen aan verschillende werkgroepen en commissies. Je stelt business requirements op voor de IT-afdeling en analyseert de impact en behoeften voor de back-office.
Je houdt toezicht op tests die worden uitgevoerd met softwarepakketten van prestatieverleners.
Je identificeert en test de door IT voorgestelde oplossingen en aanpassingen en stelt na akkoord het programma in productie. Nadien verzorg je de follow-up.
Je volgt voortdurend de ontwikkeling op het gebied van regelgeving op die binnen de KGV ge√Ømplementeerd moet worden en je analyseert de impact van deze wijzigingen in regelgeving op lopende projecten.
Je beheert individueel een breed scala aan projecten en bent specialist in je domein in samenwerking met de expert en co√∂rdinator van het team.
Je analyseert vragen en problemen , zoekt antwoorden en identificeert het onderliggend probleem met het oog op het implementeren van een oplossing op korte, middellange en lange termijn.
Je bent back-up voor je directe collega's in geval van afwezigheid (opvolging FMB‚Äôs, projectopvolging, deelname aan vergaderingen en feedback aan collega‚Äôs).


Waarom is deze job iets voor jou ?


Je bent in het bezit van een masterdiploma of gelijkwaardig door ervaring als Business & Data Analyst (minstens 3 jaar ervaring in de materie)
Je hebt een eerste relevante ervaring als Business & Data Analyst
Professionele ervaring binnen een verzekeringsinstelling (mutualiteit) of het domein gezondheidszorg is een plus.


Technische Competenties


Je kan vlot werken met de MS-Office toepassingen, voornamelijk met Word en Excel.
Je beheerst het Nederlands perfect, zowel schriftelijk als mondeling en je hebt een gevorderde kennis van het Frans (niveau B2).


Gedragscompetenties


Informatie analyseren : je bekijkt informatie vanuit een kritisch standpunt en aanvaardt informatie niet zonder er verder over na te denken.
Opvolging verzekeren : je volgt met een gepaste frequentie acties op en stuurt bij in functie van de te bereiken objectieven.
Oplossingen implementeren : je neemt het initiatief om oplossingen aan te reiken, ook in onbekende situaties. Je neemt concrete acties om problemen op te lossen en vooruit te gaan.
Continu leren : Je plant en beheert je eigen groei actief en stelt het eigen functioneren kritisch in vraag. Je verwerft continu nieuwe inzichten, vaardigheden en kennis.
Communiceren : je brengt een boodschap of gegevens op een duidelijke, correcte en transparante manier over, zowel schriftelijk als mondeling, in functie van het doel en het publiek.
Regels & procedures toepassen : Je werkt nauwkeurig en respecteert de procedures en regels.


HR Rail wil dat de sociale diversiteit weerspiegeld wordt in zijn medewerkers. Het zijn je talenten en enthousiasme die tellen, niet je geslacht, leeftijd, afkomst of handicap.

Wat mag je van ons verwachten?


Een contractuele betrekking in een innovatief en dynamisch bedrijf.
Een interessante functie met de mogelijkheid om initiatieven en verantwoordelijkheden te nemen en waarin je de kans krijgt om jouw kennis en vaardigheden te ontwikkelen en uit te breiden.
Extra legale voordelen (hospitalisatieverzekering, maaltijdcheques, enz.).
Variabele werkuren en na je opleiding mogelijkheid tot 3 dagen telewerk.
Een treinabonnement 1ste klas op het volledige Belgische netwerk.


Waar ga je werken?

HR Rail, een naamloze vennootschap van publiek recht, is de

HR-dienstverlener en juridische werkgever van alle medewerkers van de Belgische spoorwegen.

HR Rail is een samenwerkingsplek waar de klant altijd op de eerste plaats komt, waar we verantwoordelijkheid nemen en waar we bij elke procedure en elk project voortdurend de mogelijke effici√´ntie verbeteren. Dit zijn onze waarden en ons DNA, onze CORE: samenwerking, klantgerichtheid, verantwoordelijkheid en effici√´ntie.

Binnen HR Rail is de dienst Care4Rail verantwoordelijk voor het medisch-maatschappelijk beleid van de Belgische spoorwegen. Het omvat de Kas der geneeskundige verzorging (KGV), de verzekeringsinstelling van het statutaire personeel van de Belgische Spoorwegen, voor wat betreft de verplichte verzekering voor geneeskundige verzorging.

Het managementteam en het team voor project- en IT-management van de KGV zijn gevestigd in Brussel.

De regionale teams staan in voor het rechtstreeks contact met de aangeslotenen en zorgen voor de praktische uitvoering van de regelgeving rond geneeskundige verzorging, zoals het toekennen van rechten, terugbetalingen en toelatingen.

De facturatie en de contacten met zorgverleners worden centraal opgevolgd door een gespecialiseerd team in Brussel.

Jouw werkplek is gelegen vlakbij het station in Brussel (station Brussel-Zuid).

What‚Äôs next ?


Stel je kandidaat via deze link:


De inschrijvingen worden gesloten zodra wij voldoende aantal kandidaturen hebben ontvangen.


Als je na screening van jouw cv en sollicitatiebrief voldoet aan het profiel dat wij zoeken, wordt je gevraagd niet-eliminerende redeneertesten af te leggen en een online persoonlijkheidsvragenlijst in te vullen.


HR Rail behoudt zich het recht voor het aantal sollicitanten te beperken tot de profielen die het best bij de functiebeschrijving passen.


Vervolgens word je uitgenodigd voor een online interview waarin jouw belangstelling voor de functie en jouw vaardigheden en ervaring nader worden beoordeeld. Dit selectiegesprek wordt voorafgegaan door een case-study.
Als jij de kandidaat bent die wij zoeken, moet je ons nog enkele documenten bezorgen (je diploma, strafblad, ...).
Klaar voor je eerste werkdag!


Heb je nog vragen?

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
üéØ Vacature ‚Äì Microsoft Data Consultant




Ben jij klaar om het verschil te maken met data?




Bij Beyond Data Group geloven we dat betere beslissingen leiden tot betere bedrijven. Data is voor ons geen einddoel, maar een middel om √©chte impact te maken. Daarom helpen we organisaties hun data te structureren, te begrijpen √©n te activeren ‚Äî van ruwe brondata tot heldere inzichten. Met de juiste combinatie van technologie en mensen maken we data werkbaar, tastbaar en waardevol.




Over de Rol

Wil jij graag het volledige dataproces beheren ‚Äî van A tot Z ‚Äî en √©chte meerwaarde cre√´ren?




Wat ga je doen

Je bouwt schaalbare dataplatformen op Azure (Data Lake, SQL DB, Synapse, Fabric).
Je ontwikkelt en optimaliseert ETL-pijplijnen met o.a. Azure Data Factory, Databricks, Python en SQL.
Je vertaalt businessbehoeften naar werkbare dataproducten.
Je zorgt voor monitoring, data quality en robuuste pipeline-performance.

Wat breng jij mee

Minstens 3 jaar ervaring in data-projecten.
Je bent vertrouwd met Microsoft-technologie√´n zoals Power BI, Databricks, Azure Data Factory of Microsoft Fabric.
Je denkt niet in tools, maar in oplossingen.
Je neemt graag verantwoordelijkheid en werkt vlot samen met zowel technische als business stakeholders.
Interesse in AI en hoe dit data-analyse kan versterken? Top ‚Äî daar denken we graag samen over na.

Wat wij bieden

Projecten van A tot Z ‚Äî van integratie en modellering tot visualisatie.
Klanten die jou zien als een √©chte partner.
Een hecht team waarin kennisdeling en samenwerking vanzelfsprekend zijn.
Ruimte om te groeien ‚Äî technisch, inhoudelijk of richting coaching.
Mogelijkheden om je te verdiepen in actuele thema‚Äôs zoals AI, ....
Ruimte voor certificeringen en persoonlijke ontwikkeltrajecten.




Beyond Data Group is onderdeel van Select Advisory (met o.a. ARCH, Fly en Beople).

We geloven dat sterke data-oplossingen m√©√©r zijn dan technische implementaties ‚Äî ze vertellen een verhaal: wie we zijn, waar we voor staan en hoe we kunnen bijdragen aan het succes van onze klanten.

Onze klanten? Van scale-ups tot grote organisaties die investeren in een datagedreven toekomst √©n openstaan voor innovatie.

Onze aanpak? Mensgericht, technisch onderbouwd en gefocust op duurzame meerwaarde ‚Äî voor klant √©n collega.




üìç Je uitvalsbasis is Brussel, maar je kan ook werken vanuit Zaventem, Antwerpen of Luxemburg.




Klaar om mee te bouwen aan datagedreven oplossingen met impact?

üëâ Neem contact op of kom eens kennismaken. We maken graag tijd voor een goed gesprek

  • Ruimte om te groeien ‚Äî technisch, inhoudelijk of richting coaching.
  • Mogelijkheden om je te verdiepen in actuele thema‚Äôs zoals AI, ....
  • Ruimte voor certificeringen en persoonlijke ontwikkeltrajecten.


Beyond Data Group is onderdeel van Select Advisory (met o.a. ARCH, Fly en Beople).

We geloven dat sterke data-oplossingen m√©√©r zijn dan technische implementaties ‚Äî ze vertellen een verhaal: wie we zijn, waar we voor staan en hoe we kunnen bijdragen aan het succes van onze klanten.

Onze klanten? Van scale-ups tot grote organisaties die investeren in een datagedreven toekomst √©n openstaan voor innovatie.

Onze aanpak? Mensgericht, technisch onderbouwd en gefocust op duurzame meerwaarde ‚Äî voor klant √©n collega.


üìç Je uitvalsbasis is Brussel, maar je kan ook werken vanuit Zaventem, Antwerpen of Luxemburg.


Klaar om mee te bouwen aan datagedreven oplossingen met impact?

üëâ Neem contact op of kom eens kennismaken. We maken graag tijd voor een goed gesprek

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Voor een langdurige opdracht binnen een dynamische IT-omgeving zoeken we een ervaren Data Analyst die zijn of haar analytische vaardigheden wil inzetten binnen diverse Business Intelligence-projecten.




Functieomschrijving

Je zal een sleutelrol spelen in het analyseren van data en het ontwikkelen van inzichten die bijdragen aan strategische en operationele beslissingen.

Je verantwoordelijkheden omvatten onder andere:

Analyseren van grote datasets met behulp van statistische en analytische technieken
Ontwikkelen en onderhouden van duidelijke, onderhoudbare en herbruikbare datamodellen
Visualiseren van data en het vertalen ervan naar begrijpelijke rapporten en dashboards
Presenteren van inzichten aan stakeholders via heldere storytelling en visualisatietechnieken
Opzetten en implementeren van data governance processen en procedures




Profiel

Technische vaardigheden

Je beschikt over aantoonbare ervaring in de volgende domeinen:

Power BI of een vergelijkbare visualisatietool
MS SQL Server en/of MS Fabric (Data Warehousing)
SQL in functie van datamodellering
Opzetten van data governance, processen en procedures
Ervaring of kennis in Data Mesh, Git, CI/CD en Unit Testing is een plus




Soft Skills

We zoeken een professional die niet alleen sterk is in data, maar ook in samenwerking en communicatie, je bent:

In staat om complexe data-inzichten begrijpelijk over te brengen
Professioneel, correct en respectvol in je communicatie en gedrag
Vlot in het samenwerken binnen teams, met aandacht voor waarden als vriendelijkheid, betrouwbaarheid, positiviteit en verantwoordelijkheid
Ge√´ngageerd om gedurende de volledige looptijd van het project kwalitatief werk te leveren




Praktische Informatie

Locatie: Regio Brussel
Startdatum: 1 juli 2025
Contract: Freelance of consultancy
Werkregime: Voltijds
Ervaring vereist: 5 tot 10 jaar




Interesse? Solliciteer via LinkedIn.

luc@bimona.be

Title: Data Analyst (SNS02351)
Description:
Job Description

We are looking to reinforce the knowledge and application of data analytics to obtain insights within the financial market and to make data driven decisions. We want to extend the expertise and maturity of the internal data science team in the usage of analytic models for enhancing data into insight transitioning, and for evolving toward holistic data driven decision processes. For this purpose, we are looking for a senior profile having significant experience in the domain of data science with a focus on value-add, customer-centric way of working. The profile should have affinity with clean coding principles and code optimization. Capabilities in knowledge transfer, training and user support are highly recommended.

Technical Knowledge


Fundamental knowledge of statistics and data analytics, specifically in both R and Python languages
Practical experience in creating and evaluating analytic models in R and Python for data driven decision processes
Practical experience with training and support of business users within a data analytics context
Practical experience in code reviewing with regards to clean coding principles
Practical experience with analytical projects in the financial sector
Practical experience with Microsoft Power BI will be a bonus
Knowledge of (hybrid or all-in) Cloud infrastructure and services will be a bonus


Skills:


Experience in data analytics projects
Experience with code optimization and clean coding principles
Practical experience in financial sector
Python


Hiring Team Member

Sai Prashanth

Recruitment Coordinator


LinkedIn
Mail

Title: Data Analyst / Data Visualisation
Description:
Data Analyst / Data Visualisation Consultant

Who We Are

NORRIQ is a leading international consulting firm headquartered in Denmark and Belgium, with 350+ consultants driving business transformation through technology. Our Financial Services practice includes 100+ specialists supporting banks, insurers, and financial institutions in navigating regulatory challenges, embracing emerging technologies, and meeting evolving client demands. We prioritize growth, innovation, and excellence, offering abundant opportunities for professional development and collaboration.

The Opportunity

NORRIQ is seeking to grow its Data Analytics and Artificial Intelligence team with additional Data Analyst / Data Visualisation Consultants to improve the business performance of financial institutions. You will help our clients to optimize the value they can get from their internal and external data, through improved business performance monitoring and enhanced reporting quality and readability. Join us to work on impactful projects that shape the future of finance.

Responsibilities


Collecting and interpreting internal and external data about customer behaviour via the digital platforms (Web and mobile) and their digital transactions with the bank.
Translate data insight into actionable recommendations in order to coordinate the business needs around data and improve the bank‚Äôs digital and marketing strategy and optimize future campaigns.
Collect, analyze, and interpret large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and correlations
Develop and maintain complex data models, databases, data warehouses and data marts .
Create data visualizations and reports to communicate insights to stakeholders.
Perform data quality checks and ensure data integrity, develop and implement data governance policies and procedures
Stay up-to-date with industry trends and emerging technologies in data analysis and visualization


Your Profile


Master‚Äôs degree (or equivalent work experience) in mathematics or statistics, business intelligence, computer engineering, economy.
1-3 years of experience in data projects, preferably within the financial services industry.
Technical Expertise & Tooling: SQL (mandatory), SAS (nice to have), Python & R (to support our AI team), Reporting & Visualisation tools (Power BI, Tableau, Adobe Analytics, ...),.
ETL Processes: Affinity with ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes, including an understanding of data preparation, cleansing, and integration from multiple sources.
Analytical Skills: Strong problem-solving and analytical abilities to translate complex data into actionable insights.
Business Analysis Skills: Experience in requirements gathering, process design and developing action plans.
AI knowledge: AI knowledge & interest to connect easily with our data scientist and machine learning engineers.
Communication & Collaboration: Excellent communication skills; ability to work well in cross-functional teams and engage effectively with stakeholders.
Languages: Fluent in English and native in French or Dutch.


What We Offer


Dynamic Work Environment: High-impact projects with leading financial institutions in a fast-growing consulting firm.
Career Development: Continuous learning and growth opportunities to advance your career.
Collaborative Culture: A supportive, innovative team environment that encourages new ideas and professional development.
Global Exposure: International experience working on cross-border projects that shape the financial services industry.


Why Join Us?

At NORRIQ, we are shaping the future of finance through transformation and innovation. If you're passionate about improving financial processes, driving change, and delivering value to clients, this is the perfect opportunity for you.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Hello Network!







I hope you're doing well today,







We are currently looking for a Data Analyst to work for a Belgian Public Sector Client in Brussels, Belgium:







Duration: 4-5 months + extensions

Location: Brussels (Hybrid Working)

Pay Rate: Negotiable

Languages: Dutch and French B2+ Level







Job Role:







The Data Functional Data Analyst is in regular contact with the different business stakeholders (data teams and subject matter experts) to understand their business needs. He/she identify, assess and understand business processes, operational and analytics data flows (incoming and outgoing). He/she translates the business needs into data and technical requirements.
He/she designs the data architecture and validate the data models in collaboration with Data Architects.
He/she establishes the functional design for our developments in full collaboration with the Data Governance team, the Technical Leads of the BI team and the ICT teams.
He/she is in contact with the DPO to ensure full alignment with GDPR and security requirements.
The Data Functional Analyst plays also an active role in testing the data products developed.
After delivery of the product, he/she remains the key player to inform and train our users.
Even after delivery, he/she remains the liaison with the end users in order to further improve our data products.







Your Technical Skills:







Master degree in Computer Science or equivalent through experience.
Minimum 10 years of practical and professional experience in data functional analysis.
Concrete experience in data modelling (mainly conceptual an logical modelling) within a data warehouse context (preferably following the Kimball approach).
Concrete experience in designing and analysing data flows.
Prior experience as data engineer is a plus.







Questions:







I agree to come and work at the office in Brussels at least 2x a week?
I agree to telework within the Belgian borders?







If interested, or you know someone that could be please reach out and we can arrange a time to speak?

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Alken-Maes has a centralized team for Business Intelligence (BI). This team‚Äôs primary responsibility is to accelerate insights collection, creation & delivery to internal stakeholders. In this team, Business & Data Analysts work closely together. This allows us to develop fit-for-purpose solutions in a consistent manner.




What started as volume vs. market tracking, has grown into a broader mission: helping our business make better decisions, faster. The goal? Expand our impact and bring data magic to more corners of Alken-Maes, while learning from other HEINEKEN OpCos along the way.




YOUR JOB

As a Data Analyst, you help shape our ambition to become a truly data-driven company. You‚Äôll start as a key business partner for Sales & Marketing.




Here‚Äôs what you‚Äôll do:

Ensure our Power BI reports run smoothly: reliable, clear, fast, and insightful.
Constantly improve our reporting landscape: smarter data sources, better visualizations, sharper insights.
Coach colleagues to explore data on their own, turning dashboards into daily habits.







YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES




1.Make data a mindset:

Use data to support, challenge and inspire our business stakeholders with actionable information and insights about our (commercial) tactics.
Support campaigns and commercial initiatives by uncovering what (doesn‚Äôt) work through concrete numbers and clear insights.
Inspire teams with what‚Äôs possible: proactively sharing new tools, views, or data sources that could unlock smarter ways of working.
Help translate consumer behavior and commercial performance into actionable plans that grow our brands in Off-Trade (supermarkets) and On-Trade (bars, restaurants, festivals).

2. Maintain existing reporting landscape & run several data-driven projects to deliver actionable insights based on key business questions

Participate in the development of our data-driven learning agenda.
Engage a fruitful and effective collaboration with Global Analytics teams to be on top of Global models‚Äô deployment.
Maintain and improve recurring reporting in Power BI, always looking for ways to make it cleaner, faster, and more relevant.
Work closely with business stakeholders to deeply understand their needs and turn them into dashboards that help them work better.
Turn results of analytics into actionable insights.
Help business users get more confident in using dashboards, tools and insights independently.




YOUR PROFILE




You hold a Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business, IT, Analytics, Marketing or a related field.
You bring 2‚Äì4 years of professional experience, with at least 2 years hands-on in a data analyst or BI-related role.
You‚Äôre technically skilled:
SQL
Visualization Tools : Power BI preferred, others acceptable.
Microsoft Office: Excel & PowerPoint
Advanced analytics is a plus
Your experience has taught you how to:
Manage a reporting landscape: ensure quality, work on continuous improvement for recurring reporting, convert business requirements into tangible reports/dashboards.
Connect & collaborate with stakeholders: it‚Äôs the responsibility of people that speak ‚Äòdata‚Äô to communicate this simply to business stakeholders.
Take ownership of projects: own the delivery of projects.
You‚Äôre a bright analytical thinker and problem solver with eye for detail.
You‚Äôre a natural communicator: you can explain complex data to non-technical audiences with ease and confidence.
You take ownership of your work: you‚Äôre someone who gets things moving and delivers.
You are flexible in changing environments.
You have a good knowledge of English or Dutch.
Most of all: you‚Äôre curious, eager to learn and ready to grow‚Ä¶ just like us.




What's in it for you?

Trust, challenge and support from experienced managers and professionals who know how to develop people, teams and take organizations to the next level.
We are the market challenger. This means we are a dynamic, local organization; with the benefits of belonging to the larger, international HEINEKEN family.
Awesome colleagues who enjoy a refreshing Cristal or Desperados 0% after work.
The opportunity to make your mark and take the initiative. (Which, according to our colleagues, is one of the greatest advantages of working at Alken-Maes).
A coaching environment, giving you an extraordinary learning opportunity.
And of course, a competitive package and other nice conditions.
Meal vouchers
Hospitalisation plan
Group insurance
33 leave days
Mobility options

Title: Data Analist
Description:
Klaar om je vast te bijten in data en √©cht impact te maken als Data Analist?

Heb je 2 tot 5 jaar ervaring als Data Analist? Dan zijn we op zoek naar jou!

Bij darwind verwelkomen we gemotiveerde professionals die willen groeien en hun vaardigheden verder willen ontwikkelen. Je komt terecht in een omgeving waar mensen, leren en impact centraal staan.




Wat ga je doen?

Je verzamelt, zuivert en analyseert grote datasets om trends, patronen en inzichten bloot te leggen
Je bouwt dashboards en rapporten die stakeholders helpen betere beslissingen te nemen
Je werkt nauw samen met data engineers, business teams en andere analisten om vragen te vertalen naar bruikbare analyses
Je past statistische methodes of machine learning toe om voorspellingen en planning te ondersteunen
Je zorgt voor datakwaliteit en betrouwbaarheid door middel van validatie en documentatie
Je blijft jezelf ontwikkelen en ontdekt nieuwe tools, technologie√´n en methodes binnen de datawereld




Wie zoeken we?

Je hebt 2 tot 5 jaar ervaring als Data Analist of in een vergelijkbare rol
Je bent vlot met Python, SQL en Excel, ervaring met R of Azure is een plus
Je hebt gewerkt met datavisualisatietools zoals Power BI of Tableau
Je combineert analytisch denkvermogen met sterke communicatieskills
Je spreekt vloeiend Nederlands en hebt een goede kennis van Frans en Engels
Je bent nieuwsgierig, leergierig en neemt graag verantwoordelijkheid




Wat mag je verwachten?

Projecten die aansluiten bij jouw talenten en groeipad
Coaching en begeleiding van ervaren data-experts
Opleidingen en certificeringen op maat van jouw ambities
Een aantrekkelijk salarispakket met hospitalisatie- en groepsverzekering, maaltijdvergoeding en de keuze tussen een bedrijfswagen met tankkaart of het federaal mobiliteitsbudget
Flexibiliteit: werk bij de klant, op het darwind-kantoor of van thuis uit
En vooral: werkplezier, autonomie en een team waarop je kan rekenen




Klinkt dit als iets voor jou?

Laat van je horen, we kijken ernaar uit je te ontmoeten!

  • Coaching en begeleiding van ervaren data-experts

  • Een aantrekkelijk salarispakket met hospitalisatie- en groepsverzekering, maaltijdvergoeding en de keuze tussen een bedrijfswagen met tankkaart of het federaal mobiliteitsbudget

  • En vooral: werkplezier, autonomie en een team waarop je kan rekenen


Klinkt dit als iets voor jou?

Laat van je horen, we kijken ernaar uit je te ontmoeten!
