Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About This Vacancy

This role focuses on managing, organizing, and analyzing data to ensure smooth operations and informed decision-making. You‚Äôll work closely with teams across the organization to maintain the accuracy and security of data systems, ensuring compliance with company standards.


Organize data from multiple sources to ensure consistency and accuracy.
Analyze data to uncover trends, patterns, and insights that support business decision-making.
Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations to communicate findings effectively to stakeholders.
Identify inefficiencies in data workflows and recommend process enhancements to improve data quality and system performance.
Work closely with cross-functional teams to understand their data needs and deliver actionable insights.


What We Expect From You


Master's degree in IT, Data Science, Statistics or Applied Mathematics or a related field.
Interest in data analysis role
Proficiency in Python and Excel is essential.
Fluency in both Dutch and French is mandatory.


What You Can Expect From Us

TMC is an international high-tech consultancy company that brings expertise to its clients in order to support them with the realization of their technological challenges. As such, TMC is operating as an expert center at the disposition of its clients and we help them to be more competitive in an ever more global and faster-changing technological world. At TMC we believe that people are the driving force behind technological innovation. That is why we want to create the best possible conditions for tech talents to thrive in.

We offer you a challenging and stimulating work environment in which you can be the director of your own career. As an Employeneur you are part of our TMC family.

ÔªøNext to our outstanding technical expertise, fun and engagement are meaningful parts of our culture.

Ôªø

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Permanent position only




WHAT IS CREAM ALL ABOUT?

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency‚Ä¶but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.




CREAM‚ÄôS SPECIAL RECIPE:

1/3 of Personal development
1/3 of Collective Intelligence
1/3 of Intrapreneurship

Bonus ingredient: ‚Ä¶ Some passionate colleagues üòÄ




WHAT IS A BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE ANALYST AT CREAM?

As Teddy, Business Analyst Business Intelligence, translate the BI needs of the business teams in specifications for the IT department, for both small demands or as part of larger projects (contributions or BI project).




YOUR TASKS :

Act as person of contact between Business Engineering Teams and the Development Team
Define the business specifications for BI needs
Participation in (or management of) BI projects, or on the BI tracks of other projects for the engineering activities (requirement definition, impact analysis, process definition), while representing the BI vision (and BI target architecture) that has been defined
Collaboration with data delivery experts to deliver on projects
Understand business requirements and build a functional analysis which covers needs of the business according to our BI reference architecture
Collaborate with the development team




HOW DO WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT?

You have a Master degree in Computer Sciences or equivalent by experience
You have good knowledge in BI techniques and tools (BO, SAS, Cognos...)
You have a cultural openness and adaptability, you are rigorous, customer oriented, and you have high communication skills and analytical skills
You are polyvalent and can adapt easily to quickly changing environment
You are capable to think out of the box and maintain in the meantime a pragmatic approach
You are able to work with autonomy while being also a great team player
You are fluent in French and English; a good knowledge of Dutch is also required
You are committed to travelling abroad occasionally upon the client‚Äôs request

Bonus

An experience in concepts: ETL, DWHSE, data & process mining, reporting‚Ä¶ could be a real asset




WHY SHOULD YOU TASTE CREAM/THE LIME FLAVOUR?

A broad diversity of career options: you‚Äôre not stuck in a box
You evolve in a learning environment where you can challenge your knowledge with your colleagues
You grow in a company that is at the leading edge of technology
You have the opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving company
We have values we share, live with, experiment every day
We just hire great people and give them the playing field to become awesome!




"THE LITTLE THING THAT CAN MAKE THE DIFFERENCE,

CREAM IS DEVELOPING A DIVERSITY PLAN AND WOULD LIKE THAT ALL ITS MEMBERS REFLECT THE SOCIETY IN ALL ITS DIVERSITY"

Title: üî•Senior Data Analystüî• - Power BI
Description:
üî•Senior Data Analyst

üìçBrussels

üö®4yr Contract üö®üö®

üí∑ Strong Day Rate

üëÄDutch and French and English speaking




A prestigious global consultancy located in Brussels seeking a Senior Data Analyst for a significant engagement..




Role Summary:

Senior Data Analyst to analyse data using statistical and analytical techniques, obtain insights, and support data-driven decisions. The role involves developing maintainable data models and implementing data modelling governance with associated processes and procedures. The analyst must possess strong data visualisation and storytelling skills to present findings clearly to clients. Optional experience with Git, CI/CD, unit testing, or data mesh is advantageous.







Job Description:

Analyse complex datasets using statistical and analytical techniques to generate actionable business insights
Develop and maintain robust, scalable data models that are easily understood and utilised by stakeholders
Create compelling data visualisations and narratives to communicate findings effectively to clients and management
Establish and implement data modelling governance frameworks, processes, and procedures
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to support data-driven decision making across various BI projects
Ensure data quality, integrity, and compliance with organisational standards
Present analytical findings and recommendations to both technical and non-technical audiences




Requirements:

3yrs+ experience with Power BI
3yrs+ experience with MS SQL Server and/or MS Fabric Data Warehouse
3yrs+ experience with SQL in the context of data modelling -
Implementing data modelling governance

Title: Freelance Data Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a freelance Data Analyst to strengthen our Microsoft-Team at one of our clients in the automotive industry!




LACO is a Belgium-based company specializing in business intelligence and data analytics, with over 35 years of expertise. We are a Microsoft Data & AI Solutions Partner with extensive expertise in various areas, including Microsoft BI and Data Governance. We blend dedication with a dash of fun in everything we do.




Within LACO, we highly value building long-term relationships with both our clients and colleagues. Recently, we have secured several major projects with key clients, and we are seeking reinforcements for our Microsoft team to successfully deliver end-to-end solutions as part of a dedicated LACO team.




YOUR JOB




As a Medior Data Analyst you will:

Reverse engineer the current Databricks environment to Microsoft Fabric
Data Analysis




YOUR SKILLS




3 to 5 years of experience as a Data Analyst
Strong knowledge of SQL and Power BI
Experience with Data Vault modelling and data marts
Knowledge of the medallion structure
Fluent in English and French or Dutch




Interested to learn more? Contact us via our website or careers@laco.be!

Title: Data Analyst (Insurance sector)
Description:
Your Role as a Data Analyst: Turning Data into Impact in the Insurance Sector



This role is about more than just numbers - it's about insight, direction, and results. As a Data Analyst, you play a key role in transforming complex datasets into actionable insights that directly influence decision-making within the insurance industry.

You understand the unique dynamics of the sector - from risk analysis and claims management to customer segmentation and premium setting. Your analyses help identify trends, optimize processes, and improve customer understanding.



What You'll Be Doing



Collect and prepare data from various sources, ensuring it's clean, reliable, and analysis-ready.

Use statistical techniques to uncover trends, correlations, and outliers in the data.

Build dashboards and reports that present complex findings in a clear and visual way.

Communicate your insights effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

Collaborate with teams to apply data to strategic and operational decision-making.



Why You're the Right Fit



You're analytical, technically skilled, and thrive in a data-driven environment. What sets you apart is your knowledge of the insurance sector - you understand how data impacts areas like pricing, policy management, risk evaluation, and customer behavior.

Beyond the technical side, you ask the right questions and know how to present your findings in a way that makes sense to business stakeholders. You're not just crunching numbers - you're creating clarity.



What We're Looking For



Proven experience in the insurance industry is a must

Solid skills in SQL; knowledge of Python or R is a strong plus

Experience with visualization tools like Power BI, Tableau, or similar

Understanding of data warehousing, data modeling, and statistical methods

A bachelor's or master's degree in a quantitative field (statistics, mathematics, computer science, etc.)

Fluent in Dutch or French, with a good command of English



What You Can Expect from Us



You'll be part of a professional, data-focused environment where your work has immediate impact. Within the insurance sector, your insights play a vital role in how organizations manage risk, improve processes, and serve clients. We offer plenty of room for personal development, innovation, and learning - all within a collaborative and ambitious team.

Title: Business Intelligence & Analytics Lead
Description:
üìÑ Type: Full-time | üìä Experience: Mid-Senior (4-7 years experience)




At Semetis, we turn data into business growth. We are looking for a Business Intelligence & Analytics Lead to bridge the gap between raw data, marketing intelligence, and strategic decision-making. You will be at the heart of our strategic department, ensuring insights drive real marketing and business impact.




Your Mission:

Translate complex data into actionable insights for marketing and business decisions.
Scope and optimize analytics, measurement, and dashboarding projects for top clients.
Work closely with consultants and leadership to define and refine key business KPIs.
Ensure data quality, build meaningful reports, and provide strategic recommendations.
Coach and train teams, fostering a strong data-driven culture at Semetis.




What You Bring:

4-7 years experience in analytics, data insights, measurement, or BI.
Expertise in web analytics (GA4, Adobe Analytics, Piwik Pro) and dashboarding (Looker, Power BI, Tableau).
Understanding of business KPIs, ensuring analytics drive marketing and revenue growth.
Strong autonomy and ownership, able to take initiative and drive projects forward.
Some SQL knowledge (or willingness to learn) and familiarity with cloud solutions (Google Cloud, AWS, Azure).
Critical thinker, able to assess what analytics services should and shouldn‚Äôt be offered.




Why Join Semetis?

At Semetis, we do more than analyse data‚Äîwe turn it into a competitive advantage. As Belgium‚Äôs leading digital agency, we are known for our expertise, innovation, and strong market presence. We are on a mission to push the boundaries of marketing intelligence, shaping the way brands make data-driven decisions.




This is a role with real business impact. You will work closely with leadership, ensuring that analytics isn‚Äôt just a reporting tool but a driver of strategic growth. We operate in a fast-moving, entrepreneurial environment where bold ideas, innovation, and experimentation are encouraged. Unlike traditional agencies, Semetis fosters a culture of autonomy, giving you the space to take ownership and make a tangible difference.




If you are passionate about turning analytics into actionable business impact, we would love to hear from you.




Full job description & application details here.




Ready to make an impact? Let‚Äôs talk.

Title: Data-analist
Description:
Vacature: Data Analist (Freelance)




Wij zoeken een ervaren Data Analist voor een uitdagende opdracht binnen een organisatie met een sterke maatschappelijke impact. Het team waarin je terechtkomt is verantwoordelijk voor het leveren van rapporten en dashboards waarmee het management en diverse teams inzichten verkrijgen om prestaties te monitoren en problemen vroegtijdig te signaleren. Daarnaast lever je data aan voor strategische beslissingen en ondersteun je AI-initiatieven door relevante datasets beschikbaar te stellen.




Jouw verantwoordelijkheden

Ontwikkelen en verbeteren van interactieve dashboards en rapportages.
Analyseren van complexe datasets om trends en inzichten te ontdekken.
Aanspreekpunt zijn voor de business binnen een functioneel domein.
Co√∂rdineren van werkzaamheden binnen een team van ¬±5 personen.
Vertalen van business requirements naar technische analyses en documentatie.
Ondersteunen van strategische besluitvorming door middel van datagedreven advies.
Samenwerken met agile teams en bijdragen aan sprintplanning, story refinement en backlogbeheer.




Gevraagd profiel




Essentieel:

Minimaal 3 jaar ervaring als Data Analist of in een vergelijkbare rol.
Sterke kennis van SQL (zelfstandig queries schrijven).
Ervaring met het opstellen van dashboards en rapportages (bijvoorbeeld met MicroStrategy, OBI of vergelijkbare BI-tools).
Begrip van data-analyse-architecturen (ETL, data warehouses, event-driven systemen).
Ervaring met data modelleren (3NF, data vault, dimensioneel).
Kennis van Agile en Scrum (story point estimatie, backlog, refinement).
Ervaring met Jira en Confluence.
Analytisch sterk, probleemoplossend vermogen en goede communicatieskills.
Vloeiend in Nederlands, met een goede beheersing van Engels.




Gewenst:

Ervaring met unstructured data en grote datavolumes.
Kennis van data virtualisatietools en event-driven architectuur.
Basiskennis van Python (code kunnen lezen).
Ervaring met SAS (Enterprise Guide), Kafka en Apache NiFi.
Kennis van ODI (Oracle Data Integrator) is een plus.
Ervaring in de rol van Product Owner binnen een agile team.
Inzicht in trends en evoluties binnen data-analyse.




Pluspunten:

Kennis van de arbeidsmarktcontext is een troef.
Ervaring in een adviserende rol naar management en stakeholders.
Hands-on ervaring met AI-initiatieven en data-ondersteuning.




Wat bieden wij?

Een langdurig freelance project met maatschappelijke impact.
Samenwerking met een professioneel, multidisciplinair team.
Een omgeving waarin innovatie en data centraal staan.
Mogelijkheid tot hybride werken (deels onsite, deels remote).




Interesse?

Stuur je CV en een korte motivatie. We nemen snel contact met je op.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
What if you could shape the future of HR decision-making?

With us, your expertise won‚Äôt just sit in dashboards - it will actively support HR innovation across the entire organization.

To strengthen our HR IS team, we‚Äôre looking for a Data Analyst who thrives in a dynamic, agile environment and is eager to turn complex HR data into powerful insights.

You‚Äôll get to work on varied, business-critical HR projects with real impact - all while collaborating with a supportive and passionate team. If you love working at the intersection of data, people, and technology, this job was made for you.

Your work location our Equans-site in Brussels

As our HR Data Analyst, you will


translate business needs into clear analysis and reporting actions
collaborate closely with analysts with different expertise within HR
work in an agile team
act as the bridge between business and the developers
collect, clean and prepare data from multiple sources (databases, systems...)
prototype Power BI reports
evaluate results and help steer improvements
document processes, solutions and user guides
support the business during testing phases and guide them through test scenarios



What You Bring To The Table


5+ years of experience in data analysis,
2+ years of experience working in agile teams
hands-on knowledge of Power BI and MS Office
experience with Azure DevOps, MS Visio, DAX or SAP BI is a plus
strong communication & social skills and a proactive mindset
analytical, independent and focused on solutions
customer-oriented and eager to keep learning
fluent in Dutch, French and English



Ready to shape the way data drives HR?

Want to tackle tomorrow‚Äôs multi-technical challenges with us?

At Equans, you find an exciting career within a stable and financially sound company. You work on challenging, diverse projects and assist our clients with today‚Äôs three major transitions the energy transition, the industrial transition, and the digital transition.

You have the opportunity to discover cutting-edge technologies and further develop your skills.

Joining Equans is more than that! You also get


a competitive salary in line with your education and experience
interesting training and career opportunities
group-, hospitalization-, disability insurance
eco & meal vouchers, 13th month, holiday pay
concessionary travel, lease car (with fuel/charging card), parking, bicycle lease plan
smartphone with subscription, internet fee
additional paid leave, seniority leave, homeworking
discounts through Benefits@Work (culture, sports, travel, and more)



Add to that the contagious warm atmosphere at Equans, and what are you waiting for?

We look forward to welcoming you!

Does this description fit you and would you like more information? Contact our HR colleague Erwin Verniers - 02 370 30 62 - erwin.verniers@external.equans.com - https//www.linkedin.com/in/erwin-verniers

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
P2P.org is the largest institutional staking provider with a TVL of over $10B and a market share exceeding 20% in restaking.

We are continually focused on researching and improving our infrastructure to extract maximum APR while enhancing security. For instance, in ETH and SOL, our NRR is on average 10% higher than the market, and in DOT, it's 20% higher.

We also place significant focus and resources on launching new networks such as TON, Avail, Monad, Babylon, Story, Berachain, and others, along with yield products. From restaking, where we are the largest operator with a 20+% market share, to yield aggregators on stablecoins.

Our clients include BitGo, Copper, Crypto.com, Ledger, ByBit, Bitget, OKX, HTX, Bitvavo, SBI, and others, who choose us for our client-centric approach and extensive product line from unified API to widgets and custom dApps.

We are also actively expanding our product line, exploring RWA, data, yield, and service products for banks, exchanges, custodians, and wallets.

P2P.org unites talented individuals globally ‚ù§Ô∏è

Despite our distributed team, we share a passion for decentralized finance - a fairer system for all. We code, learn, create, and connect to shape finance's future üí∞

P2P.org boasts a strong reputation and network. We prioritize customer satisfaction and, as tech enthusiasts, develop innovative solutions that bolster our brand.

You will


Analyze large, complex datasets (on-chain and off-chain) to derive strategic and product insights
Develop models and dashboards to monitor validator performance, user behavior, and protocol performance
Investigate network economics, user incentives, and staking flows to support growth strategies, research new revenue opportunities
Conduct exploratory and root-cause analysis of ecosystem or performance changes
Build data tools and reporting frameworks to scale internal decision-making
Present insights and data stories clearly to technical and non-technical audiences


You have


5+ years of experience in data analysis, strategy, or research roles in tech, fintech, or crypto
Proficiency in advanced SQL and Python (must be comfortable working with large, complex datasets)
Strong business acumen and problem-solving skills ‚Äì ability to work from ambiguous problem statements to clear recommendations
Excellent written and verbal communication skills (English)
Experience with data visualization tools like Superset, Metabase, Looker, or Tableau
Bachelor's or Master‚Äôs degree in Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, or related field


Nice to have


Prior work in Web3, or an active interest in the crypto space
Experience with blockchain data platforms: Dune Analytics, The Graph, Flipside, etc.
Exposure to staking protocols, validator infrastructure, or DeFi analytics
Experience of building data pipelines with tools like dbt, airflow etc.


At P2P.org we have a team of experts with their own unique approach and ownership culture. Together we gain experience and make dreams come true! üåü


Full-time Contractor (Indefinite-term Consultancy Agreement)
Competitive salary level in $ (we can also pay in Crypto)
Well-being program
Mental Health care program
Compensation for education, including Foreign Language & professional growth courses
Equipment & co-working reimbursement program
Overseas conferences, community immersion
Positive and friendly communication culture


P2P.org is committed to providing equal opportunities. All applicants will be considered without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, or disability.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We're looking for a seasoned Data Analyst to support our client in strengthening their data-driven decision-making capabilities. You will play a key role in enhancing the maturity and impact of their internal analytics initiatives, working alongside a growing data science team. The role focuses on delivering real business value through data modeling, user enablement, and clean, maintainable code.

Key Responsibilities


Translate complex data into actionable insights for decision-making processes.
Build and evaluate analytical models using Python and R to support strategic goals.
Review and optimize codebases, applying clean coding principles and best practices.
Coach and support business users in adopting analytical tools and data-driven practices.
Contribute to the expansion of a customer-focused data science culture across the organization.



Technical Profile


Strong foundation in statistics and data analytics.
Proficient in both R and Python, with proven experience in model development.
Skilled in code reviews and performance optimization.
Experienced in business user training and support within a data context.
Background in analytical work within the financial sector is a strong asset.
Knowledge of Power BI and cloud services (hybrid or full cloud) is considered a bonus.



Ideal Candidate


Communicative team player with a proactive mindset.
Capable of transferring knowledge and enabling others through training and support.
Language requirements: Fluent in either Dutch or French, with working knowledge of the second language. English is also required.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
ü§ñ The Job

As a Data Analyst within Dataroots, you'll be a key player in a team bridging the gap between business and data teams. Under the guidance of experienced data consultants, you'll display your passion for translating business needs into tangible data and AI-driven solutions. You'll gather business requirements from clients, identify and assess the necessary data, and build or collaborate to build and deploy effective data solutions.

Your role will extend beyond technical expertise as you translate complex outcomes into business impact, presenting results to stakeholders in clear and understandable terms. Along the way, you'll contribute to developing the right capabilities and governance structures within organisations, ensuring that data solutions deliver sustainable long-term value.




‚úÖ Key Responsibilities:

Collect, clean, and analyze large datasets to extract meaningful insights.
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports for data visualization.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business needs and translate them into data-driven solutions.
Identify trends, patterns, and anomalies to support strategic decision-making.
Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and integrity across various sources.
Optimize data processes and workflows for efficiency and scalability.
Support data-driven decision-making by providing actionable recommendations.
Work with cross-functional teams to integrate data insights into business processes.
Stay updated on industry trends, tools, and best practices in data analytics.




üéâ What you can expect at Dataroots?

Dataroots, a vibrant and dynamic data consulting company founded in 2016, stands out with its unique expertise in the data realm. We are committed to nurturing a culture that prioritises team well-being, diversity, knowledge sharing, and outstanding customer experiences, which has fueled our sustained and robust growth. As a Data Analyst at Dataroots, you'll be an essential part of our mission, playing a key role in developing and implementing data-driven solutions for our clients.




Job requirements




üîé The profile

You have at least 2 years experience.
You have worked on a data visualisation project in a professional setting.
You are excited about the potential of data, AI, and digital to solve real-world problems.
You have either a business degree and a technical affinity or a technical degree and a business affinity.
You are curious and possess a healthy dose of drive and ambition.




üí™ The Skills

You have a good overview of the (big-)data ecosystem and know how different components fit in a data engineering or machine learning solution.
You have experience in working with Power BI in a professional setting.
You have experience with programming languages such as SQL, Python, R and cloud platforms AWS, GCP and Azure.
You understand how to collect and identify business requirements and translate these into functional requirements and acceptance criteria.
You possess both strong technical abilities and soft skills to align technical- and business stakeholders and drive change.

ü§ñ The Job

As a Data Analyst within Dataroots, you'll be a key player in a team bridging the gap between business and data teams. Under the guidance of experienced data consultants, you'll display your passion for translating business needs into tangible data and AI-driven solutions. You'll gather business requirements from clients, identify and assess the necessary data, and build or collaborate to build and deploy effective data solutions.

Your role will extend beyond technical expertise as you translate complex outcomes into business impact, presenting results to stakeholders in clear and understandable terms. Along the way, you'll contribute to developing the right capabilities and governance structures within organisations, ensuring that data solutions deliver sustainable long-term value.


‚úÖ Key Responsibilities:

  • Collect, clean, and analyze large datasets to extract meaningful insights.
  • Develop and maintain dashboards and reports for data visualization.
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business needs and translate them into data-driven solutions.
  • Identify trends, patterns, and anomalies to support strategic decision-making.
  • Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and integrity across various sources.
  • Optimize data processes and workflows for efficiency and scalability.
  • Support data-driven decision-making by providing actionable recommendations.
  • Work with cross-functional teams to integrate data insights into business processes.
  • Stay updated on industry trends, tools, and best practices in data analytics.

Dataroots, a vibrant and dynamic data consulting company founded in 2016, stands out with its unique expertise in the data realm. We are committed to nurturing a culture that prioritises team well-being, diversity, knowledge sharing, and outstanding customer experiences, which has fueled our sustained and robust growth. Title: Data Quality Analyst
Description:
Unleash your data quality enthusiasm!




Do you have the supernatural ability to turn raw data into gold? Are you passionate about data and convinced that data quality is the key enabler for organizations to create value from their data? If so, brace yourself, because LACO has a data-driven adventure tailor-made for you! As our Data Quality Analyst, you'll be the Sherlock Holmes of numbers, deciphering business requirements like clues in a mystery novel. You'll be the architect of insights, sculpting data into strategies that steer the ship.




YOUR JOB

As a Data Quality Analyst, you‚Äôll support our clients with their data quality needs:




Gather and analyse data from different sources to identify inconsistency and trends.
Identifying data quality issues and clearly communicate their business impact
Clean the data and identify the route causes of data quality issues
Design and build data quality controls to support data stewards and other business stakeholders
Build data quality dashboards to monitor the overall data quality
Working closely with stakeholders to gather and understand data requirements, ensuring data accuracy and consistency.
Working closely with cross-functional teams and leveraging your expertise in Power BI, data quality frameworks and data platforms
Designing, optimizing, and developing Power BI reports and dashboards to meet business needs and requirements.
Troubleshooting and resolving data quality issues by identifying root causes and implementing solutions.
Staying up to date with the latest technologies and best practices to excel in this role.




YOUR SKILLS




You have a Bachelor's and/or Master's degree in computer science or equivalent experience.
You have good communication skills, used to work with business stakeholders.
You have an analytical mindset for analysing business requirements.
You have proven experience with data quality projects.
You are familiar with data quality tool like Azure Purview (Collibra, Informatica, Soda)
You know all about the SQL.
You have experience in Power BI, including DAX, data modelling techniques, minimum Star Schemas (Kimball) and others are nice to have.
You are fluent in Dutch and/or French and English.




OUR OFFER




Receive an attractive salary package, including a company car, along with excellent benefits.
Training opportunities to enhance your knowledge and advance your career in your chosen field.
Get involved in innovative Microsoft tracks that challenge and inspire you.
Guided by our expert LACO coaches, you'll have the support and motivation to grow and build a sustainable career.
We practice participative management, as we extend a warm invitation to you to embrace ownership and play an active role in shaping both your future and that of LACO.
Have a say in which project placement you‚Äôll get, enabling you to work remotely, in the office, in a hybrid fashion, or based on your geographical preferences.
A great company culture with room for fun events such as: family day, yearly ski trip, sports events, game nights, ‚Ä¶




ABOUT US




So step into the world of LACO, because we're not just your average Belgian-based business intelligence and data analytics company. We're the superheroes of many realms including Microsoft, SAS and Data Advisory, which earned us the rank of Microsoft Data & AI Solutions Partner. With a squad of over 120 consultants, we're on a mission to unravel the secrets of data and lead businesses from all walks of life through the digital wilderness. Join LACO, and you're not just an employee: you're family. We blend dedication with a dash of fun in everything we do, making every day at LACO a thrilling adventure.




Don't let this opportunity slip through your data fingers! Get in touch with our recruiters and embark on your adventure to success. Hurry up and smash that button, before your dream job becomes someone else's journey!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Location: Brussels, Belgium (Hybrid) (2-3 days/week onsite)

Languages: (French or Dutch) & English

Contract duration: until 31/12/2025 (4 months)




Job Description:

The Client is looking to reinforce the knowledge and application of data analytics to obtain insights within the financial market and to make data driven decisions.
The Client wants to extend the expertise and maturity of the internal data science team in the usage of analytic models for enhancing data into insight transitioning, and for evolving toward holistic data driven decision processes.
For this purpose, we are looking for a profile having significant experience in the domain of data science with a focus on value-add, customer-centric way of working.




Required Experience:

Fundamental knowledge of statistics and data analytics, specifically in both R and Python languages
Experience in data analytics projects
Python
Practical experience in creating and evaluating analytic models in R and Python for data driven decision processes
Practical experience with training and support of business users within a data analytics context
Practical experience in code reviewing with regards to clean coding principles
Practical experience with analytical projects in the financial sector
Practical experience with Microsoft Power BI will be a bonus
Knowledge of (hybrid or all-in) Cloud infrastructure and services is a plus

Title: Product Data Analyst
Description:
At Phrase, we help open the door to global business by providing the world‚Äôs most comprehensive localization platform.

We‚Äôre transforming language technology with our AI platform to give people the content they need, in the language they speak. Whether it's for digital products like an app or website, marketing comms, legal literature, internal comms or customer service messaging, Phrase ensures that content always hits its mark by being on brand, consistent, and culturally resonant.

With a global team working from our offices in Hamburg and Prague‚Äîor from home across Europe, the UK, the US, and the APAC region‚Äîwe help organizations like Uber, Shopify, Puma, Snowflake, Volkswagen and thousands of others engage their customers at scale to accelerate growth.

As a Product Data Analyst at Phrase, you will play a pivotal role in guiding product prioritization through data-driven insights. You will collaborate closely with Product Managers to implement analytics functionalities that empower our customers to make informed decisions. You will influence the development of data products for customers, participate in strategic discussions, respond to input from our customers to address their needs.Your work will be instrumental in bringing our Product vision to life and driving the success of Phrase's innovative localization solutions.




What you‚Äôll be responsible for:




Collaborate with Product Managers to identify data needs and translate them into actionable insights.
Develop and implement analytics functionalities within the Control Hub domain to support data-driven decision-making for customers.
Conduct detailed statistical analyses and data visualizations to inform product strategy and prioritization.
Manage competing priorities while navigating a high-context-switching environment.
Collaborate with customers to understand their data needs and gather feedback to help improve the product continuously.
Work closely with the BI/Data team and other stakeholders to ensure data integrity and optimize analytics solutions.
Influence strategic decision-making by providing evidence-based insights and recommendations.




What you need:




Proven experience in analytical thinking and problem-solving within a product-oriented environment.
Proficiency in data visualization, statistical analysis, and SQL.
Hands-on experience with data tools and platforms commonly used for product analytics.
Detail-oriented mindset with the ability to manage competing priorities effectively.
A strategic mindset with a basic understanding of product management principles.
Excellent communication skills and the ability to influence stakeholders across teams.
Experience in customer-facing roles or participating in customer calls is a plus.




What you‚Äôll get:




Work experience in a successful and growing global SaaS company
Be part of an international team of 300+ in Europe, APAC, and the Americas
Expert colleagues in their field who are determined to build the best localization platform on the market, creating a world where language never limits opportunity
An agile work environment, where it is encouraged to take smart risks
Take part in a culture full of trust, support and loyalty, where respectful and open feedback is valued, and diversity is fully embraced
A positive, open-minded, and innovative atmosphere
Support in your professional development and personal career goals




What's on top:




4 Company holidays additional to your regular holidays (1 day per quarter where the entire company is off to celebrate our achievements).
In addition, the company also provides employees with a Christmas break to allow you to spend time with family and friends without use of your vacation allocation.
Your birthday is off because it is important to celebrate you as well.
2 Giveback days where you can support the local community, volunteer, and/or participate in charity events and activities.
Professional and extensive onboarding.
Learning & development through Phrase learning and a dedicated ChatGPT Plus user license
Additional local benefits depending on the entity you're hired at, just ask your Talent Acquisition Partner




At Phrase we believe in the critical importance of diversity in all its forms and intersectionalities, and are committed to ensuring that the people we interview reflect this diversity. We value and welcome different perspectives, experiences and backgrounds as we believe that these differences make our team even stronger on our mission of opening the door to global business by giving everybody access to the content they need in the language they speak.

At Phrase, we help open the door to global business by providing the world‚Äôs most comprehensive localization platform.

We‚Äôre transforming language technology with our AI platform to give people the content they need, in the language they speak. Whether it's for digital products like an app or website, marketing comms, legal literature, internal comms or customer service messaging, Phrase ensures that content always hits its mark by being on brand, consistent, and culturally resonant.

With a global team working from our offices in Hamburg and Prague‚Äîor from home across Europe, the UK, the US, and the APAC region‚Äîwe help organizations like Uber, Shopify, Puma, Snowflake, Volkswagen and thousands of others engage their customers at scale to accelerate growth.

As a Product Data Analyst at Phrase, you will play a pivotal role in guiding product prioritization through data-driven insights. You will collaborate closely with Product Managers to implement analytics functionalities that empower our customers to make informed decisions. You will influence the development of data products for customers, participate in strategic discussions, respond to input from our customers to address their needs.Your work will be instrumental in bringing our Product vision to life and driving the success of Phrase's innovative localization solutions.


What you‚Äôll be responsible for:


  • Collaborate with Product Managers to identify data needs and translate them into actionable insights.
  • Develop and implement analytics functionalities within the Control Hub domain to support data-driven decision-making for customers.
  • Conduct detailed statistical analyses and data visualizations to inform product strategy and prioritization.
  • Manage competing priorities while navigating a high-context-switching environment.
  • Collaborate with customers to understand their data needs and gather feedback to help improve the product continuously.
  • Work closely with the BI/Data team and other stakeholders to ensure data integrity and optimize analytics solutions.
  • Influence strategic decision-making by providing evidence-based insights and recommendations.


What you need:


  • Proven experience in analytical thinking and problem-solving within a product-oriented environment.
  • Proficiency in data visualization, statistical analysis, and SQL.

  • A positive, open-minded, and innovative atmosphere

What's on top:

  • In addition, the company also provides employees with a Christmas break to allow you to spend time with family and friends without use of your vacation allocation.
  • Your birthday is off because it is important to celebrate you as well.

Title: Statistical Analyst
Company: EORTC - European Organisation for Research and Treatment of Cancer
Description:
The Statistical Analyst works under the hierarchical supervision of the Head of Statistics Department.

Main responsibilities / Major Activities

Statistical Analysts are experts in SAS and other statistical programming language and support the activities of the EORTC Statistics Department. The Statistical Analyst complies with the EORTC standard operating procedures and other international guidelines in use at EORTC. The main responsibilities include


Development and validation of SAS programs for the reporting of clinical trials according to defined statistical analysis plans
Production of intermediate study reports
Data exchanges with external partners
Database reconciliation
Developing and Implementing Data Cleaning Programs
Quality control of SAS programs
Development and validation of standard SAS programs and SAS macros
Trial results disclosure (EudraCT/ClinicalTrials.gov reporting)


As member of the statistics department, the statistical analyst is actively participating in the scientific activities of the department. The statistical analyst is also offered the possibility to increase her/his knowledge of the medical field and statistical methodology through attendance to training courses and conferences organized by EORTC and select external training relevant to his/her activities.

Profile


A Master‚Äôs degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field.
Experience of programming and reporting of clinical trial data
Excellent knowledge of SAS (SAS BASE, SAS STAT, SAS GRAPH, SAS MACRO, SAS ODS), knowledge of R is a plus
Knowledge of CDISC/ADAM STDM standards is a plus
Be able to work in an international and multidisciplinary environment
Fluent in English (oral and written)
Dynamic and capable of working autonomously inside a team
Show more

Title: Data Analyst / Consultant (Energy Department)
Description:
Data Analyst / Data consultant

Are you interested in expanding your consulting exposure? Do you want to move away from an operations role and make an impact on the business?

Do you often feel like processes and ways of working could be better or more efficient?

Capco is a global management consultancy specialising in driving transformation across investment banking, securities services, and insurance.

We have the people, the vision, and the passion.

We are going through a significant growth journey, and now is a very good time to join us as we expand geographically, increase headcount and disrupt the consulting market across Central Europa with entrepreneurial and agile thinking.

In your role as a Consultant at Capco, you play a key role in the delivery of projects and gain wider exposure to our wider Investment Banking business.

You will work closely with senior clients to deliver large-scale change initiatives for leading global banks.

Fitting that description, you will also need to be a supremely motivated person and able to work in a team where clients become colleagues too.

We Are Looking For Talent With The Following


Leverage your existing analytical skills and expertise to help clients meet their challenges
Take part in strategic data transformation projects and value creation through use of data
Enable data-driven decisions through advanced analytics, visualisation, quality data and dedicated datasets
Engage data using analytical tools and languages to perform data manipulation and analysis
Be involved with managing, cleansing, abstracting and aggregating data
Support the importance of data processes, data integrity and cleanliness, and the strategic use of data
Work with or act as project manager to scope and analyse the area of analysis


Skills & Expertise


Professional experience of minimum 2 years in a data related position, with a preference for roles within the energy industry (or financial / banking) or a consultancy firm
Bachelor or Master degree in a relevant field
Excellent analytical, reporting and presentation skills
Good knowledge of SQL, Python and preferably one visualisation tool (Tableau, PowerBI...)
Being able to work and liaise with various stakeholders, ranging from business to technical stakeholders
You are a creative problem solver with a hands-on approach
Fluency in French or Dutch AND excellent knowledge of English


What We Offer You


The opportunity to join a growing, thought leading, global team of data professionals
An attractive remuneration package, reflecting your experience, including a company car or a mobility budget, net allowances, end-of-year bonuses, health insurance, a mobile phone and subscription, laptop and meal vouchers
Organised individual learning tracks with access to leading online skills development platforms, to onsite and online teachers and to our global experts. Our learning materials cover all areas of data (Governance, Management, Manipulation, Decision science, Engineering)
A hybrid (on-site/remote) work environment
A shared objective to achieve a good work-life balance
A flat, non-hierarchical structure that will enable you to work with senior partners and directly with clients
A diverse, inclusive, meritocratic culture
Show more

  • Work with or act as project manager to scope and analyse the area of analysis

Skills & Expertise

  • Professional experience of minimum 2 years in a data related position, with a preference for roles within the energy industry (or financial / banking) or a consultancy firm
  • Bachelor or Master degree in a relevant field
  • Excellent analytical, reporting and presentation skills
  • Good knowledge of SQL, Python and preferably one visualisation tool (Tableau, PowerBI...)
  • Being able to work and liaise with various stakeholders, ranging from business to technical stakeholders
  • You are a creative problem solver with a hands-on approach
  • Fluency in French or Dutch AND excellent knowledge of English

What We Offer You

  • The opportunity to join a growing, thought leading, global team of data professionals
  • An attractive remuneration package, reflecting your experience, including a company car or a mobility budget, net allowances, end-of-year bonuses, health insurance, a mobile phone and subscription, laptop and meal vouchers
  • Organised individual learning tracks with access to leading online skills development platforms, to onsite and online teachers and to our global experts. Our learning materials cover all areas of data (Governance, Management, Manipulation, Decision science, Engineering)
  • A hybrid (on-site/remote) work environment
  • A shared objective to achieve a good work-life balance
  • A flat, non-hierarchical structure that will enable you to work with senior partners and directly with clients
  • A diverse, inclusive, meritocratic culture

Title: Quantitative Analyst
Description:
Quantitative analyst

About ENGIE:

Our group is a global reference in low-carbon energy and services. Our purpose (‚Äúraison d‚Äô√™tre‚Äù) is to act to accelerate the transition towards a carbon-neutral world, through reduced energy consumption and more environmentally-friendly solutions, reconciling economic performance with a positive impact on people and the planet. We rely on our key businesses (gas, renewable energy, services) to offer competitive solutions to our customers. With our 100,000 employees, our customers, partners and stakeholders, we are a community of Imaginative Builders, committed every day to more harmonious progress

About S&EM:

BU Supply & Energy Management provides energy supply solutions and risk management services to support its clients (businesses and retail) through their decarbonization journey, while optimizing ENGIE‚Äôs assets and contributing to value creation.

15000 employees around the world develop our solutions, through international business platforms and B2C entities. We cover the full energy mix: renewable and thermal power, natural gas & LNG, biomass, environmental products. Our experts provide tailor made solutions based on a wide range of savoir-faire in energy management with a strong focus on decarbonation and decentralization.

Our clients span the entire value chain: producers, asset developers, financial players, utilities, distributors, industrials and retail. Our global reach and strong local presence enable us to offer these diverse clients tailor-made services and respond to rapid changes in mature or emerging markets alike.

At S&EM we encourage breakthrough results, team spirit, curiosity and innovation

Context: The Expertise Center (EC) Quantitative Research and Modeling (QRM) within GEMS is a team of around 115 quantitative analysts. It‚Äôs mission is to provide advanced quantitative expertise to all Business Platforms (BP) of GEMS and to Engie worldwide. The quantitative analyst will be part of the ‚ÄúPricing‚Äù team (approximately 15 people) and will be fully dedicated to the Business Platform Power Trading & Commercial.

Role:

The quantitative analyst should design and provide robust quantitative tools that have a concrete impact on the power business:


Work very closely with the BP Power Trading & Commercial, mainly with the Renewable and Batteries Trading team and the Asset Backed Power Trading team. He / She needs to understand their business needs, and needs to provide them with high-quality quantitative support in their day to day activities.
Participate in enhancing the existing pricing and managing framework.
Deliver ad hoc tactical solutions as well as develop new pricers in the official pricing library.
Play a key role for developing new products, linked for example to the renewable and battery business (pricing, managing strategies, various risk indicators, ‚Ä¶).
Promote best coding practices that comply with general rules and standards.
Document and share knowledge across GEMS on the different models used within GEMS.


Hard skills:


Must have:

Strong Financial Mathematical background (probability, stochastic calculus, various numerical methods such as Monte Carlo, finite differences, ‚Ä¶)
Coding experience (preferably C# and python), object oriented programming skills
Familiar with Git




Good to have:

Experience on the power markets
Experience on different optimization methods
Experience in a trading environment

Soft skills:


Must have:

Practical and conceptual thinking
Ability to explain and convey messages about complex issues
Ability to deliver concrete solutions
Autonomy
Working together

Ed ucation and professional background:


Engineering or university degree (Master of PhD) in Computer Sciences, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Financial Engineering.
0 to 3 years of experience in a similar role.


Languages:


English


Travels: Occasional travels (for example conferences) are possible, but limited.

If you meet these requirements, then you are the talent we are looking for. Do not waste time!

Apply by attaching your updated CV.

ENGIE Global Energy Management & Sales is committed to create a gender-neutral environment that unlocks the potential of everyone and provides equal employment opportunities for all individuals.

All our positions are open to people with disabilities, please let your recruiter know if you need reasonable accommodations to be able to participate in the recruitment process, they will be happy to assist you.

Title: Data-analist
Description:
Data Analist ‚Äì Breng data tot leven en maak impact




Kontich | Internationale werkomgeving | Fulltime (40u/week) | Hybride werken mogelijk




Ben jij gebeten door data en klaar om je BI-skills in te zetten in een snelgroeiende organisatie die bouwt aan de infrastructuur van morgen? In deze functie werk je mee aan slimme rapportering en diepgaande analyses die businessbeslissingen rechtstreeks be√Ønvloeden. Je krijgt de ruimte om zelfstandig projecten uit te bouwen en je expertise verder te verdiepen met de nieuwste technologie√´n.




Deze sterk groeiende speler is actief in de uitrol, modernisering en ondersteuning digitale infrastructuur in Belgi√´. Met meer dan 1.000 medewerkers in de Benelux en een geschatte jaaromzet van meer dan ‚Ç¨200 miljoen, levert de organisatie cruciale diensten voor verschillende bedrijven en diensten.




Je komt terecht in een hecht team waar je ownership krijgt over je werk, maar ook omringd wordt door collega‚Äôs met kennis van zaken. Variatie, vrijheid en impact gegarandeerd.




Data Analist - Jouw verantwoordelijkheden




Ontwikkelen en beheren van dashboards, analyses en rapporteringen in Power BI
Bouwen aan een centrale dataroom en integraties realiseren met andere systemen
Vertalen van businessdoelstellingen naar KPI‚Äôs en procesverbeteringen op basis van data
Zelfstandig beheren van BI-projecten met ondersteuning van een ervaren team
Waken over datakwaliteit en voorzien van betrouwbare inzichten voor de organisatie




Data Analist - Jouw profiel




Minstens 4 jaar ervaring in een BI- of data-analysefunctie
Grondige kennis van Power BI, DAX, M Query, datamodellering en ETL-processen
Ervaring met Python en Notebooks is een plus
Sterke analytische vaardigheden en gestructureerde projectaanpak
Zeer goede kennis van Nederlands en Engels; Frans is een troef




Data Analist - Wat mag je verwachten




Een voltijdse functie binnen een innovatieve en dynamische organisatie
Een aantrekkelijk loonpakket met onder andere:
Bedrijfswagen met tankkaart
Maaltijdcheques, groeps- en hospitalisatieverzekering
Ecocheques
20 verlofdagen en 12 ADV-dagen
Opleidings- en doorgroeimogelijkheden via een interne academy
Een professionele en informele werksfeer
Flexibele werkuren en mogelijkheid tot thuiswerk
Variatie, autonomie en ruimte voor initiatief

Title: Data Analyst - Product
Description:
Building the Future of Crypto

Our Krakenites are a world-class team with crypto conviction, united by our desire to discover and unlock the potential of crypto and blockchain technology.

What makes us different?

Kraken is a mission-focused company rooted in crypto values. As a Krakenite, you‚Äôll join us on our mission to accelerate the global adoption of crypto, so that everyone can achieve financial freedom and inclusion. For over a decade, Kraken‚Äôs focus on our mission and crypto ethos has attracted many of the most talented crypto experts in the world.

Before you apply, please read the Kraken Culture page to learn more about our internal culture, values, and mission. We also expect candidates to familiarize themselves with the Kraken app. Learn how to create a Kraken account here.

As a fully remote company, we have Krakenites in 70+ countries who speak over 50 languages. Krakenites are industry pioneers who develop premium crypto products for experienced traders, institutions, and newcomers to the space. Kraken is committed to industry-leading security, crypto education, and world-class client support through our products like Kraken Pro, Desktop, Wallet, and Kraken Futures.

Become a Krakenite and build the future of crypto!

Proof of work

The team

Embark on a transformative journey with Kraken's data team, where your expertise will directly influence the evolution of the cryptocurrency landscape.

The data team is the backbone of decision-making at Kraken. And no company can grow without high quality decision-making that incorporates what success looks like. You will be quite literally and quantitatively defining success on a daily basis. For our growth, our products, and our leadership.

Join us, and be part of a team where data is not just an asset; it's our language, our tool, and our future.

The opportunity


Your data expertise will inform our product development, impacting how we build the next generation of products
Dive into large, complex datasets/logs to turn your findings into scalable data models necessary to facilitate reporting, analytics and ML models
Lead cross-functional projects with analysts, scientists, engineers, and product teams to build data pipelines using Airflow, Python, and modern ETL frameworks
Develop and automate reporting of key performance indicators of various Kraken‚Äôs products at scale
Develop high-quality code for pipelines and dashboards, incorporating software engineering best practices
Deliver insights that shape product direction through clear, data-driven storytelling


Skills You Should HODL


A degree in a field emphasizing analytical rigor, such as software engineering, economics, or a hard science
Proficiency in SQL and familiarity with Python libraries such as pandas, matplotlib, and plotly
Experience setting up and managing data pipelines, with a strong understanding of data workflow orchestration
Capable of creating intuitive dashboards and visualizations to communicate complex insights clearly
Familiarity with dbt (data build tool) and version-controlled analytics workflows
Curious and investigative, with a natural tendency to explore data deeply and spot hidden patterns
Comfortable in fast-paced environments, delivering quality work with speed and adaptability
Strong communicator who can simplify complex data ideas for both technical and non-technical audiences


Nice to haves


Familiarity with machine learning model development
Deep interest in improving user experiences through better product analytics and experimentation
Passion for continuous learning and approaching problems with a beginner‚Äôs mindset
Solid understanding of the cryptocurrency space and how financial markets function


#USCANEU

This job is accepting ongoing applications and there is no application deadline.

Please note, applicants are permitted to redact or remove information on their resume that identifies age, date of birth, or dates of attendance at or graduation from an educational institution.

We consider qualified applicants with criminal histories for employment on our team, assessing candidates in a manner consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

Kraken is powered by people from around the world and we celebrate all Krakenites for their diverse talents, backgrounds, contributions and unique perspectives. We hire strictly based on merit, meaning we seek out the candidates with the right abilities, knowledge, and skills considered the most suitable for the job. We encourage you to apply for roles where you don't fully meet the listed requirements, especially if you're passionate or knowledgable about crypto!

As an equal opportunity employer, we don‚Äôt tolerate discrimination or harassment of any kind. Whether that‚Äôs based on race, ethnicity, age, gender identity, citizenship, religion, sexual orientation, disability, pregnancy, veteran status or any other protected characteristic as outlined by federal, state or local laws.

Stay in the know

Follow us on Twitter

Learn on the Kraken Blog

Connect on LinkedIn

Candidate Privacy Notice

Compensation Range: $110K - $176K

  • Esprit analytique, rigueur, autonomie et sens du travail en √©quipe.


Nous offrons :

  • Un package salarial attractif, modulable selon votre exp√©rience
  • Des avantages extra-l√©gaux : assurance groupe, assurance hospitalisation, ch√®ques repas, √©coch√®ques
  • Une ambiance de travail conviviale dans une structure √† taille humaine
  • Une fonction vari√©e, avec des responsabilit√©s concr√®tes et transversales
  • L‚Äôopportunit√© de rejoindre un acteur solide et reconnu du secteur financier automobile


-----------------------------------------------------------

Wie zijn wij?

Stellantis Financial Services is de financi√´le maatschappij van de merken Peugeot, Citro√´n, DS, Opel, Fiat, Alfa Romeo, Jeep, Abarth, Fiat Professional en Maserati.

Het bedrijf is een joint venture met de Santander Bank en actief in meer dan 10 Europese landen.


Uw rol

Als Data/Business Analyst binnen de dienst Invordering speel je een strategische rol in het optimaliseren van het beheer van openstaande vorderingen.

Je verantwoordelijkheden omvatten:

  • Analyse van invorderingsgegevens: betalingen, achterstanden, inningspercentages, klantsegmentatie.
  • Creatie van dynamische dashboards (SAS, Power BI, Excel, ‚Ä¶).
  • Voorspellende modellering: scoring, voorspelling van wanbetalingen, detectie van risicogedrag.
  • Strategische aanbevelingen en continue verbetering van KPI‚Äôs.
  • Samenwerking met de teams van Financi√´n, IT, Juridische Dienst en Klantendienst.


Gezocht profiel

  • Master in Data Science, Statistiek, Financi√´n of Business Intelligence.
  • 5 jaar ervaring in een gelijkaardige functie.
  • Beheersing van Power BI, SAS, Excel, SQL.
  • Kennis van invordering of klantenfinanciering is een pluspunt.
  • Goede communicatieve vaardigheden in het Frans en Engels.

  • Wij bieden:

    ‚Ä¢ Een aantrekkelijk en flexibel loonpakket afhankelijk van uw ervaring

    ‚Ä¢ Extralegale voordelen: groepsverzekering, hospitalisatieverzekering, maaltijdcheques, ecocheques

    ‚Ä¢ Een aangename werksfeer binnen een mensgerichte structuur

    ‚Ä¢ Een gevarieerde functie met concrete en transversale verantwoordelijkheden

    ‚Ä¢ De kans om deel uit te maken van een solide en erkende speler in de autofinancieringssector

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Tired of inheriting someone else‚Äôs messy dashboards? Ready to build the entire BI function from the ground up - your way?




We‚Äôre looking for a hands-on Data Analyst to help a fast-scaling eCommerce team stop guessing and start acting on real data. This is a unique opportunity to architect a clean, scalable data infrastructure from scratch, enabling data-driven decisions across marketing, ops, product, and leadership.




If you love collecting, cleaning, and connecting data - and transforming that into insights that actually drive action - this is your chance to make a massive impact in a company that‚Äôs hungry for your expertise.




YOUR MISSION

To build and own a brand-new Business Intelligence system, structuring raw, fragmented data from multiple sources into accessible dashboards and reports that empower the teams to optimize performance, identify inefficiencies, and make smarter decisions.

This is a full-time, contractor role.




WHAT‚ÄôS IN IT FOR YOU

Architect the company‚Äôs entire BI stack and define best practices from day one
Work with high-leverage datasets from platforms like Shopify, Meta Ads, GA, TripleWhale, Klaviyo, and more
Operate independently in a low-data-maturity environment where your work will directly drive growth
Work from anywhere with a fully international and global team




WHAT YOU‚ÄôLL BE DOING

Build a brand-new Business Intelligence infrastructure from scratch - no legacy systems to fight against
Collect and connect data from multiple marketing and analytics platforms to create a unified view of performance
Build and maintain automated processes that transform raw data into structured, usable insights
Design intuitive dashboards and reports that help the team make fast, informed decisions
Turn complex data into clear, actionable insights that drive marketing strategy and funnel performance
Spot anomalies or underperformance early and flag them to key stakeholders
Work cross-functionally with teams across marketing, tech, and leadership to improve data visibility and measurement




WHO YOU ARE

Experience: 3+ years in data analysis, business intelligence, or analytics roles with exposure to data infrastructure and performance reporting
Builder Mentality: You‚Äôve worked in (or thrive in) low-data-maturity environments and know how to get results without perfect tools
Technical Skills: Proficient in SQL and comfortable working with Python or similar scripting tools to automate and structure data
Platform Familiarity: Experienced with key marketing data sources like Shopify, GA, Facebook Ads, and email platforms
Analytical & Strategic: You connect the dots across funnel stages, ROI metrics, and ad performance to guide decision-making
Self-Starter: Comfortable working independently and building systems from the ground up in a fast-paced environment
Collaborative Partner: Skilled at working across departments and aligning data initiatives with company objectives
Software Background: Bonus if you have a foundation in software engineering to collaborate more effectively with developers




WHAT SUCCESS LOOKS LIKE

30 Days: You‚Äôve mapped all available data sources, aligned with stakeholders, and delivered initial KPIs & dashboards
60 Days: You‚Äôve automated reporting processes and built pipelines to support recurring business needs
90 Days: You‚Äôre the go-to person for insights and reporting, with real-time visibility driving better decisions across marketing and operations




RECRUITMENT PROCESS

Intro Chat: A quick intro call to understand your experience and motivations
Tech Interview: Deep dive into your technical abilities and past experience
Task: A small, real-world BI task to see how you think and communicate
Final Chat: We‚Äôll align expectations, goals, and finalize the next steps

Title: Data Analist
Description:
afarax is op zoek naar een Data Analist voor een van onze klanten. Wij hebben jou nodig!

We zijn een Belgisch team met een sterk netwerk van consultants en bedrijven actief in verschillende sectoren met digitale transformatie. Het concept is zeer eenvoudig: √©√©n keer in onze database heb je toegang tot onze projecten en laat ons je leven gemakkelijke maken.




De opdracht

Onze klant is op zoek naar een Data Analist om zijn team te verstereken.




Doel:

Analyseren van de behoeften van de gebruikers en deze in afstemming met de Solution Architect vertalen. Rekening houdend met technische mogelijkheden/beperkingen teneinde de kwaliteit van de bestaande architectuur en de geldende kwaliteitseisen bij de opleveringen van nieuwe applicaties en de continu√Øteit van de bestaande applicaties te kunnen waarborgen.




Ben jij dat?

Data analist met uitgebreide ervaring in data warehousing, uitgebreide ervaring met data normalisatie en modelling vereist: 3NF, Kimball, data vault. Een goede kandidaat heeft ook uitgebreide ervaring met Oracle en ODI specifiek.




MUST HAVES: 3NF, Kimball/stermodelleren (facts/dimensions), SQL en kennis van ETL tools
SHOULD HAVE: Datavault, Oracle (ODI)




Master
3 jaar ervaring als business of functioneel analist
Kan een denkkader aanreiken voor een project
Organiseert het eigen werk en coacht mee de andere analisten
Voert onderbouwde discussie met business omtrent functionaliteiten
Heeft een diepgaande kennis van alle belangrijke elementen in de toegewezen domeinen en reikt een denkkader aan voor een project
Formuleert en werkt verbeteringsvoorstellen uit ter optimalisatie van de werkwijze en procedures na bespreking met het management
Doet review van analyses van andere domeinanalisten en begeleidt nieuwe medewerkers




Hoe helpen wij je ?

We helpen en steunen het project.
Je geniet van onze netwerk en onze uitdagingen.
We bieden aan de mogelijkheid van een handige en duurzame samenwerking.
Je hebt de mogelijkheid om gehoord te zijn en jouw expertise te delen.
Je krijgt toegang tot opdrachten die jouw expertise matchen en de gelegenheid om nieuwe dingens te leren.




Meer projecten op : https://afarax.be/jobs/type/freelance/

Show more

Title: Business & Data Analyst Healthcare
Description:
Taken en verantwoordelijkheden

HR Rail zoekt nieuwe collega's, Wil jij onze teams versterken? Ontdek de vacature hieronder en solliciteer.

Opmerking

Bedankt om te solliciteren via deze link.

Wat is jouw rol bij HR Rail?

Het team Project & IT Management (PIT) van de KGV is op zoek naar een Business & Data Analyst Healthcare om het team te versterken. Je bent verantwoordelijk voor de implementatie en het beheer van diverse projecten op het gebied van digitalisering van de geneeskundige verzorging.


Als Business & Data Analist Healthcare werk je mee aan de digitalisering van de sector geneeskundige verzorging door deel te nemen aan verschillende werkgroepen en commissies. Je stelt business requirements op voor de IT-afdeling en analyseert de impact en behoeften voor de back-office.
Je houdt toezicht op tests die worden uitgevoerd met softwarepakketten van prestatieverleners.
Je identificeert en test de door IT voorgestelde oplossingen en aanpassingen en stelt na akkoord het programma in productie. Nadien verzorg je de follow-up.
Je volgt voortdurend de ontwikkeling op het gebied van regelgeving op die binnen de KGV ge√Ømplementeerd moet worden en je analyseert de impact van deze wijzigingen in regelgeving op lopende projecten.
Je beheert individueel een breed scala aan projecten en bent specialist in je domein in samenwerking met de expert en co√∂rdinator van het team.
Je analyseert vragen en problemen , zoekt antwoorden en identificeert het onderliggend probleem met het oog op het implementeren van een oplossing op korte, middellange en lange termijn.
Je bent back-up voor je directe collega's in geval van afwezigheid (opvolging FMB‚Äôs, projectopvolging, deelname aan vergaderingen en feedback aan collega‚Äôs).


Waarom is deze job iets voor jou ?


Je bent in het bezit van een masterdiploma of gelijkwaardig door ervaring als Business & Data Analyst (minstens 3 jaar ervaring in de materie)
Je hebt een eerste relevante ervaring als Business & Data Analyst
Professionele ervaring binnen een verzekeringsinstelling (mutualiteit) of het domein gezondheidszorg is een plus.


Technische Competenties


Je kan vlot werken met de MS-Office toepassingen, voornamelijk met Word en Excel.
Je beheerst het Nederlands perfect, zowel schriftelijk als mondeling en je hebt een gevorderde kennis van het Frans (niveau B2).


Gedragscompetenties


Informatie analyseren: je bekijkt informatie vanuit een kritisch standpunt en aanvaardt informatie niet zonder er verder over na te denken.
Opvolging verzekeren: je volgt met een gepaste frequentie acties op en stuurt bij in functie van de te bereiken objectieven.
Oplossingen implementeren: je neemt het initiatief om oplossingen aan te reiken, ook in onbekende situaties. Je neemt concrete acties om problemen op te lossen en vooruit te gaan.
Continu leren: Je plant en beheert je eigen groei actief en stelt het eigen functioneren kritisch in vraag. Je verwerft continu nieuwe inzichten, vaardigheden en kennis.
Communiceren: je brengt een boodschap of gegevens op een duidelijke, correcte en transparante manier over, zowel schriftelijk als mondeling, in functie van het doel en het publiek.
Regels & procedures toepassen: Je werkt nauwkeurig en respecteert de procedures en regels.


HR Rail wil dat de sociale diversiteit weerspiegeld wordt in zijn medewerkers. Het zijn je talenten en enthousiasme die tellen, niet je geslacht, leeftijd, afkomst of handicap.

Wat mag je van ons verwachten?


Een contractuele betrekking in een innovatief en dynamisch bedrijf.
Een interessante functie met de mogelijkheid om initiatieven en verantwoordelijkheden te nemen en waarin je de kans krijgt om jouw kennis en vaardigheden te ontwikkelen en uit te breiden.
Extra legale voordelen (hospitalisatieverzekering, maaltijdcheques, enz.).
Variabele werkuren en na je opleiding mogelijkheid tot 3 dagen telewerk.
Een treinabonnement 1ste klas op het volledige Belgische netwerk.


Waar ga je werken?

HR Rail, een naamloze vennootschap van publiek recht, is de

HR-dienstverlener en juridische werkgever van alle medewerkers van de Belgische spoorwegen.

HR Rail is een samenwerkingsplek waar de klant altijd op de eerste plaats komt, waar we verantwoordelijkheid nemen en waar we bij elke procedure en elk project voortdurend de mogelijke effici√´ntie verbeteren. Dit zijn onze waarden en ons DNA, onze CORE: samenwerking, klantgerichtheid, verantwoordelijkheid en effici√´ntie.

Binnen HR Rail is de dienst Care4Rail verantwoordelijk voor het medisch-maatschappelijk beleid van de Belgische spoorwegen. Het omvat de Kas der geneeskundige verzorging (KGV), de verzekeringsinstelling van het statutaire personeel van de Belgische Spoorwegen, voor wat betreft de verplichte verzekering voor geneeskundige verzorging.

Het managementteam en het team voor project- en IT-management van de KGV zijn gevestigd in Brussel.

De regionale teams staan in voor het rechtstreeks contact met de aangeslotenen en zorgen voor de praktische uitvoering van de regelgeving rond geneeskundige verzorging, zoals het toekennen van rechten, terugbetalingen en toelatingen.

De facturatie en de contacten met zorgverleners worden centraal opgevolgd door een gespecialiseerd team in Brussel.

Jouw werkplek is gelegen vlakbij het station in Brussel (station Brussel-Zuid).

What‚Äôs next ?


Stel je kandidaat via deze link: https://jobs.infrabel.be/HRRail/job/BrusselBruxelles-Business-&-Data-Analyst-Healthcare/826262702/


De inschrijvingen worden gesloten zodra wij voldoende aantal kandidaturen hebben ontvangen.


Als je na screening van jouw cv en sollicitatiebrief voldoet aan het profiel dat wij zoeken, wordt je gevraagd niet-eliminerende redeneertesten af te leggen en een online persoonlijkheidsvragenlijst in te vullen.


HR Rail behoudt zich het recht voor het aantal sollicitanten te beperken tot de profielen die het best bij de functiebeschrijving passen.


Vervolgens word je uitgenodigd voor een online interview waarin jouw belangstelling voor de functie en jouw vaardigheden en ervaring nader worden beoordeeld. Dit selectiegesprek wordt voorafgegaan door een case-study.
Als jij de kandidaat bent die wij zoeken, moet je ons nog enkele documenten bezorgen (je diploma, strafblad, ...).
Klaar voor je eerste werkdag!


Heb je nog vragen?

HR Rail behoudt zich het recht voor het aantal sollicitanten te beperken tot de profielen die het best bij de functiebeschrijving passen.

  • Vervolgens word je uitgenodigd voor een online interview waarin jouw belangstelling voor de functie en jouw vaardigheden en ervaring nader worden beoordeeld. Dit selectiegesprek wordt voorafgegaan door een case-study.
  • Als jij de kandidaat bent die wij zoeken, moet je ons nog enkele documenten bezorgen (je diploma, strafblad, ...).
  • Klaar voor je eerste werkdag!

Heb je nog vragen?

Title: Data Analyst-Developer
Description:
Within our department IT Front & Packages with the mission of developing and maintaining our web applications and all our third-party applications, we are seeking a Data Analyst-Developer. The person will play a central role in developing IT Data & BI solutions to reach business objectives. She/He will ensure the availability, performance, and evolution of key business applications that support operational and strategic needs. She/He will strive to maximize the use of the company‚Äôs data assets.

The team consists of 8 colleagues who are eager to welcome you!

Your responsibilities

As An Analyst-Developer, Your Key Responsibilities Will Include


Collaborating with stakeholders to understand data needs and translate them into technical specifications.
Designing, developing, and implementing data warehousing and BI solutions to meet business requirements.
Performing data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes using tools such as SQL, Python, and ETL frameworks.
Developing and maintaining dashboards, reports, and visualizations using BI tools like Power BI.
Ensuring data integrity, quality, and security across all data platforms.
Conducting data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and insights that drive business decisions.
Supporting the business in understanding and using the available data to facilitate creation of their own reports and dashboards Stay updated with the latest industry trends and technologies in data analytics, BI & AI.
Participating in data & BI documentation (implement and manage tools supporting the documentation and contribute to the content along with other team members).
Implementing and managing tools that will improve data security and governance.


Your profile


You hold a bachelor's degree in Computer Science, IT, Data Science, a related field, or possess equivalent experience.
You have proven experience as a Data Analyst, BI Developer, or similar role.
You have proficiency in SQL, data modeling, and database management.
You have experience with BI tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or Qlik.
You are familiar with programming languages such as Python.
You are fluent in English and French or Dutch, with a good command of the other national language.
You can learn quickly and adapt in a dynamic environment.
You have an analytical mindset and are solution-oriented.
You are proactive and can communicate effectively with various stakeholders.
You value teamwork and can work both on-site and remotely, including with offshore developers.


Good reasons to join us


A permanent employment contract.
A company that values human scale within a dynamic group where you can make a significant impact.
Accessible management that is close to its employees and fosters a pleasant working environment.
Numerous development opportunities, particularly through our Athora Academy.
A balance between professional and private life with generous holidays (at least 39 days a year), flexible working hours, and up to 3 days of teleworking per week.
An attractive salary package with various fringe benefits.
Modern, bright offices that encourage collaboration.
A central location in the Porte de Namur district, easily accessible by train and public transport, with parking available if needed.
Last but not least‚Ä¶ a sunny terrace, after-work gatherings, team-building activities, an annual staff day, and many other events to discover‚Ä¶ üòâ


If you are looking for a friendly organization with a human touch and value collaboration and mutual support, you have come to the right place!
