Title: Executive Administrative Assistant
Description:
About The Company

Stewart is a leading title services company dedicated to providing comprehensive real estate transaction solutions across the United States. With a commitment to innovation, integrity, and customer satisfaction, Stewart has established itself as a trusted partner in the industry. The company emphasizes a diverse and inclusive work environment that reflects the communities it serves, fostering a culture of growth, development, and excellence. Stewart continuously invests in its employees' careers, offering opportunities for advancement and skill enhancement. Its mission is to become the premier title services provider by delivering exceptional service and leveraging cutting-edge technology to streamline real estate closings and related processes.

About The Role

The Administrative Support Specialist plays a vital role within Stewart by providing advanced administrative assistance to ensure smooth daily operations. Under limited supervision, this role requires a high level of discretion, organizational skills, and expertise in handling a wide range of administrative functions. The ideal candidate will manage complex scheduling, prepare reports, handle confidential information, and coordinate various meetings and travel arrangements. This position acts as a resource for less experienced team members and contributes to the efficiency and effectiveness of the department. The role offers an excellent opportunity for individuals with substantial administrative experience to support a dynamic and growing organization while developing their professional skills in a fast-paced environment.

Qualifications


High school diploma required; Bachelor's degree preferred
Minimum of 5+ years of related administrative work experience
Exceptional organizational and time management skills
Strong communication skills, both verbal and written
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook)
Ability to handle highly confidential information with discretion
Experience in scheduling complex meetings, travel arrangements, and report preparation
Self-motivated with the ability to work independently and adapt to changing priorities
Attention to detail and problem-solving skills


Responsibilities


Answer incoming calls, take messages, and direct inquiries appropriately
Prepare and distribute reports, correspondence, and other documentation as needed
Issue documents in compliance with departmental, legal, or statutory requirements
Coordinate and schedule complex meetings, conference calls, and training sessions
Arrange detailed travel plans and itineraries for team members and clients
Support department operations by modifying work practices to improve efficiency
Serve as a resource and mentor for less experienced team members
Perform additional duties as assigned by management to support organizational goals


Benefits


Competitive annual salary ranging from $44,732.48 to $74,554.13, based on experience and qualifications
Comprehensive health and wellness insurance options
Paid time off and holiday leave
401(k) plan with company matching contributions
Employee stock purchase program
Employee discounts on various products and services
Opportunities for professional development and career growth


Equal Opportunity

Stewart is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace. We provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other protected characteristic.

Title: Intern ‚Äì Early Warning & Preparedness
HTML:
Job Description

Background

Diversity, Equity and Inclusion are core principles at UNDP: we value diversity as an expression of the multiplicity of nations and cultures where we operate, we foster inclusion as a way of ensuring all personnel are empowered to contribute to our mission, and we ensure equity and fairness in all our actions. Taking a ‚Äòleave no one behind‚Äô approach to our diversity efforts means increasing representation of underserved populations. People who identify as belonging to marginalized or excluded populations are strongly encouraged to apply. Learn more about working at UNDP including our values and inspiring stories.

UNDP does not tolerate sexual exploitation and abuse, any kind of harassment, including sexual harassment, and discrimination. All selected candidates will, therefore, undergo rigorous reference and background checks.

UNDP plays an important and unique role in supporting high risk countries to achieve their development goals by reducing loss to life and assets, and by strengthening long term resilience. UNDP works with governments at international, national and local levels to ensure that disaster risk reduction (DRR) is a nationally-led and owned agenda, as well as integrated into national development planning. UNDP‚Äôs work focuses on resilience building and ensuring development remains risk-informed and sustainable. To do this we assist governments in systematically and comprehensively delivering on risk-informed development through the communication, reduction and management of risk.

UNDP‚Äôs Country Level DRR And Recovery Efforts Have Reached Expenditures Of USD 2.1 Billion During The Period 2005 ‚Äì 2016 (more Information On UNDP‚Äôs DRR Portfolio Can Be Accessed Here ). The Disaster Risk Reduction And Recovery For Building Resilience Team (DRT) Currently Manages a Portfolio Of Global And Regional Projects Amounting To Approximately USD 60 Million. Through Enhanced Integration With Climate Change Adaptation And a Firm Focus On Partnerships And Mechanisms To Deliver On Sendai, UNDP, During This Reporting Period, Has

  • helped 148 countries develop national and local DRR strategies and action plans;
  • supported 84 countries to understand and communicate risks through risk assessments;
  • worked with 90 countries to strengthen their legal and regulatory frameworks for DRM; and
  • supported 110 countries to develop post-disaster recovery capacities.


The DRT leads UNDP‚Äôs global practice in this field and provides policy advice and programmatic support to UNDP Regional Hubs and Country Offices in the design, implementation, monitoring and evaluation of disaster risk reduction and recovery programmes. The team collaborates closely with other UNDP Global Policy Network (GPN) practices such as climate change, governance, conflict prevention, sustainable development and poverty eradication, towards a comprehensive and multi-dimensional approach to resilience building.

This position is specifically intended to support UNDP‚Äôs work on early warning, preparedness and anticipation as one of the key strategic work streams of DRT. The intern will support the team with research, knowledge management and communications tasks related to the continuous development and rollout of UNDP‚Äôs Preparedness Learning Pathway .

Duties And Responsibilities

Support the continuous development of UNDP‚Äôs Preparedness Learning Pathway

  • Undertake research and categorization of resources to support the expansion and tailoring of the UNDP‚Äôs Preparedness Learning Pathway as a corporate learning package
  • Support the development and maintenance of the online repository of the UNDP‚Äôs Preparedness Learning Pathway on the UNDP Intranet homepage and on selected open-source websites
  • Undertake research and categorization of resources to support the development of new thematic modules for the UNDP Preparedness Toolkit, which is an online repository linked to the UNDP Preparedness Learning Pathway
  • Oversee the process to translate the UNDP Preparedness Learning Pathway package in additional languages if required


Support the organization of workshops and webinars for the rollout of the UNDP Preparedness Learning Pathway

  • Support the organization of country workshops for the rollout of the UNDP Preparedness Learning Pathway as appropriate, including supporting the lead to adapt programme and agenda, tailor slide decks, adapt and develop new methodological approaches for interactive elements for workshops, develop country briefs, coordinate communication with facilitators and in-country counterparts
  • Support the organization of webinars for the UNDP Preparedness Learning Pathway, including development of tailored webinar plans for all webinars (i.e. selective modules will be delivered for each webinar), facilitation guidance for resource persons, support the facilitation of webinars (development of MURAL boards, facilitation of group discussions, setting up Zoom options, etc.), develop webinar reports
  • Support the development of social media kits for all workshops and webinars, based on existing guidance and samples


Support the team with any other portfolio related tasks that include research, analysis, and communication

  • Develop project proposals, briefs, talking points, slide decks, etc. as required.


Competencies

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English;
  • Knowledge of online applications such as Canva, MURAL, Zoom, MS Teams, Google Forms;
  • Initiative taking;
  • Strong organization skills;
  • Great attention to detail and proven experience in proof reading;
  • Ability to work well in a team;
  • Demonstration of cultural sensitivity and appreciation for different cultures and practices;
  • Sound computer skills and experience using web-based applications, social media and data management systems.


Required Skills And Experience

Enrolled in a Master‚Äôs programme or equivalent in the area of: disaster risk reduction, climate change adaptation, disaster management, humanitarian affairs.

Proficiency in English in both writing and speaking.

Applicants to the UNDP internship programme must at the time of application meet one of the following requirements:

  • Be enrolled in a postgraduate degree programme (such as a master‚Äôs programme, or higher);
  • Be enrolled in the final academic year of a first university degree programme (such as bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent);
  • Have recently graduated with a university degree (as defined in (a) and (b) above) and, if selected, must start the internship within one-year of graduation;
  • Be enrolled in a postgraduate professional traineeship program and undertake the internship as part of this program.


The applicant should be enrolled in a programme, as stated in requirements a) b), c) or d), in Communication, Public Relations, Events, Graphic Design or related field.

Application Procedure

  • The application should contain a) brief Cover Letter (in English) stating interest in and qualifications for the post; and (b) current and complete CV in English.


Conditions Of The Internship

  • As of 1 January 2020, Interns may be given a stipend according to the UNDP Internship Policies, if is not financially supported by any institution or programme, such as a university, government, foundation, or scholarship programme;
  • Interns are responsible for securing adequate medical insurance for the duration of the internship. UNDP accepts no responsibility for costs arising from accidents and/or illness or death incurred during the internship;
  • Interns are not eligible to apply for, or be appointed to, any post in UNDP during the period of the internship;
  • Interns are not staff members and may not represent UNDP in any official capacity;
  • The purpose of the Internship Programme is not to lead to further employment with UNDP but to complement an intern‚Äôs studies. Therefore, there should be no expectation of employment at the end of an internship;
  • The intern will be evaluated at the end of the contract and due recognition of work will be issued in writing.


In Case An Applicant Is Successfully Selected, S/he Will Be Requested To Provide Electronic Versions Of The Following Documents Upon Selection

  • Copy of the applicant‚Äôs most recent resume or curriculum vitae;
  • Letter from his/her university confirming current enrolment and graduation date;
  • Letter of recommendation from a professor;
  • Copy of his/her school transcript;
  • Copy of passport;
  • Completed UNDP internship application form;
  • Signed UNDP Internship Agreement;
  • Medical Certificate of Good Health;
  • Proof of medical insurance.


Application Process

  • In your application, please (i) state in one paragraph why you would like to be considered for the internship, and (ii) indicate your preferred start and end date, as well as your availability timeframe between February and July 2025;
  • Submit your CV/Resume.


Equal opportunity

As an equal opportunity employer, UNDP values diversity as an expression of the multiplicity of nations and cultures where we operate and, as such, we encourage qualified applicants from all backgrounds to apply for roles in the organization. Our employment decisions are based on merit and suitability for the role, without discrimination.

UNDP is also committed to creating an inclusive workplace where all personnel are empowered to contribute to our mission, are valued, can thrive, and benefit from career opportunities that are open to all.

Sexual harassment, exploitation, and abuse of authority

UNDP does not tolerate harassment, sexual harassment, exploitation, discrimination and abuse of authority. All selected candidates, therefore, undergo relevant checks and are expected to adhere to the respective standards and principles.

Right to select multiple candidates

UNDP reserves the right to select one or more candidates from this vacancy announcement. We may also retain applications and consider candidates applying to this post for other similar positions with UNDP at the same grade level and with similar job description, experience and educational requirements.

Scam alert

UNDP does not charge a fee at any stage of its recruitment process. For further information, please see www.undp.org/scam-alert.

Title: Threat Analyst
Description:
About the Role:

We‚Äôre seeking an experienced Threat Analyst to join our cybersecurity team. This expert will lead advanced threat analysis initiatives, integrate AI/ML into SECOPS operations, and collaborate across multi-disciplinary intelligence environments. The role demands strong incident response experience, a deep understanding of counterintelligence dynamics, and expertise in cutting-edge cybersecurity tools such as Splunk, Sentinel One, Armis, and SNA.




About Revature:

Revature is one of the largest and fastest-growing employers of technology talent across the U.S., partnering with Fortune 500 companies, the biggest System Integrators, and Government Contractors to identify experienced professionals who can be effective leaders.




Key Responsibilities:

Lead cyber threat analysis and incident response efforts with precision
Integrate artificial intelligence and machine learning into Security Operations (SECOPS) environments
Perform triage of detections to determine scope, severity, and root cause
Monitor cybersecurity events and investigate incidents across enterprise networks
Fuse network attack analyses with criminal and counterintelligence investigations
Maintain situational awareness through continuous interface with internal and external intelligence teams
Analyze and synthesize complex data sources to build a unified picture of cyber threat landscapes
Share insights and best practices across the intelligence community to promote joint operations
Communicate technical findings to non-technical stakeholders with clarity and confidence
Support contract Program Manager with relevant cybersecurity guidance and reporting




What We're Looking For:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Cybersecurity, Computer Science, IT, or related field
Minimum of 10 years of hands-on cybersecurity experience
Demonstrated experience with an incident response team and cybersecurity analysis
Familiarity with tools such as Splunk, Sentinel One, Armis, and SNA
Proven ability to apply cyber counterintelligence within a broader intelligence operations context
Strong understanding of emerging technologies and threat trends
Excellent analytical, presentation, and communication skills
This is a full-time W2 role, not C2C




Equal Opportunity Employer:

Revature (‚ÄúCompany‚Äù) is an equal opportunity employer. We will extend equal opportunity to all individuals without regard to race, religion, color, sex, pregnancy, childbirth or related medical conditions, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, age, genetic information, marital status, veteran status, or any other status protected under applicable federal, state, or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including but not limited to, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, benefits, compensation, and training. If you require accommodation to work, based on any of these protected factors, please notify the Human Resources Department, and the Company will evaluate the request and provide accommodation in accordance with applicable law.




We seek to comply with all applicable federal, state, and local laws related to discrimination and will not tolerate interference with the ability of any of the Company's employees to perform their job duties. Our policy reflects and affirms the Company's commitment to the principles of fair employment and the elimination of all discriminatory practices.




Note: Work authorization in the country you are applying to is required. Revature does not sponsor work visas.

Title: Senior Data & Digital Analyst, Assurance & Risk Advisory (ARA) - remote
Description:
Why ARA at Stryker?

Our internal audit team is expanding, and we are looking for someone with data and digital skills to integrate data, technology and digital solutions across our department. As a member of our Assurance and Risk Advisory (ARA) department, you will have a crucial role in leveraging your skills to enhance our operations, improve risk management, and provide valuable insights to the organization. Your skills will contribute to taking ARA into the future by supporting the development, implementation, and scaling of digital initiatives that will be integrated throughout the internal audit lifecycle. You will have the chance to work with a dynamic and global team that supports the organization‚Äôs strategy through customer focus and innovation.

The Senior Data & Digital Analyst will play a crucial role in identifying opportunities and implementing automation, data-driven insights, and process improvements across internal audit projects. This individual should possess a strong digital acumen and effectively apply a digital mindset to internal audit projects and other activities, thereby contributing to the continuous upskilling of the internal audit department. Additionally, having a solid foundation in internal audit principles, methodologies, and practices is a plus.

This role can be remote or hybrid. Candidates living within 50 miles of our Flower Mound, TX; Portage, MI; or Mahwah, NJ locations will be required to work in the office one day per week. The candidate must reside within the Eastern, Central, or Mountain time zones.

Who We Want

Problem solvers. Innovative thinkers who are excited to find a way to overcome a challenge or accomplish a new task.

Dedicated achievers. People who thrive in a fast-paced environment and will stop at nothing to ensure business goals and objective are met

Effective communicators. Can analyze and synthesize data/information for insights and communicate them in a consumable way for decision making

What You Will Do


Use analytics and automation tools to efficiently gather, analyze, and interpret datasets, enabling the identification of trends, anomalies, and patterns that enhance the effectiveness and depth of audit procedures.
Design and deliver dynamic dashboards, analytic models, and reports to effectively communicate results and key findings to stakeholders.
Integrate and analyze multiple disparate data sources from a variety of systems.
Continuously monitor and evaluate emerging technologies such as GenAI to identify opportunities for innovation and enhancement within audit processes.
Support ongoing enhancement and optimization of the ARA department by supporting activities that align with ARA's data and digital strategy.
Stay up-to-date and proactively share ways of using emerging technologies and applying industry best practices to enhance audit processes.


What You Need

Required:


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in relevant field (e.g., accounting, finance, business administration, business analytics, computer science, data science or other relevant information systems degree)
2+ years of professional experience
Experience in database management and coding (e.g., SQL)


$69,100 - $139,600 salary plus bonus eligible + benefits. Individual pay is based on skills, experience, and other relevant factors.

Preferred:


Experience creating dashboards using tools such as Power BI, or similar platforms
Digital technology certifications (e.g., Microsoft Power BI Certification).
AuditBoard experience


$69,100 - $139,600 salary plus bonus eligible + benefits. Actual minimum and maximum may vary based on location. Individual pay is based on skills, experience, and other relevant factors.

Health benefits include: Medical and prescription drug insurance, dental insurance, vision insurance, critical illness insurance, accident insurance, hospital indemnity insurance, personalized healthcare support, wellbeing program and tobacco cessation program. Financial benefits include: Health Savings Account (HSA), Flexible Spending Accounts (FSAs), 401(k) plan, Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP), basic life and AD&D insurance, and short-term disability insurance. Stryker offers innovative products and services in MedSurg, Neurotechnology, Orthopaedics and Spine that help improve patient and healthcare outcomes. Alongside its customers around the world, Stryker impacts more than 150 million patients annually. Depending on customer requirements employees and new hires in sales and field roles that require access to customer accounts as a function of the job may be required to obtain various vaccinations as an essential function of their role.

Title: Executive Administrative Assistant
Description:
Title: Executive Administrative Assistant

Duration: 06+ Months with Possible Extensions

Location: New York, NY 10282




Job Summary & Responsibilities:

Provide administrative support in a team-oriented environment; Flexibility to support varying teams and cover where necessary
Proactive and detailed calendar management across multiple time zones, prioritize meeting requests, including coordination of complex meetings and phone/video conference calls
Manage a high volume of incoming phone calls; take detailed and accurate messages while interacting with high level business leaders and clients in a professional manner
Coordinates domestic and international travel arrangements as required, including visa procurement, and processes expense reports or related invoices in a timely manner.
Arrange internal and client meetings on and off the Client campus ‚Äì working with conference services to book conference rooms and catering, register guests, ensure materials organized
Perform general administrative duties including but not limited to phone answering, time entry, copying, scanning, filing, mailing, archiving and other ad hoc projects as requested
Handles highly confidential and sensitive client information with utmost discretion.
Act as an integral member of the team; maintaining a high level of awareness of current priorities and support required
Adhere to Compliance regulations and gain the relevant approvals




Qualifications:

Experience as an Administrative Assistant supporting executives in a complex environment, preferably in financial services, private sector or government.
Ability to exercise excellent judgement and discretion in dealing with confidential material or handling highly sensitive information.
Excellent interpersonal skills and teamwork; ability and willingness to work collaboratively amongst assistant team based both locally and globally
Calm under pressure, can prioritize and handle multiple tasks efficiently and effectively in a busy environment
Requires excellent interpersonal and communication skills, both written & verbal. Ability to display a consistent, professional degree of communication.
Extreme attention to detail and organizational skills, with ability to prioritize tasks.
Quick learner and self-starter with excellent anticipation skills.
Pro-active problem solver and independent thinker; ability to follow-up as often as necessary.
Highest degree of integrity, professionalism, and diplomacy is required.
Strong proficiency in MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook and Zoom is required.
Familiar with expense platforms such as SAP Concur
Supportive team player with a positive attitude.
3-5 years of experience

Title: Customer Onboarding Specialist (Orlando)
Description:
About Fresha

Fresha is the leading marketplace platform for beauty & wellness trusted by millions of consumers and businesses worldwide.

Fresha is used by 130,000+ businesses and 450,000+ stylists and professionals worldwide, processing over 1 billion appointments to date across 120+ countries.

The company is headquartered in London, United Kingdom, with 12 global offices located across North America, EMEA and APAC.

Fresha allows consumers to discover, book and pay for beauty and wellness appointments with local businesses via its marketplace, while beauty and wellness businesses and professionals use an all-in-one platform to manage their entire operations with an intuitive subscription-free business software and financial technology solutions.

Fresha‚Äôs ecosystem gives merchants everything they need to run their business seamlessly by facilitating appointment bookings, point-of-sale, customer records management, marketing automation, loyalty, beauty products inventory and team management.

The consumer marketplace unlocks revenue potential for partner businesses by leveraging the power of online bookings and automated marketing through mobile apps and advanced integrations with major tech brands including Instagram, Facebook and Google.

Onboarding Specialist | Implementation Specialist | Professional Services Specialist

Given our exciting and progressive growth plans, we are looking for an exceptional Professional Services Specialist to come and join our global business.

Reporting into our Head of Professional Services and working closely with our Business Development and Account Management Teams, you will be accountable for ensuring a quality efficient build for all our Partners coming onto the Fresha Ecosystem through Inbound & Outbound channels in North America.

This is a great opportunity for someone looking to work in a fast-paced and changing environment, who likes to work autonomously, enjoys a challenge and wants to make an impact.

To foster a collaborative environment that thrives on face-to-face interactions and teamwork, all Fresha employees work from the office five days per week.

KPIs


Onboarding Lead time - average of 7 business days per Professional Services Specialist
New Partner Support - respond and train partners on SaaS adoption
High Volume Onboarding Funnel - 40 to 50 accounts built per month
Customer Satisfaction Score - Maintain a high customer satisfaction score



Partner Onboarding


Understand our partners business requirements, and confidently communicate the Fresha Onboarding approach and project plan
Be able to clearly articulate the Fresha Ecosystem including Fresha Pay Online, our Booking Software & the Marketplace in order to provide solutions into the Partners‚Äô business requirements
Lead the Partner on the onboarding journey, managing expectations, risks and ultimately accurate go live dates
Demonstrate strong attention to detail to ensure quality Fresha profiles are built for all our Partners with particular focus on activating all our payment features
Assist our partners in representing themselves in the best possible manner on our
Conduct trainings and onboarding for new businesses joining Fresha
Provide sufficient guidance and documentation to ensure a seamless handover experience for the partner to Partner Success or Customer Experience teams
Communicate clearly and effectively with off-shore teams to ensure proper manual data entry and migration
Ensure progress in all accounts through time management and prioritization



Marketplace


Provide continuous quality assurance on the Marketplace to ensure this looks good at all time



Additional Ad-Hoc


Comfortable presenting information, and open to feedback
Cover other team members Partner projects to ensure we win as a team
Ensure efficient and accurate use of Hubspot to accurately reflect the progress of each Partner in the Onboarding pipeline whilst also tracking all activity and correspondence
Proactively search for new features, processes & opportunities that may optimize our own internal processes, improve Partner experience and drive conversions
Supporting partners through banking and verification processes
Manage the logistics and troubleshooting of terminals



This list is not exhaustive and there may be other activities you are required to deliver.

Skills, Experience & Qualifications Required


Commercially minded, understanding critical needs of Partners onboarding
Managing expectations of Partner right from the start
Exceptionally high organizational and time management skillsExcellent oral and written communication skills
Proficient in Excel and data cleaning an asset
Project coordination experience or certification highly desired
Experience working in the Beauty & Wellness sector or previous start-up/scale-up tech company environment an asset
Ability to identify problems and opportunities as well as offer or implement actions and solutions
Strong analytical and troubleshooting skills
An ability to influence others through effective communication and negotiations
Flexible and comfortable working in a fast-paced and changing environment
Creative thinking and problem-solving mindset
Ability to interact with people from across the business and build strong relationships, including the ability to effectively influence upwards
Team player - must be happy to ‚Äòroll sleeves up‚Äô and assist the team whenever required
Self-starter and highly proactive approach



At Fresha, we value passion and potential as much as specific skills. If you're enthusiastic and eager to learn, we encourage you to apply, even if you don't meet every listed requirement. We believe in fostering growth and providing the support needed for you to excel in your role.

Interview Process


Screen Call - Video-call with a member from the Talent Team (30m)
Technical Ability & Cultural Assessment - Panel video-call with our Head of Professional Services



We aim to finalise the entire interview process and deliver feedback within 4 weeks.

Every job application received is reviewed manually by our talent team. While we strive to assess applications within 7 days, the sheer volume of talented individuals expressing interest may occasionally extend this timeframe.

Inclusive workforce

At Fresha, we are creating a culture where individuals of all backgrounds feel comfortable.

We want all Fresha people to feel included and truly empowered to contribute fully to our vision and goals. Everyone who applies will receive fair consideration for employment.

We do not discriminate based on race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, gender identity, national origin, disability, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which the candidate is applying.

If you have any accessibility requirements that would make you more comfortable during the interview process and/or once you join, please let us know so that we can support you.

Title: Consultant - MDG
Description:
About Us

Syniti is the enterprise data partner, empowering anyone who relies on data to make business-critical decisions by delivering data they can trust through a unique combination of intelligent software and experts who deeply understand the role of data in enterprise growth.

Trusted by the Fortune 2000, Syniti helps leading businesses reconfigure the role of enterprise data from afterthought to foundational first step; enabling them to unlock valuable insights that ignite growth, reduce risk, and expand their competitive advantage.

Syniti‚Äôs Data First philosophy and enterprise data management platform supports data migration, data quality, data replication, data matching, master data management, analytics, data governance, and data strategy in a single, unified solution.

As an innovative, global leader in Enterprise Data Management, the combination of our award-winning software platform and premier consultants creates a unique advantage for leading enterprises. Syniti is also a preferred data solution used by the world‚Äôs top system integrators, and a portfolio company of BridgeGrowth Partners LLC. Headquartered in Boston, Massachusetts with offices in 25 countries around the world, Syniti operates in all global regions and industry verticals, and maintains a 100% client success rate across thousands of complex data projects and initiatives.

Must-Have:-


ABAP Technical expertise. (OOABAP, WORKFLOWS, FPM-WEBDYNPRO)
Business Rule Framework (BRF +) hands on experience

Basic SAP ECC/S4 configuration experience

Title: Senior Engineer, Data & Analytics
Description:
Verified Job On Employer Career Site




Job Summary:

KeHE Distributors is an employee-owned distributor of natural and organic products, committed to making a positive impact and fostering development. The Senior Engineer of Data and Analytics will engage with internal stakeholders to define and deliver data engineering and analytics solutions, transforming data into actionable insights using both on-prem and cloud technologies.




Responsibilities:

‚Ä¢ Demonstrated ability to partner with internal product stakeholders to help define requirements and outcomes for data-focused initiatives.

‚Ä¢ Ability to decompose large problems and execute smaller, manageable bodies of work to demonstrate continuous architecture delivery.

‚Ä¢ Architects and manages scalable data pipelines across on-premises and cloud data repositories.

‚Ä¢ Creates data flow diagrams, and document source to target mapping

‚Ä¢ Utilizes their business acumen, analytical mindset, and strong communication/people skills to extract business requirements and translates them into actionable tasks.

‚Ä¢ Maintains the data warehouse performance by optimizing batch processing through parallelization, performance tuning, aggregations etc.

‚Ä¢ Creates user-facing dashboards that provide key insights for its specific audience.

‚Ä¢ Recognizes and adopts best practices and cost-effective solutions in developing analytical insights on prem and in the cloud.

‚Ä¢ Provides guidance and mentors junior team members.

‚Ä¢ Keeps current with Business Intelligence data trends and technological innovations

‚Ä¢ Executes on POC‚Äôs with new technologies, drive innovation, and new ideas

‚Ä¢ Other duties and projects as assigned.




Qualifications:




Required:

‚Ä¢ Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Finance, Computer Science, Information Systems, Operations Research, Mathematics, Statistics, or related field.

‚Ä¢ 7+ years leveraging Microsoft and its associated array of offerings (SQL, PL/SQL, SSIS, SSRS, SSAS, PowerBI, etc.)

‚Ä¢ 5+ years leveraging AWS and its associated array of offerings (Glue, Redshift, Athena, S3, Spectrum, PySpark etc.)

‚Ä¢ Able to collaborate with a development team with established source control (git).

‚Ä¢ Strong understanding of data modeling (i.e. conceptual, logical and physical model design, experience with Operation Data Stores, Enterprise Data warehouses and Data Marts).

‚Ä¢ Strong knowledge with business intelligence and data warehousing design principles and industry best practices including multi-dimensional modelling (star schemas, snowflakes, de-normalized models, handling ‚Äúslow changing‚Äù dimensions).

‚Ä¢ Ability to work with stakeholders and changing priorities

‚Ä¢ Ability to learn and apply new technologies to business problems.

‚Ä¢ Strong communication skills both verbally and written.

‚Ä¢ Ability to work independently and in a team environment.

‚Ä¢ Ability to multitask tasks.

‚Ä¢ Expert knowledge of Python and C#.




Company:

KeHE Distributors is a fresh and natural, organic wholesale foods distributor. Founded in 1953, the company is headquartered in Naperville, Illinois, USA, with a team of 5001-10000 employees. The company is currently Late Stage. KeHE Distributors has a track record of offering H1B sponsorships.

Title: Data Analyst (3-month internship)
Description:
Job Description

Purpose of the position:

Support our Commercial Finance Lead in building our regional data & analytics capabilities

Position Functions


Enable common Western Europe product hierarchy and product mix analysis standardization (60%)
Map local product hierarchies to WEBU hierarchy
Connect & Align with Marketing
Enable pricing strategy across Western Europe (20%)
Competitor Set Mapping
Analyze Items by price ranges & gaps vs competition
Enable Franchisee data sharing (Sales Growth, brand Metrics, Operations metrics 20%)
Test Franchisee user accesses / Test brand & ops metrics


Knowledge And Skills Required


Bachelor Degree
Good Excel / Microsoft Office Skills
Power BI knowledge is a plus
English fluent mandatory
Ability to connect with cross functional teams


#PanEurope

About Us

From the centre of the continent to the remote (and not-so-remote) coasts and islands, KFC Pan Europe is the iconic chicken restaurant brand with a unique history of innovation and success. Always original, our passion is high-quality, finger lickin‚Äô good chicken. Yes, we also have a secret recipe. No, we can‚Äôt share it. What we can share is our heart-led, welcoming culture, where you can be your best self, make a difference and have fun.

We‚Äôre part of Yum! Brands, Inc.‚Äîcollaborating across the world with our sister brands, Taco Bell, Pizza Hut and The Habit Burger Grill. KFC Pan Europe has three business units: Western Europe, Central & Eastern Europe and France. With more than 30 official languages in 150 different franchises, connecting with us is easier than ever. If you really want to do the math, we‚Äôve also got 2,200 restaurants in 40 countries. Either way, we keep it original.

For us, the future is all about connecting food traditions and tomorrow‚Äôs technology to innovate customer experiences, our global brand and the best fried chicken you‚Äôve ever tasted. We exist to feed people‚Äôs potential, valuing personal development and an inclusive culture. This also means having a keen social purpose and investing in mentorship, upskilling and food security. Creating opportunities for the most underserved and vulnerable groups in our communities helps grow new roots and strengthen bonds.

We want our people to be their best selves. So, we invest in skills, resources and each other. At our Pan Europe Academy, we develop leadership and train all levels of restaurant and corporate employees. From Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) to Individual Development Plans, we build meaningful careers that have real impact.

The bottom line? We bring it. Curious? We hope so.

Bring your spark, your spice and your original story. At KFC Pan Europe, we‚Äôre grounded in winning, celebrating, recognizing, welcoming and belonging. We've got a big table. You have a seat at it.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Senior Data Analyst

Job Location: Geneva, Switzerland

Job Term: Full-Time

The Opportunity

Picarro is transforming gas utility operations with innovative solutions for methane emissions management, risk-informed leak prioritization, and pipeline asset optimization. As a Data Analyst in Picarro's Gas Business Unit, you will play a critical role in developing analytical tools, generating insights from complex datasets, and driving operational improvements.

Reporting to the Sr. Director of Climate and Safety Solutions, you will work with cross-functional teams to develop ETL pipelines, automate data processing, and create reports that enhance internal decision-making and customer outcomes. The role is ideal for candidates with 1-2 years of experience or a recent Master's or Ph.D. graduate with strong data analysis skills.



Roles and Responsibilities


Data Processing and ETL Development ‚Äì Build and optimize automation tools and ETL pipelines for cleaning, normalizing, and structuring large-scale sensor and operational data.
Analysis and Insights ‚Äì Conduct data analysis on time-series, sensor, and geospatial datasets to identify trends, anomalies, and operational improvements.
Collaboration ‚Äì Work with product management, engineering, and customer success teams to ensure data workflows meet business needs.
Automation ‚Äì Develop scripts and processes in Python and SQL to improve data ingestion, processing, and reporting.
Documentation and Reporting ‚Äì Maintain clear documentation of methodologies, workflows, and results to support internal teams and customers.
Customer Support ‚Äì Assist in generating analytical deliverables and visualizations to support customer projects and business objectives.




Skills and Abilities


Technical Proficiency ‚Äì Strong Python and SQL skills for data automation and analysis.
Statistical and Analytical Skills ‚Äì Solid foundation in statistics, including hypothesis testing and uncertainty quantification.
Data Engineering Exposure ‚Äì Experience with ETL, data cleaning, and automation techniques.
GIS (Preferred but Not Required) ‚Äì Familiarity with GIS tools (e.g., ESRI ArcGIS, QGIS) for geospatial analysis is a plus.
Communication ‚Äì Ability to translate technical findings into actionable insights for both technical and non-technical audiences.
Problem-Solving ‚Äì Proactive approach to improving data processes and solving data quality challenges.


Qualifications


Master's or Ph.D. in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field (or Bachelor's with 1-2 years of experience in a relevant role).
Experience in Python, SQL, and data automation workflows.
Exposure to geospatial, time-series, or measurement data.
Industry experience in natural gas, utilities, or infrastructure is a plus.
Experience with ETL development, reporting automation, or cloud-based data processing is preferred.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Key Responsibilities

‚óè Drive Data Equivalency: Design and execution of study migration checks to formally assess and ensure data and output equivalency between legacy platforms (HPC and MS Azure) and the novel data analysis environment (AWS based).

‚óè Validation & Quality Assurance: Meticulously check data for completeness and correctness post-migration, troubleshooting and resolving any discrepancies to maintain the highest standards of data quality.

‚óè Script Migration & Adaptation: Assist study team‚Äôs adaptation of existing Python scripts from legacy systems to the new AWS workspace, ensuring they are optimized for performance and reliability.

‚óè User Onboarding & Support: Develop and deliver comprehensive onboarding materials, documentation, and training sessions to empower the team. Provide ongoing expert support to facilitate a smooth adoption of the new platform.

‚óè Cloud Environment Management: Assist in the creation and configuration of cloud workspaces and analytical environments tailored to the needs of specific studies and analysis tasks.

‚óè Independent Problem Solving: Proactively identify potential issues, bottlenecks, or risks in the migration process and independently develop and implement effective solutions.




‚óè Stakeholder Collaboration: Collaborate closely with study stakeholders to align on migration priorities, provide progress updates, and ensure the new platform capabilities meet their research needs.




Who You Are

You are a detail-oriented and self-reliant individual with a strong sense of ownership. You thrive in a collaborative environment where your technical expertise can directly empower your peers and advance scientific goals. You are adept at working effectively in a hybrid and multi-cultural team environment.




Required Qualifications & Experience:

‚óè University degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Bioinformatics, or a related quantitative field.

‚óè 3+ years of professional experience in a data analysis role, with a proven track record of working with sensor data.

‚óè Demonstrated, hands-on experience in performing data equivalency analysis and system-to-system data migration projects.

‚óè Strong proficiency in Python and its core data science libraries (e.g., Pandas, NumPy, SciPy).

‚óè Solid understanding of and practical experience with cloud computing environments, preferably AWS.

‚óè Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently to troubleshoot complex technical and data-related issues.

‚óè Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with an ability to explain complex concepts to a diverse audience.




Desired Qualifications:

‚óè Experience with the R programming language.

‚óè Familiarity with working in a regulated (e.g., GxP) environment and handling clinical study data.

‚óè Experience in creating technical documentation, training materials, or user guides.

Title: Data Analyst, Product Analytics
Description:
About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, travelers from over 170 countries have booked more than 200 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 700 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team Mission

The Analytics department's mission is to enable the organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel, from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement and take pride in the insights we generate.

As a Data Analyst in the Product Analytics team, you will support the Fulfillment mission‚Äîimproving the post-booking experience, empowering suppliers, and enabling Care to resolve issues efficiently. You‚Äôll work across the analytics funnel to drive measurement, strategy, and decision-making. Example problems include quantifying the impact of improved pickup selection on defect rate, identifying drivers of booking issues, or evaluating how post-booking communication affects traveller sentiment and retention.

You will


Design and analyze A/B tests to evaluate product changes and guide decision-making.
Develop quantitative analysis to drive product decisions
Help the product teams to learn about their features by designing and analyzing Experiments.
Design and implement metrics, dashboards, and reports to guide the teams‚Äô product strategy and success.
Support the technical teams in tracking and producing more insightful data.
Contribute to the learning and experimentation culture of the company by promoting hypothesis-driven product development and evaluation.


Who You Are


2-3 years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
Strong knowledge of SQL and knowledge of Python
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks)
Curiosity, reasoning skills with proven evidence of problem solving.
Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers
Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction and with highly engaged individuals
Ability to communicate data insights clearly to non-technical stakeholders, influencing decisions across product, engineering, and operations


Nice to have


Previous experience working with agile product teams is a plus.
Experienced with the statistics and assumptions of experimentation.
Familiarity with ETL technologies like Airflow is a plus.
Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus
Experience with LLM APIs (OpenAI, Gemini, Anthropic) is a plus.


How We Set You Up For Success


Meaningful work that helps create memorable travel experiences.
The opportunity to contribute to the
A diverse, inclusive environment where your voice is valued
Collaboration with smart, engaged colleagues from over 80 nationalities
English-speaking office environment
Continuous learning opportunities through monthly Hackathons, weekly tech talks, and an annual external training budget
Mentorship programs to support your growth and career development
Flexible working arrangements to support work-life balance
GetYourGuide vouchers.


And more‚Ä¶

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.

Title: PRIVATE EQUITY REPORTING & DATA ANALYST
Description:
For one of our clients, a well-established venture capital firm originating from Geneva, we are looking for a :




REPORTING & DATA ANALYTICS




Job description

The objective of the role is to help super-charge the Reporting & Analytics function, driving efficiencies and increased data-driven decision-making for the firm.

Understand investment and reporting systems architecture
Produce reports, statements, and dashboards
Review financial statements and cash flows
Support portfolio company valuation and year-end audit
Lead quantitative and qualitative analyses
Identify continuous improvements and support system implementation
Handle ad-hoc requests




Profil required

Bachelor's or Master's in finance, economics, engineering, or business
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and financial accounting
Database querying experience (SQL knowledge is a plus)
Strong attention to detail, multitasking, and communication skills
Experience in a fast-paced environment
Highly motivated, independent, adaptable
Excellent attention to detail and ownership of work quality
Strong multitasking and prioritization abilities
Critical thinking for process and report improvements
Fluent in English with excellent communication skills
Effective problem solver







All files will be treated with the utmost confidentiality.

Title: Intern Cocoa Sustainability Data Analyst (100%)
Description:
You are passionate about data and sustainability, like project work and have good experience and knowledge working with big data sets, analytics, coding and statistics, but want to learn more about corporate sustainability and the world of cocoa? Then you may be interested in doing an one year internship at Lindt & Spr√ºngli in the Cocoa Sustainability Team.







About Lindt & Spr√ºngli

Lindt & Spr√ºngli has been enchanting the world with chocolate for 180 years. The long-established Swiss company with its roots in Zurich is a global leader in the premium chocolate product sector. Lindt & Spr√ºngli produces quality chocolates today at its 12 factories in Europe and the USA. Its products are sold by 38 subsidiaries and branch offices in around 560 of its own stores as well as via a network of more than 100 independent distributors around the globe. In addition, Lindt & Spr√ºngli runs around 560 own shops. With around15,000 employees, the Lindt & Spr√ºngli Group reported sales of CHF 5.47 billion in 2024.







Our commitment to contributing to a more sustainable tomorrow is a key element driving the company‚Äôs actions and ambitions. For the responsible sourcing of its most important raw material cocoa, the company launched its own program in 2008: the Lindt & Spr√ºngli Farming Program.







Working at Lindt & Spr√ºngli headquarters offers flexible work set up with two days of home office per week. You will be working at our corporate offices in the beautiful Home of Chocolate building next to Lake Zurich in Kilchberg. You will have the opportunity to work in an enthusiastic small team and a welcoming work environment where you will be able to network and meet peers, including during our organized social events.







About the role

Reporting to the ‚ÄúMonitoring, Evaluation and Learning Lead‚Äù for Cocoa Sustainability and working together with a multi-disciplinary team of cocoa and sustainability experts, you will be a member of the Cocoa Sustainability Team at Lindt & Spr√ºngli's headquarters in Kilchberg. Amidst a changing regulatory environment, increasing sustainability requirements, and the need for data insights to guide decisions, you will have the opportunity to support sustainability work and gain experience at the heart of an internationally active, listed company and its premium chocolate brands. By supporting the dynamic cocoa team by analyzing monitoring and evaluation data from 7 cocoa sourcing regions to help steer decisions and by helping review carbon footprint data, you will gain hands-on and sought-after experience in the world of cocoa sustainability.







Main tasks and responsibilities

Maintain, quality check and further develop the Farming Program data bases
Support to review supplier reported raw datasets including geospatial data
Design and help roll out dashboards to display results for global Key Performance Indicators as well as thematic or origin specific KPIs
Run advanced statistical analysis on large data sets and present results for learning and continuous improvement purposes
Prepare forms and datasets for data collection
Compile and present reporting data for the annual sustainability statement
Support other external reporting tasks (benchmarking, surveys, membership reporting, etc)
Support to desktop review process for deforestation risk assessments
Support other tasks required by the cocoa team







Profile

Master‚Äôs degree graduate in science or engineering
Proficient knowledge and experience working with large datasets, advanced statistics, coding languages (python, R or similar) and creating dashboards (power BI)
Up to date knowledge of AI with experience of it‚Äôs application in data science
Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications (PowerPoint, Word, Excel, Teams)
Experience with study design, data collection, analysis and presentation of results
Working knowledge of GIS and use of QGIS
Fluency in English required. Knowledge or additional languages of German or French a plus
First professional experience in corporate sustainability or related area preferred
An affinity for sustainability matters and desire to create positive change
Excellent communication skills (written and verbal)
Organized and ability to work independently, but as a strong team player
Ability to work cross-functionally
High standards of quality and organization
Positive attitude and growth mindset

Show more

Title: Data Analyst

Responsabilities
Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and actionable insights.
Build and maintain dashboards and reports to support business functions.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data needs and deliver solutions.
Define and track key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure success.
Support data-driven decision-making through clear visualizations and storytelling.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity through validation and quality checks
Skills
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, Mathematics).
Proven experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or a similar role.
Strong SQL skills; experience with tools like Excel, Power BI, Tableau, or Looker.
Familiarity with Python or R.
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Strong communication skills with the ability to explain complex data in simple terms.
Fluent in English (written and spoken).

Title: Sac Data Analyst
Description:
üì£ Qim info ?

Qim info is an IT services company based in Switzerland for more than 15 years.

Our agencies in Geneva, Lausanne, Basel and Zurich in Switzerland as well as Annecy in France, together already counts 473 consultants and we are always looking for new talents to join our growing and ambitious company.

At the end of 2021, Qim info obtained the Happy at Work¬Æ label !

And ranks 3rd in the ICTJournal ranking in 2022.

üìå In few words

We are looking for a Data Analytics & Data Management Specialist to design and optimize SAP Analytics Cloud and Datasphere solutions, enabling advanced reporting, planning, and data integration across business processes.

üéØActivities

Design and customize analytics applications using SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) for both reporting and planning purposes.
Develop scalable and efficient data models and business layers in SAP Datasphere, integrating data from SAP and non-SAP sources.
Configure and maintain spaces, data flows, consumption models, and semantic views within Datasphere.
Ensure data models are optimized for performance, scalability, integrity, and availability.
Build and enhance interactive dashboards, analytical stories, and self-service visualizations in SAC.
Improve and stabilize existing SAC Planning implementations, including FTE planning, budgeting, data actions, and predictive functions.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and integrate SAC and Datasphere into end-to-end business processes.
Provide Level 2 and Level 3 technical support and guidance to internal teams and stakeholders.

üíº Your profil

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a scientific field with a focus on data analysis and architecture, or equivalent professional experience.
Strong expertise in SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) and SAP Datasphere.
Solid experience in data management, ETL processes, and data warehousing.
In-depth knowledge of SAC Planning processes, especially FTE planning and budgeting.
Proficiency in JavaScript or similar scripting languages.
Familiarity with non-SAP BI tools is a plus.
Demonstrated autonomy, proactivity, and a hands-on approach with a strong focus on delivery and problem-solving.
Excellent communication skills and ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams and across hierarchical levels.
Languages: Fluent in French and English; German is an asset.
Willingness to travel between Geneva and Wangen by D√ºbendorf as needed.

üèÜ Job conditions

Localisation : Geneva
Remote work : 1 day/week

üí•Your recruitment

Your first interview with one of our recruiters will be over the phone. The recruiter‚Äôs role is to understand your path and listen to your personal and professional aspirations.
Once you have been in contact with our teams, we will organise a technical evaluation of your expertise with one of our staff members.
An in-person interview with a Business Manager will then be organised to introduce you to the assignment or project we think would suit you best.
Finally, after any doubts are cleared up during the previous steps, the recruitment process ends with a hiring proposal.

üôå Why choose Qim info ?

üõ† Recognized IT expertise in the world of consulting with an activity focused around ten business sectors

ü§úü§õ Proximity and quality HR & managerial follow-up with our consultants to support them in their skills development and in their daily mission

ü•≥ Joining us is also sharing more than a coffee break! Qim tech talks, company evenings, Qim info Weekend‚Ä¶ many events are organized each year, enough to create beautiful memories together!

üîé Want to know more ?

We look forward to your application üòä

Title: Data & Insights Intern (m/f/x/d, 6 months, 100%)
Description:
Are you passionate about transforming complex financial data into meaningful insights? Join our dynamic Life & Health Reinsurance Finance team where you'll develop valuable skills in data analysis, financial reporting, and business intelligence while making a real impact on global business decisions!

About The Role

As a Data & Insights Intern, you'll be at the heart of our data-driven decision-making process, providing crucial transparency into our global Life & Health business operations through sophisticated data analysis and visualization.

Key Responsibilities


Analyze IFRS data and contribute to building robust data pipelines that transform raw information into actionable insights
Develop deep understanding of Life & Health business operations and IFRS reporting methodologies affecting income statements and balance sheets
Process and interpret performance measures and technical aspects of risk selection under IFRS reporting frameworks
Transform complex data from multiple sources into compelling visual narratives that support executive decision-making
Create standardized visualizations that effectively communicate key data stories and business messages to senior leadership
Collaborate cross-functionally with Regional Finance and Actuarial teams across multiple countries


The position is located in Zurich and the start date would be September 15, 2025.

About The Team

Within Reinsurance Finance, our Data & Insights team is responsible for comprehensive financial data analysis and the continuous enhancement of information-sharing tools for Life & Health Reinsurance worldwide. We leverage our extensive data resources and company network to provide senior management with critical insights into business performance, guiding them toward accurate and impactful decisions. Our team serves as a CFO function for both the Head of Life & Health Products and the Head of Life & Health Business Management. We maintain close collaboration with pricing and actuarial teams globally to ensure the highest quality of financial information and insights.

About You

You're an analytical thinker with a passion for translating numbers into meaningful stories. You thrive in collaborative environments and are eager to apply your technical skills to real-world business challenges. Your curiosity drives you to explore new technologies and methodologies that can enhance data processing and visualization.

We Are Looking For Candidates Who Meet These Requirements


Completed bachelor or master degree in statistics, economics, finance, business administration, or natural sciences
Strong analytical skills with the ability to critically evaluate numbers and draw relevant conclusions
Proficient in MS Excel and programming languages such as PySpark, Python, R, or similar tools
Basic understanding of financial statements, particularly IFRS17 principles
Excellent communication skills with fluency in written and spoken English


These Are Additional Nice To Haves


Actuarial background or coursework
Experience with cloud technology for developing data pipelines
Knowledge of data visualization tools and techniques
Additional language proficiencies beyond English
Previous internship experience in finance, data analysis, or related fields


What next?

We are looking forward to your application, including CV and cover letter!

The base salary range for this position will be shared with you during the interview process.

About Swiss Re

Swiss Re is one of the world‚Äôs leading providers of reinsurance, insurance and other forms of insurance-based risk transfer, working to make the world more resilient. We anticipate and manage a wide variety of risks, from natural catastrophes and climate change to cybercrime. We cover both Property & Casualty and Life & Health. Combining experience with creative thinking and cutting-edge expertise, we create new opportunities and solutions for our clients. This is possible thanks to the collaboration of more than 14,000 employees across the world.

Our success depends on our ability to build an inclusive culture encouraging fresh perspectives and innovative thinking. We embrace a workplace where everyone has equal opportunities to thrive and develop professionally regardless of their age, gender, race, ethnicity, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, physical or mental ability, skillset, thought or other characteristics. In our inclusive and flexible environment everyone can bring their authentic selves to work and their passion for sustainability.

If you are an experienced professional returning to the workforce after a career break, we encourage you to apply for open positions that match your skills and experience.

Title: Associate / Senior Analyst ‚Äì Reporting & Analytics
Description:
About the company

Phoenix Search has partnered with a renowned venture capital firm with a strong presence in technology-enabled industries such as e-commerce, fintech, mobility, gaming, and AI. With a global presence, they have a successful track record of 30 years in the industry. The firm is

committed to driving innovation and growth through strategic investments and exceptional portfolio management.




The opportunity

We are seeking a Senior Analyst/Associate to enhance the Reporting &

Analytics function within the Operations Team. This role is pivotal in

driving efficiencies and fostering data-driven decision-making across

the firm. The ideal candidate will have a passion for global financial

markets, an analytical mindset, and thrive in a dynamic environment.




If you are ready to contribute to a high-performing team and make an

impact through your analytical skills, this could be the perfect

opportunity for you.




Responsibilities

Analyse the architecture and relationships within investment and reporting systems.
Prepare quarterly reports, capital account statements, and fund dashboards.
Review financial statements and cash flows for consistency with deliverables.
Support portfolio company valuations through rigorous analysis.
Lead quantitative and qualitative analyses to derive insights.
Synthesise portfolio performance data to aid in year-end fund audits.
Identify and implement continuous improvements to enhance reporting efficiency.
Address ad-hoc requests from both internal and external stakeholders.




Requirements

Degree qualified (Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs) in finance, economics, engineering, or business.
Strong Excel skills and solid understanding of financial accounting principles.
Familiarity with databases (SQL a plus); MacOS experience is beneficial.
Detail-oriented, motivated, and able to work independently in a fast-paced environment.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English, with a critical eye for process improvement.

Title: Merchandising Data Analyst
Description:
Who We Are

Kontoor Brands, Inc. (KTB) is the parent company of Wrangler¬Æ, Lee¬Æ and Rock & Republic¬Æ, with owned manufacturing facilities in Mexico. Kontoor also owns and operates over 140 retail stores across the globe. Our global company employs more than 13,000 people in 65 countries, with world headquarters in Greensboro, North Carolina, and regional headquarters in Geneva and Hong Kong.

Job Posting

Merchandising Data Analyst

Location: Geneva // Switzerland

Join Kontoor Brands, home to iconic denim brands Wrangler¬Æ and Lee¬Æ. We design high-quality apparel that empowers self-expression. Be part of our global community of 17,000+ employees, fostering collaboration and innovation. Grow with us in our Geneva office and shape the future!

What‚Äôs the scope?

Reporting into the EMEA Merchandising Director, the Merchandising Data Analyst collects, processes, analyzes and interprets retail, wholesale and product data to support Merchandising decisions. The Analyst works closely with Merchandising and Planning Team to optimize product assortment, pricing strategies and buying decisions. The key responsibilities include generating reports, identifying trends and providing actionable insights.

Your Responsibilities As Our Merchandising Data Analyst


Collect data from multiple sources and combine it into consolidated reports that are easy to analyze.
Design and generate reports related to sell-through, total business performance, bestsellers, regional performance, and market trends.
Highlight any significant changes or deviations in performance and interpret potential impacts on product and retail strategy.
Work closely with product, retail, and merchandising teams to understand data needs, share insights, and provide recommendations for future strategies.
Track key performance indicators (KPIs) to ensure merchandising and product strategies are on track.
Provide additional analysis and custom reports as requested by senior leadership or specific teams to help with decision-making.


Skills For Success


A Bachelor‚Äôs degree and 3‚Äì5 years of experience in retail or merchandising analytics.
A strong understanding of product performance, retail dynamics, and merchandising strategy.
Advanced skills in Microsoft Office, with solid experience in SQL, Power BI, or similar data tools.
Fluency in English, both written and verbal; additional European languages are a plus.
Strong analytical thinking, problem-solving ability, and a sharp eye for detail.
A collaborative mindset and the ability to communicate insights clearly and effectively.


We Offer

We value trust, transparency, collaboration, and innovation, and focus on sustainability and teamwork. Our purpose, mission, and values guide us towards continuous growth and leveraging cutting-edge sustainable technologies.

Benefits And Perks Include


Competitive salary package
Discounts on Wrangler¬Æ & Lee¬Æ brands
Casual denim dress code at work and beyond
A multicultural, diverse, and inclusive workforce with employees from various nationalities
Employee resource groups focused on diversity, sustainability, wellbeing, and social activities
Opportunities for professional development and career growth
Advantages of being part of a global company


Why Kontoor Brands?

At Kontoor, we offer a comprehensive benefit package to fit your lifestyle. Our benefits are crafted with the same care as our products.

When our employees are healthy, secure, and well, they bring their best selves to work. Kontoor Brands supports you with a competitive benefits program that provides choice and flexibility to meet your and your family‚Äôs needs ‚Äì now and in the future. We offer resources to support your physical, emotional, social, and financial wellbeing, plus benefits like discounts on our apparel. Kontoor Brands also provides four weeks of Paid Parental Leave to eligible employees who are new parents, Flexible Fridays, and Tuition Reimbursement.

We are proud to offer a workplace culture centered on equitable opportunities and a sense of belonging for all team members. Here we have a global workforce of high-performing teams that both unlocks our individual uniqueness and harnesses our collaborative talents.

Title: Data Business Analyst & Power BI Specialist
Description:
Switzerland

Data Business Analyst & Power BI Specialist

Organization


M√©decins Sans Fronti√®res en Suisse


Posted 30 Jul 2025 Closing date 17 Aug 2025

Job Offer

(strictly no recruitment agencies)

Join MSF OCG as a Data Business Analyst & Power BI Specialist!

We are looking for passionate candidates ready to contribute to our humanitarian mission.

Below, you will find the job details and the qualifications we are looking for.

Inclusivity and Diversity at MSF

Do your qualifications and experience not exactly match all requirements of the job?

At MSF OCG, we are committed to an inclusive culture that supports and amplifies the diverse voices of our staff members. We strive to create workplaces where teams of people with diverse backgrounds, characteristics, perspectives, ideas and experiences work together to advance MSF's social mission and create better outcomes for our patients and the communities we work with.

We understand that some people may hesitate to apply for employment if they don't meet all listed job requirements. Research shows that this is especially true for women. If you believe your profile is a good match for this position, we invite you to apply even if you don‚Äôt fulfil every listed qualification.

We encourage applications from individuals of all genders, ages, sexual orientations, ethnicities, background, religions, beliefs, ability status, and all other diversity characteristics.

MSF does not tolerate sexual exploitation and abuse, any kind of discrimination or harassment, including sexual harassment. All selected candidates will undergo reference checks.

Context & mission

M√©decins Sans Fronti√®res is an independent, international medical and humanitarian organization that provides care to people in need, people affected by natural or man-made disasters, and victims of armed conflict, without discrimination and without regard to race, religion, creed or political affiliation (MSF Charter).

The MSF movement is built around 5 operational centers supported by 24 sections and offices worldwide. MSF Operational Center Geneva (MSF OCG) is one of these centers.

Are you passionate about turning data into actionable insights? At MSF Switzerland, we're looking for a Data Business Analyst & Power BI Specialist to play a key role in shaping our self-service data platform and enterprise reporting.

In this role, you‚Äôll wear two hats. First, as a Business Analyst, you‚Äôll work closely with different departments to understand their reporting needs, listening, analyzing, and documenting requirements to ensure we‚Äôre solving the right problems. Then, you‚Äôll switch gears and become our Power BI expert, building intuitive reports, clean datasets, and powerful semantic models using Power BI and Microsoft Fabric.

You won‚Äôt be working in isolation. You‚Äôll be a vital part of a cross-functional project team alongside our Data Architect, Data Engineers, and key stakeholders, you will be part of the BRIDGE (Bringing Resources & Intelligence for Dynamic Global Engagement) project team, integrated to the DIP (Data, Innovation and Project) section, which is part of the DSI (Direction of the Systems of Information).

You‚Äôll help make sure everything we build aligns with both business goals and our data governance standards, thus influencing the adoption of the new dashboards.

If you're ready to dive into a meaningful data journey and make a real difference through your work, we‚Äôd love to hear from you.

Fixed-term contract for 12 months, with potential for renewal based on evolving project requirements.

Tasks & Responsibilities


Business Needs Collection: Collect, analyze, and structure reporting needs across departments and domains.
Requirements Documentation: Translate business requirements into documented reporting specifications and data needs.
Request Prioritization: Prioritize and organize reporting requests and ensure traceability from request to solution.
Governed Reporting Design: Participate in the design and evolution of a governed reporting environment using Power BI and Microsoft Fabric.
Report & Dashboard Implementation: Build and deploy interactive, user-friendly reports and dashboards tailored to business objectives.
