Title: EP Mapping Specialist I - Minneapolis, MN
Description:
Additional Location(s): N/A

Diversity - Innovation - Caring - Global Collaboration - Winning Spirit - High Performance

At Boston Scientific, we‚Äôll give you the opportunity to harness all that‚Äôs within you by working in teams of diverse and high-performing employees, tackling some of the most important health industry challenges. With access to the latest tools, information and training, we‚Äôll help you in advancing your skills and career. Here, you‚Äôll be supported in progressing ‚Äì whatever your ambitions.

Interested in hearing from an Electrophysiology Mapping Specialist at Boston Scientific? Check out our video featuring Gianna to learn more about the role.

About The Role

Now is an exciting time to join our Cardiology team as we launch groundbreaking solutions in the Electrophysiology (EP) market‚Äîone of the fastest-growing areas in med tech. Boston Scientific offers a comprehensive portfolio to treat atrial fibrillation (AFib), including Cryo, Radiofrequency, and Pulsed Field Ablation therapy (FARAPULSE‚Ñ¢).

Our technologies encompass 3D Mapping and Navigation systems, Radiofrequency Ablation catheters, Diagnostic Catheters, EP recording systems, and Intracardiac Access Sheaths to diagnose and treat heart rhythm disorders.

In this field-based role, the Electrophysiology Mapping Specialist will begin with an intensive training and development program to gain in-depth knowledge of our technologies and prepare for success. Upon completion, the specialist will provide expert clinical, technical, and educational support to physicians, EP Lab staff, and sales representatives during cardiac procedures using the Opal HDx‚Ñ¢ mapping system within a defined territory‚Äîcontributing directly to patient care and business objectives.

Your Responsibilities Will Include


Maintaining advanced clinical knowledge of EP diagnostic and ablation technologies, PFA, mapping and recording systems, transeptal access tools, and left atrial appendage occlusion technologies I add


Attending procedures in cardiac CV/EP labs to provide clinical support on Boston Scientific AF Solutions products, including the Opal HDx‚Ñ¢ mapping system, FARAPULSE‚Ñ¢, transeptal access tools, diagnostic and therapeutic catheters, and WATCHMAN FLX‚Ñ¢ devices


Educating customers on clinical usage and benefits of AF Solutions products through customized presentations, demonstrations, and ongoing training


Meeting with physicians and clinical stakeholders to assess their needs and demonstrate how Boston Scientific products support optimal patient outcomes


Developing relationships with hospital staff, physicians, and administrators to expand influence across departments and facilitate strategic decision-making


Responding to clinical and technical inquiries by collaborating across functions including sales, clinical research, marketing, and technical support


Demonstrating change leadership and collaborating cross-functionally to align local activities with broader strategic goals


Implementing strategies outlined in quarterly action plans and coordinating efforts with sales teams to advance business objectives


Supporting physician education and market development by engaging referring physicians, fellows, and key opinion leaders


Training on and adhering to clinical trial protocols and compliance standards in line with global regulatory expectations


Managing clinical trial activity within the territory, including Interest Visits and Site Initiation Visits, and educating investigators on study procedures and products

Required Qualifications


Bachelor's degree in biomedical or mechanical engineering

Requisition ID: 611456

The anticipated annualized base amount or range for this full time position will be $85,000.00, plus variable compensation governed by the Sales Incentive Compensation Plan (which includes certain annual non-discretionary incentives based on predetermined objectives) as well as the value of core and optional benefits offered at BSC, which can be reviewed at www.bscbenefitsconnect.com. Actual compensation will be commensurate with demonstrable level of experience and training, pertinent education including licensure and certifications, and other relevant business or organizational needs.

For MA positions: It is unlawful to require or administer a lie detector test for employment. Violators are subject to criminal penalties and civil liability.

As a leader in medical science for more than 40 years, we are committed to solving the challenges that matter most ‚Äì united by a deep caring for human life. Our mission to advance science for life is about transforming lives through innovative medical solutions that improve patient lives, create value for our customers, and support our employees and the communities in which we operate. Now more than ever, we have a responsibility to apply those values to everything we do ‚Äì as a global business and as a global corporate citizen.

So, choosing a career with Boston Scientific (NYSE: BSX) isn‚Äôt just business, it‚Äôs personal. And if you‚Äôre a natural problem-solver with the imagination, determination, and spirit to make a meaningful difference to people worldwide, we encourage you to apply and look forward to connecting with you!

At Boston Scientific, we recognize that nurturing a diverse and inclusive workplace helps us be more innovative and it is important in our work of advancing science for life and improving patient health. That is why we stand for inclusion, equality, and opportunity for all. By embracing the richness of our unique backgrounds and perspectives, we create a better, more rewarding place for our employees to work and reflect the patients, customers, and communities we serve. Boston Scientific is proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer.

Boston Scientific maintains a prohibited substance free workplace. Pursuant to Va. Code


2.2-4312 (2000), Boston Scientific is providing notification that the unlawful manufacture, sale, distribution, dispensation, possession, or use of a controlled substance or marijuana is prohibited in the workplace and that violations will result in disciplinary action up to and including termination.


Please be advised that certain US based positions, including without limitation field sales and service positions that call on hospitals and/or health care centers, require acceptable proof of COVID-19 vaccination status. Candidates will be notified during the interview and selection process if the role(s) for which they have applied require proof of vaccination as a condition of employment. Boston Scientific continues to evaluate its policies and protocols regarding the COVID-19 vaccine and will comply with all applicable state and federal law and healthcare credentialing requirements. As employees of the Company, you will be expected to meet the ongoing requirements for your roles, including any new requirements, should the Company‚Äôs policies or protocols change with regard to COVID-19 vaccination.

Among other requirements, Boston Scientific maintains specific prohibited substance testing requirements for safety-sensitive positions. This role is deemed safety-sensitive and, as such, candidates will be subject to a drug test as a pre-employment requirement. The goal of the drug testing is to increase workplace safety in compliance with the applicable law.

Title: Adventure Coordinator | Remote
Description:
Title: Adventure Coordinator
Job Type: Full-time / Part-time / Remote

Location: Remote (Work from Home)

About Us:
At Destination Knot, we specialize in creating unforgettable cruise experiences by offering expert travel planning services. As a trusted name in the travel industry, we are committed to providing exceptional customer service and seamless booking experiences. We partner with top cruise lines to ensure our clients receive the best deals, amenities, and tailored itineraries.

Job Summary:
We are looking for a detail-oriented and customer-focused Adventure Coordinator to join our team. In this role, you will assist clients with selecting, booking, and managing their cruise vacations. You will leverage your knowledge of the cruise industry to recommend the best options based on clients‚Äô preferences, budgets, and needs. This is a remote role that requires excellent communication, sales, and organizational skills.

Key Responsibilities:


Assist clients with cruise inquiries, reservations, and modifications via phone, email, and online platforms
Provide expert guidance on cruise destinations, itineraries, ship amenities, and travel requirements
Process bookings and payments while ensuring accuracy and compliance with company policies
Maintain strong relationships with clients by offering personalized service and follow-ups
Stay updated on cruise line promotions, policies, and travel regulations
Collaborate with cruise partners to secure the best deals and exclusive perks for clients
Address client concerns and troubleshoot any booking-related issues professionally
Upsell and cross-sell additional travel services, such as excursions, travel insurance, and pre/post-cruise accommodations





Qualifications:


Previous experience in travel sales, reservations, or customer service (preferred but not required)
Strong knowledge of cruise lines, destinations, and travel industry trends
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Ability to multitask and manage multiple bookings efficiently
Sales-oriented mindset with a passion for helping clients plan memorable vacations
Proficiency with online booking systems, CRM software, and Microsoft Office Suite
Self-motivated and able to work independently in a remote environment
Certification in travel or cruise industry (e.g., CLIA certification) is a plus





Benefits:


Flexible work schedule with remote opportunities
Exclusive travel discounts and industry perks
Ongoing training and professional development
Career growth opportunities within the company





How to Apply:
If you are passionate about travel and enjoy creating unforgettable cruise experiences, we would love to hear from you! Apply today by submitting your resume and a brief cover letter outlining your relevant experience and enthusiasm for the role.

We are looking for a detail-oriented and customer-focused Adventure Coordinator to join our team. In this role, you will assist clients with selecting, booking, and managing their cruise vacations. You will leverage your knowledge of the cruise industry to recommend the best options based on clients‚Äô preferences, budgets, and needs. This is a remote role that requires excellent communication, sales, and organizational skills.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Assist clients with cruise inquiries, reservations, and modifications via phone, email, and online platforms
  • Provide expert guidance on cruise destinations, itineraries, ship amenities, and travel requirements
  • Process bookings and payments while ensuring accuracy and compliance with company policies
  • Maintain strong relationships with clients by offering personalized service and follow-ups
  • Stay updated on cruise line promotions, policies, and travel regulations
  • Collaborate with cruise partners to secure the best deals and exclusive perks for clients
  • Address client concerns and troubleshoot any booking-related issues professionally
  • Upsell and cross-sell additional travel services, such as excursions, travel insurance, and pre/post-cruise accommodations




Qualifications:

  • Previous experience in travel sales, reservations, or customer service (preferred but not required)
  • Strong knowledge of cruise lines, destinations, and travel industry trends
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability to multitask and manage multiple bookings efficiently
  • Sales-oriented mindset with a passion for helping clients plan memorable vacations
  • Proficiency with online booking systems, CRM software, and Microsoft Office Suite
  • Self-motivated and able to work independently in a remote environment
  • Certification in travel or cruise industry (e.g., CLIA certification) is a plus




Benefits:

  • Flexible work schedule with remote opportunities
  • Exclusive travel discounts and industry perks
  • Ongoing training and professional development
  • Career growth opportunities within the company




How to Apply:
If you are passionate about travel and enjoy creating unforgettable cruise experiences, we would love to hear from you! Apply today by submitting your resume and a brief cover letter outlining your relevant experience and enthusiasm for the role.

Title: Remote Solutions Consultant
Description:
Join a dynamic company that values innovation and excellence. Whether you are an experienced sales professional or a newcomer, this remote role offers flexibility and the opportunity to ignite your career. Maximize your earning potential with our support and embark on a fulfilling career path.

Key Responsibilities:
- Collaborate with seasoned mentors and excel in a supportive team setting.
- Initiate client interactions via phone to understand their needs.
- Schedule and lead virtual consultations (via Zoom or phone) for comprehensive discussions.
- Design personalized insurance quotes to meet each client's needs.
- Present effective solutions to close sales and provide customized insurance plans.

What We Offer:

- Healthcare exchange for medical, dental, and vision
- Performance-based bonuses
- Incentive trips for top performers

This is a 1099 independent contractor position and compensation is commission-based only.

Title: Junior Cloud Engineer
Description:
Job Title: Junior Cloud Engineer (**Immediate Joining**)

Location: [Anywhere in USA]

Experience: 1‚Äì3 years

Employment Type: Full-Time




**NO SPONSPORSHIP**




Are you excited about taking your technical career to new heights with a full-time, W-2 role as a consultant in a dynamic and rapidly growing company? If you are, let's get in touch ‚Äì your interest is the first step to starting the conversation.

Core Skills and Requirements

1. Basic Linux Knowledge

Comfortable working in a Linux terminal (CLI) environment.
Able to perform basic file operations (create, copy, move, delete files/folders).
Understand and manage file and directory permissions, ownership, and basic user management.
Use of common Linux utilities like grep, top, df, ps, and chmod.




2. Basic Networking Fundamentals

Understanding of IP addressing, subnetting, and what private/public IPs mean.
Knowledge of DNS (Domain Name System) and how name resolution works.
Familiarity with HTTP/HTTPS protocols, what ports are, and what firewalls do at a high level.




3. Scripting Basics

Ability to read and write basic shell scripts (Bash) to automate repetitive tasks.
Some hands-on experience or learning in Python for simple scripting or tool use.




4. Git Version Control

Comfortable using Git for source code management.
Understand how to clone repositories, commit changes, push and pull code, and create branches.
Familiar with GitHub




5. CI/CD Concepts

Basic understanding of what Continuous Integration (CI) and Continuous Deployment (CD) are.
Awareness of tools like Jenkins, GitHub Actions, or Azure DevOps, even if not deeply experienced.
Understand how code goes from development to production in an automated way.




6. Container Awareness

Have heard of Docker and understand the basic purpose of containers (e.g., "run applications in isolated environments").
Understand the difference between containers and virtual machines at a high level.
Basic idea of what Docker images and containers are.




7. Cloud Computing Fundamentals

Awareness of cloud platforms like AWS and Azure
Understand concepts like virtual machines, storage, and networking in the cloud.
Know why organizations use the cloud (scalability, flexibility, cost-efficiency).




Nice to Have (Bonus Skills)

These are not mandatory, but having some exposure will be a plus:

Infrastructure as Code (IaC): Basic idea of tools like Terraform ‚Äì used to define cloud infrastructure using code.
Monitoring and Logging: Awareness of tools like Prometheus (for monitoring) and Grafana (for dashboards).
Basic YAML knowledge: Since tools like Kubernetes and GitHub Actions use YAML, familiarity helps.




Soft Skills

Willingness to learn new tools and concepts.
Good problem-solving attitude.
Ability to follow documentation and troubleshoot issues.
Comfortable working in a team and asking questions when stuck.

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
Job Summary




We‚Äôre looking for a AI Engineer to support our team. This role offers the opportunity to work on meaningful projects, collaborate with talented colleagues, and contribute to the success of a growing company. If you‚Äôre someone who takes initiative, values continuous learning, and thrives in a collaborative setting, we‚Äôd love to hear from you.




Key Responsibilities




Strong programming skills in Python or equivalent (Go/Node.js is a plus)

Experience in developing autonomous agents and agentic workflows using frameworks like LangChain, AutoGen, or similar

Hands-on with Cursor AI for development, debugging, and agent orchestration

Experience building and consuming RESTful APIs.

Manage the data flow and infrastructure for effective AI deployment.

Collaborate across teams to align AI initiatives with organizational goals.




About CLPS




CLPS Incorporation (NASDAQ: CLPS) is a global technology and consulting firm specializing in end-to-end digital transformation solutions. Since our founding in 2005, we‚Äôve expanded our footprint across 10 countries, with regional hubs in China, Singapore, and the United States, and our headquarters in Hong Kong. Leveraging advanced technologies such as AI, cloud computing, and big data, we deliver innovative services across key sectors including fintech, payments, e-commerce, education, and travel tech. Our mission is to empower businesses to become intelligent, data-driven enterprises. Join CLPS and be part of an innovative, fast-growing team shaping the future of technology across industries.

Title: Senior Analyst - Tech Ops Analytics
Description:
Verified Job On Employer Career Site




Job Summary:

United Airlines is a leading airline company that offers a chance to grow your career while enjoying top-tier health and wellness benefits. They are seeking a Senior Analyst for their Technical Operations Analytics team to turn data into actionable insights that drive business decisions related to maintenance planning and operational efficiency.




Responsibilities:

‚Ä¢ Explore and mine data, identify key issues, apply rigorous statistical analysis, and present findings with our stakeholders and organizational leaders

‚Ä¢ Review existing reports, dashboards, and performance indicators to modify, enhance, and develop new reports

‚Ä¢ Extracts data from a variety of sources for use in analysis and models; completes ad-hoc reporting and data analysis

‚Ä¢ Encourage development and sharing of internal best practices and foster collaboration with internal and external teams

‚Ä¢ Develop statistical models to improve forecasts, labor productivity, operational metrics, financial performance, etc




Qualifications:




Required:

‚Ä¢ Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field like Math, Statistics, Operations Research, Economics, Computer Science, Engineering, or related field required

‚Ä¢ At least 2-4 years of work experience in analytics

‚Ä¢ Strong analytical skills with experience in collecting, manipulating, and analyzing complex and high-volume data from various sources to highlight patterns and relationships

‚Ä¢ Proven comfort and an intellectual curiosity for working with large sets of data with attention to detail and accuracy, and pulling in relevant team members to address identified - and sometimes undiscovered - needs

‚Ä¢ Experience in building presentations for senior leadership

‚Ä¢ Query relational databases using SQL (Teradata, Microsoft, Oracle, MySQL, etc.)

‚Ä¢ Transform and model data in a quantitative analysis software package or language (Python, R, SAS, etc)

‚Ä¢ Experience using data visualization tools (ie. Spotfire, Tableau, ggplot2, etc.)

‚Ä¢ Must be legally authorized to work in the United States for any employer without sponsorship

‚Ä¢ Successful completion of interview required to meet job qualification

‚Ä¢ Reliable, punctual attendance is an essential function of the position




Preferred:

‚Ä¢ Master's degree in a quantitative field like Math, Statistics, Operations

‚Ä¢ At least 1 year of airline experience preferred

‚Ä¢ Basic programming skills for web scraping and experience of working with non-structured data

‚Ä¢ Work autonomously to learn from subject matter experts, identify gaps in data, and generate quantitative solutions to problems

‚Ä¢ Understanding of airline maintenance operations




Company:

United Airlines is an aviation company that provides information on reservations, bookings, and travel services online. Founded in 1926, the company is headquartered in Chicago, Illinois, USA, with a team of 10001+ employees. The company is currently Public Company.

Title: Customer Onboarding Specialist (Orlando)
Description:
About Fresha

Fresha is the leading marketplace platform for beauty & wellness trusted by millions of consumers and businesses worldwide.

Fresha is used by 130,000+ businesses and 450,000+ stylists and professionals worldwide, processing over 1 billion appointments to date across 120+ countries.

The company is headquartered in London, United Kingdom, with 12 global offices located across North America, EMEA and APAC.

Fresha allows consumers to discover, book and pay for beauty and wellness appointments with local businesses via its marketplace, while beauty and wellness businesses and professionals use an all-in-one platform to manage their entire operations with an intuitive subscription-free business software and financial technology solutions.

Fresha‚Äôs ecosystem gives merchants everything they need to run their business seamlessly by facilitating appointment bookings, point-of-sale, customer records management, marketing automation, loyalty, beauty products inventory and team management.

The consumer marketplace unlocks revenue potential for partner businesses by leveraging the power of online bookings and automated marketing through mobile apps and advanced integrations with major tech brands including Instagram, Facebook and Google.

Onboarding Specialist | Implementation Specialist | Professional Services Specialist

Given our exciting and progressive growth plans, we are looking for an exceptional Professional Services Specialist to come and join our global business.

Reporting into our Head of Professional Services and working closely with our Business Development and Account Management Teams, you will be accountable for ensuring a quality efficient build for all our Partners coming onto the Fresha Ecosystem through Inbound & Outbound channels in North America.

This is a great opportunity for someone looking to work in a fast-paced and changing environment, who likes to work autonomously, enjoys a challenge and wants to make an impact.

To foster a collaborative environment that thrives on face-to-face interactions and teamwork, all Fresha employees work from the office five days per week.

KPIs


Onboarding Lead time - average of 7 business days per Professional Services Specialist
New Partner Support - respond and train partners on SaaS adoption
High Volume Onboarding Funnel - 40 to 50 accounts built per month
Customer Satisfaction Score - Maintain a high customer satisfaction score



Partner Onboarding


Understand our partners business requirements, and confidently communicate the Fresha Onboarding approach and project plan
Be able to clearly articulate the Fresha Ecosystem including Fresha Pay Online, our Booking Software & the Marketplace in order to provide solutions into the Partners‚Äô business requirements
Lead the Partner on the onboarding journey, managing expectations, risks and ultimately accurate go live dates
Demonstrate strong attention to detail to ensure quality Fresha profiles are built for all our Partners with particular focus on activating all our payment features
Assist our partners in representing themselves in the best possible manner on our
Conduct trainings and onboarding for new businesses joining Fresha
Provide sufficient guidance and documentation to ensure a seamless handover experience for the partner to Partner Success or Customer Experience teams
Communicate clearly and effectively with off-shore teams to ensure proper manual data entry and migration
Ensure progress in all accounts through time management and prioritization



Marketplace


Provide continuous quality assurance on the Marketplace to ensure this looks good at all time



Additional Ad-Hoc


Comfortable presenting information, and open to feedback
Cover other team members Partner projects to ensure we win as a team
Ensure efficient and accurate use of Hubspot to accurately reflect the progress of each Partner in the Onboarding pipeline whilst also tracking all activity and correspondence
Proactively search for new features, processes & opportunities that may optimize our own internal processes, improve Partner experience and drive conversions
Supporting partners through banking and verification processes
Manage the logistics and troubleshooting of terminals



This list is not exhaustive and there may be other activities you are required to deliver.

Skills, Experience & Qualifications Required


Commercially minded, understanding critical needs of Partners onboarding
Managing expectations of Partner right from the start
Exceptionally high organizational and time management skillsExcellent oral and written communication skills
Proficient in Excel and data cleaning an asset
Project coordination experience or certification highly desired
Experience working in the Beauty & Wellness sector or previous start-up/scale-up tech company environment an asset
Ability to identify problems and opportunities as well as offer or implement actions and solutions
Strong analytical and troubleshooting skills
An ability to influence others through effective communication and negotiations
Flexible and comfortable working in a fast-paced and changing environment
Creative thinking and problem-solving mindset
Ability to interact with people from across the business and build strong relationships, including the ability to effectively influence upwards
Team player - must be happy to ‚Äòroll sleeves up‚Äô and assist the team whenever required
Self-starter and highly proactive approach



At Fresha, we value passion and potential as much as specific skills. If you're enthusiastic and eager to learn, we encourage you to apply, even if you don't meet every listed requirement. We believe in fostering growth and providing the support needed for you to excel in your role.

Interview Process


Screen Call - Video-call with a member from the Talent Team (30m)
Technical Ability & Cultural Assessment - Panel video-call with our Head of Professional Services



We aim to finalise the entire interview process and deliver feedback within 4 weeks.

Every job application received is reviewed manually by our talent team. While we strive to assess applications within 7 days, the sheer volume of talented individuals expressing interest may occasionally extend this timeframe.

Inclusive workforce

At Fresha, we are creating a culture where individuals of all backgrounds feel comfortable.

We want all Fresha people to feel included and truly empowered to contribute fully to our vision and goals. Everyone who applies will receive fair consideration for employment.

We do not discriminate based on race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, gender identity, national origin, disability, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which the candidate is applying.

If you have any accessibility requirements that would make you more comfortable during the interview process and/or once you join, please let us know so that we can support you.

üíº Le Tue Responsabilit√†:

Analisi dati: raccogliere, elaborare e analizzare dati aziendali e da fonti esterne, sviluppare e implementare database per consentire l‚Äôanalisi delle performance aziendali e la definizione di obiettivi.
Pianificazione: collaborare con il team per sviluppare piani strategici e operativi basati sull'analisi dei dati, supportando le attivit√† di budgeting, forecasting e simulazioni.
Controllo di gestione: supportare il monitoraggio e la valutazione delle performance aziendali rispetto ai budget e ai forecast e la conseguente analisi degli scostamenti rispetto ai risultati attesi. Supportare il team nello sviluppo di query e nella definizione di procedure operative, nonch√© nella gestione e ottimizzazione della procedura di cost allocation.
Reportistica: supportare lo sviluppo e l‚Äôimplementazione di report e dashboard per comunicare i risultati delle analisi e facilitare la presa di decisioni da parte dei responsabili.
Data Modeling: creare modelli e strumenti di analisi predittiva per supportare la previsione delle tendenze e la valutazione degli impatti delle decisioni aziendali.
Collaborazione interfunzionale: essere in grado di interfacciarsi con le diverse strutture aziendali per comprenderne di supporto analitico e le esigenze informative del management.
Ottimizzazione dei processi: identificare opportunit√† per ottimizzare i processi aziendali attraverso l'analisi dei dati e la proposta di soluzioni migliorative.

Esperienza nell‚Äôanalisi ed interpretazione dei dati

Buona conoscenza di Excel
Conoscenza avanzata di SQL. Nice to have conoscenza di altri linguaggi di programmazione (e.g. Python)
Esperienza nell'utilizzo di software di business intelligence e data analytics (Qlik Sense, Power BI, Tableau)

Passione per l‚Äôanalisi e la visualizzazione dei dati. Attenzione al dettaglio e capacit√† di problem-solving
Attitudine e coerenza con la cultura dell‚Äôapprendimento continuo e dell‚Äôinnovazione

Title: Analyst, Data Analysis
Description:
Job Description

Job Purpose

The role of the Data Analyst requires the maintenance and integration of both static and dynamic data related to equity securities listed on global stock exchanges and of related Entities, including all possible corporate actions and the types of dividends distributed.

This role calls for accuracy and a solid understanding of all types of equity or capital-participation financial instruments. Additionally, knowledge of national and international taxation related to the financial securities under analysis is required. The analyst is also responsible for managing the entity database, ensuring proper codification and the corporate group structure. A proactive attitude towards client interaction, strong problem-solving skills and teamwork abilities are also essential for this role.

Responsibilities


Track all life cycle events of financial instruments (such as dividends, corporate actions, etc.) for the full set of securities listed on designated stock exchanges.
Collect company and security data requested by clients, ensure complete coverage of corporate groups, and monitor Initial Public Offerings (IPOs)
Acquire financial data for issuers and securities from relevant markets
Manage both ordinary and extraordinary corporate actions involving issuers.
Interact occasionally with companies (e.g., investor relations) to acquire and update corporate information
Deliver client support via the help desk, assisting with the content monitored and implemented within internal systems
Analyze, monitor, and maintain specific tax-related content concerning the securities under review


Knowledge And Experience


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in an economic field
Experience in the financial services industry would be an asset
Strong collaboration skills - ability to navigate cross functional teams to deliver on shared objectives
Must have the ability to develop strong relationships with colleagues at all levels of the organization
Understanding of how data is stored and flows through systems and databases
Proficiency in English and Italian (spoken and written)
Experience in querying and retrieving data from structured databases (e.g. SQL) and in using programming languages such as Python

HTML:
Job Description

Job Purpose

The role of the Data Analyst requires the maintenance and integration of both static and dynamic data related to equity securities listed on global stock exchanges and of related Entities, including all possible corporate actions and the types of dividends distributed.

This role calls for accuracy and a solid understanding of all types of equity or capital-participation financial instruments. Additionally, knowledge of national and international taxation related to the financial securities under analysis is required. The analyst is also responsible for managing the entity database, ensuring proper codification and the corporate group structure. A proactive attitude towards client interaction, strong problem-solving skills and teamwork abilities are also essential for this role.

Responsibilities

  • Track all life cycle events of financial instruments (such as dividends, corporate actions, etc.) for the full set of securities listed on designated stock exchanges.
  • Collect company and security data requested by clients, ensure complete coverage of corporate groups, and monitor Initial Public Offerings (IPOs)
  • Acquire financial data for issuers and securities from relevant markets
  • Manage both ordinary and extraordinary corporate actions involving issuers.
  • Interact occasionally with companies (e.g., investor relations) to acquire and update corporate information
  • Deliver client support via the help desk, assisting with the content monitored and implemented within internal systems
  • Analyze, monitor, and maintain specific tax-related content concerning the securities under review

Knowledge And Experience

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in an economic field
  • Experience in the financial services industry would be an asset
  • Strong collaboration skills - ability to navigate cross functional teams to deliver on shared objectives
  • Must have the ability to develop strong relationships with colleagues at all levels of the organization
  • Understanding of how data is stored and flows through systems and databases
  • Proficiency in English and Italian (spoken and written)
  • Experience in querying and retrieving data from structured databases (e.g. SQL) and in using programming languages such as Python

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

With over 5,000 employees based in more than 80 countries across the globe, our teams provide industry leading expertise that spans:


Consumer Engagement
Parts, Accessories & Service Performance
Actionable Insights
Diagnostics & Repair Enhancement
Warranty and Repair Efficiency
Technical Information
Learning Solutions
Sales Performance


Building trust since 1931, our proven track record means that we now partner with almost every car manufacturer on the market.

The MSXI Purpose

To empower Movers and Makers to thrive in our ever-changing world

The MSXI Mission

To harness our expertise in mobility, the creativity of our global teams,

and the power of technology, to craft tailored and innovative solutions

The MSXI Vision

To enhance every journey in the world of mobility

Job Description

Business Data Analyst

40 hours per week, Monday-Friday

Rome, hybrid

Are you an automotive fan and have a passion for data analysis? Do you enjoy collecting and analyzing data to detect improvements? MSXI has the job for you!

MSX is looking for a proactive and enthusiastic Business Data Analyst to join our team in Rome.

The Role

Responsibilities

As part of our team, you will support the data management and analysis processes as well as the development and deployment of our Data and AI literacy program. Your primary responsibilities will include collecting, organizing, and interpreting data to help guide decision-making processes. Your key tasks will be:


Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations that provide insights into Lean program performance and business operations
Provide data-driven recommendations to stakeholder
Document processes, findings, and recommendations clearly and effectively for both technical and non-technical audiences


Qualifications

About you

About

We would love to welcome a new colleague passionate about the automotive field, oriented to teamwork and taking the good dose of initiative to achieve results. Our ideal Business Data Analyst has a Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or a related technical field, as well as:


3+ years experience as a Business Analyst, with background in data analytics and AI
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Entry level knowledge of SQL, ETL processes, and data modeling
Experience with BI tools and data visualization platforms such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a dynamic and fast-paced environment
Experience of planning complex schedules of activities
Fluent level of English


If you‚Äôre ready to make an impact and contribute to our company‚Äôs success, apply now!

What‚Äôs in it for you?

At MSX, our employees are the force behind our success. We are dedicated to empowering and encouraging our people and offer flexible working methods to suit all. We are a Disability Confident Committed organisation who takes pride in our diverse workforce.

In Joining MSX, You Can Enjoy


Competitive salary
Company laptop and phone
Lunch voucher


Working Pattern


40 hours per week
Monday ‚Äì Friday
Rome - hybrid


You can learn more about MSX International on our website: www.msxi.com

Additional Information

MSX is an equal opportunities employer and positively encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion or belief, marital status, or pregnancy or maternity. As users of the disability confident scheme, we guarantee to interview all disabled applicants who meet the minimum criteria for the vacancy.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Responsibilities

Job Description


Acquisition of new issues priced on Euromarket and Italian markets
External contacts with lead managers/bookrunners/paying agent/calculation agents in order to create and increase contacts
Checking of daily batches
Checking of the data entered and uploaded in the database
Checking of new issues, coupons and bonds
Checking, monitoring and management of Users messages, downloading, requests
Dynamic Management of bonds future changes (increases, corporate action, redemption)
Management and checking of different Stock Exchanges: quotations and cancellations
Management of foreign Euromarket bonds and Italian domestic bonds
Management of foreign Government‚Äôs bonds: acquisitions and variations
Management of Italian domestic Government‚Äôs bonds: acquisitions and variations.
Management of Italian Municipal bonds (BOC-BOR-BOP)
Management of Italian domestic shares: acquisitions and variations, dividends, corporate action, standardized and/or customized text notes for Italians clients
Italian financial transaction tax (FTT)
Management of Italian domestic derivatives: acquisitions and variations
Management of Italian traditional warrants: acquisitions and variations
Management of all Italians issuers listed on Italian markets: acquisitions, variations, OPA, OPV, corporate actions
Checking, monitoring and management of Banca D‚ÄôItalia codes
Users help desk (sms, servicenow, emails and by phone)
Automatic entry and checking of coupons
Automatic / manual entry of Euro TLX and Italian Stock Exchange quotations.
Implementation of customized factsheets for Italian clients
Data research for the implementation of live/scheletal bonds
Request for documentation on bonds
Request and gathering of data on new issues/bonds
Analysis and checking for Unicredit factsheets (sales restrictions)
Checking and updating financial instruments for SPPI test (IFRS9)
Analysis of info from Gazzetta Ufficiale
Study and analysis of new laws and regulations (target market, priips, tlac/mrel, Consob complexity, Italian taxation)

Title: Junior Consultant Data Analyst (Intern)
Description:
We let the future guide us. Join our next generation

Vuoi fare un lavoro che sia davvero significativo e di impatto? In KPMG avrai l‚Äôopportunit√† di aiutare i clienti, la societ√†, le colleghe e i colleghi ad affrontare e risolvere le sfide pi√π attuali e complesse. KPMG Advisory offre servizi di consulenza alle imprese per affiancarle nella trasformazione del business model, nel miglioramento e nella digitalizzazione dei processi, nell'analisi e nella gestione dei rischi, nonch√© supporto nelle operazioni di finanza straordinaria.

Nel particolare, entrerai a far parte del Team di Lighthouse.

La Lighthouse √® il centro di eccellenza di KPMG Advisory che offre soluzioni di Data & Analytics sul mercato.

Unendoti al team, svilupperai soluzioni innovative attingendo dalle nostre competenze globali. Combinerai informatica, matematica, statistica e business per creare analisi predittive, presentandole e comunicandole con professionalit√† e competenza. Opererai in un ambiente orientato all'innovazione tecnologica, occupandoti dell'ingegneria dei dati, con un forte focus sulla progettazione delle informazioni e visualizzazione dei dati. Abbiamo ricevuto riconoscimenti internazionali per quanto riguarda la nostra capacit√† di interpretare e gestire i dati.

Nello specifico, ti occuperai di:


Disegno di basi dati con finalit√† analitiche
Analisi e integrazione di fonti dati
Analisi, progettazione e implementazione di reporting e cruscotti di monitoraggio
Analisi dei processi di business e disegno di modelli analitici a supporto
Implementazione di soluzioni analitiche, supporto al go-live e application maintenance.


Come As You Are - Le tue competenze e caratteristiche

Questa opportunit√† √® perfetta per te se:


Possiedi una Laurea in economia, matematica, ingegneria matematica, statistica, ingegneria informatica, ingegneria gestionale o informatica;
Hai sviluppato conoscenza in ambito dati e database (modelli dati entit√†/relazioni, DBMS)
Hai sviluppato interesse per l'ambito Business Intelligence/Data & Analytics;
Hai sviluppato la capacit√† di combinare competenze aziendali con competenze IT, inclusa la modellazione dei dati;
Hai maturato onoscenza di strumenti di Business Intelligence come Qlik, Power BI, Tableau o equivalenti.
Hai una buona padronanza della lingua inglese, preferibilmente con esperienze di studio e/o lavoro all'estero;
Possiedi conoscenza di almeno uno dei seguenti database (Oracle, SQL Server, PostgreSQL) e hai sviluppato competenze in SQL; la conoscenza di linguaggi di programmazione rappresenta un vantaggio.


Your Future With Us - Cosa troverai in KPMG


Un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, equo e che rispetta, incoraggia e valorizza le diversit√†;
Un contesto stimolante e dinamico che incentiva la creativit√† e il lavoro di squadra;
Modalit√† di lavoro ibrida, per promuovere un sano equilibrio tra vita lavorativa e personale;
Programmi di formazione e sviluppo avanzati per rimanere sempre aggiornati;
Mindset internazionale e progettualit√† innovative;
Iniziative incentrate sul benessere psicofisico.


Together for Better ‚Äì I nostri valori e il nostro impegno

Leadership, lavoro in team, rispetto di ogni individualit√†, approfondimento continuo, trasparenza, impegno verso la comunit√†, integrit√†: questi sono i Valori di KPMG che danno vita a un ambiente aperto allo scambio di idee e di conoscenza, che permette ai nostri professionisti di esprimere tutto il loro potenziale.

Grazie all‚Äôimpegno nel favorire un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, il nostro Network risulta conforme agli standard dei requisiti ISO 30415, sul Sistema di Gestione per la Diversit√† e l‚ÄôInclusione, e UNI PdR 125, relativa alla parit√† di genere. All‚Äôinterno del nostro Impact Plan - Our Impact Plan (kpmg.com) - trovi riassunte tutte le azioni che stiamo portando avanti su tematiche ambientali, sociali e di governance (ESG).

Unisciti a noi!

I tuoi dati saranno trattati nel pieno rispetto delle disposizioni del Regolamento (UE) n. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - "GDPR") e successive modifiche. Per ulteriori informazioni, consultare l'informativa sulla privacy di KPMG.

KPMG Advisory S.p.A. garantisce le pari opportunit√†

At KPMG - no secrets with big data

We let the future guide us. Join our next generation

Do you want to pursue a profession that is truly meaningful and impactful? At KPMG, you will have the opportunity to help clients, the company and colleagues address and solve the most current and complex challenges. KPMG Advisory offers consulting services to companies to assist them in business model transformation, process improvement and digitisation, risk analysis and management, and support in extraordinary finance transactions.

Specifically, you will join our Lighthouse team.

Lighthouse is the KPMG Advisory centre of excellence delivering an array of data & analytics solutions.

Alongside the team, you will develop innovative solutions by drawing on our global expertise,with access to shared knowledge from our centres of excellence Your experience in IT, mathematics and statistics along with your corporate expertise will allow you to design and implement predictive analytical solutions, integrating different factors and presenting them in a professional manner. In a business- and technological innovation-orientated environment, your work will embrace data science, data engineering and information visualisation.

Specifically, you will be tasked with:


Designing databases for analytical purposes
Analyzing and integrating data sources
Analyzing, designing, and implementing reporting and monitoring dashboards
Analyzing business processes and designing analytical models to support them
Implementing analytical solutions, go-live support, and application maintenance.


Skills

Come As You Are - Your skills and characteristics

This is the perfect opportunity for you if:


You have a degree in economics, mathematics, mathematical engineering, statistics, computer engineering, management engineering, or computer science.
You have developed knowledge in the field of data and databases (entity/relationship data models, DBMS).
You have developed an interest in the field of Business Intelligence/Data & Analytics.
You have developed the ability to combine business skills with IT skills, including data modeling;
You have a good command of English, preferably with experience studying and/or working abroad;
You have knowledge of at least one of the following databases (Oracle, SQL Server, PostgreSQL) and have developed skills in SQL; knowledge of programming languages is an advantage.


Your Future With Us - What you‚Äôll find at KPMG


An inclusive and equitable work environment that respects, encourages and values diversity.
A challenging and dynamic environment that encourages creativity and teamwork.
Hybrid work arrangements to promote a healthy work-life balance.
Advanced training and development programmes to stay current.
International mindset and innovative projects.
Initiatives focused on mental and physical well-being.


Together for Better ‚Äì Our values and commitment

Leadership, teamwork, respect every individual, continuous learning, transparency, commitment to the community and integrity. These are the KPMG values that create an environment that encourages the sharing of ideas and knowledge, so our professionals can achieve their full potential.

AAs a result of our commitment to fostering an inclusive work environment, our Network complies with the standards of the ISO 30415 requirements, on the Diversity and Inclusion Management System, and UNI PdR 125, relating to gender equality. Within our Impact Plan - Our Impact Plan (kpmg.com) - you will find summarised all the actions we are taking on environmental, social and governance (ESG) issues.

Join us!

Your data will be processed in full compliance with the provisions of Regulation (EU) no. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - ‚ÄúGDPR‚Äù), as amended. For more information, please see KPMG‚Äôs privacy policy.

KPMG Advisory S.p.A. is an equal opportunity employer.

At KPMG, you will have the opportunity to help clients, the company and colleagues address and solve the most current and complex challenges. KPMG Advisory offers consulting services to companies to assist them in business model transformation, process improvement and digitisation, risk analysis and management, and support in extraordinary finance transactions.

Specifically, you will join our Lighthouse team.

Lighthouse is the KPMG Advisory centre of excellence delivering an array of data & analytics solutions.

Alongside the team, you will develop innovative solutions by drawing on our global expertise,with access to shared knowledge from our centres of excellence Your experience in IT, mathematics and statistics along with your corporate expertise will allow you to design and implement predictive analytical solutions, integrating different factors and presenting them in a professional manner. In a business- and technological innovation-orientated environment, your work will embrace data science, data engineering and information visualisation.

Specifically, you will be tasked with:

  • Designing databases for analytical purposes
  • Analyzing and integrating data sources
  • Analyzing, designing, and implementing reporting and monitoring dashboards
  • Analyzing business processes and designing analytical models to support them
  • Implementing analytical solutions, go-live support, and application maintenance.

Skills

 Come As You Are - Your skills and characteristics

This is the perfect opportunity for you if:

  • You have a degree in economics, mathematics, mathematical engineering, statistics, computer engineering, management engineering, or computer science.
  • You have developed knowledge in the field of data and databases (entity/relationship data models, DBMS).
  • You have developed an interest in the field of Business Intelligence/Data & Analytics.
  • You have developed the ability to combine business skills with IT skills, including data modeling;
  • You have a good command of English, preferably with experience studying and/or working abroad;
  • You have knowledge of at least one of the following databases (Oracle, SQL Server, PostgreSQL) and have developed skills in SQL; knowledge of programming languages is an advantage.

Your Future With Us - What you‚Äôll find at KPMG

  • An inclusive and equitable work environment that respects, encourages and values diversity.
  • A challenging and dynamic environment that encourages creativity and teamwork.
  • Hybrid work arrangements to promote a healthy work-life balance.
  • Advanced training and development programmes to stay current.
  • International mindset and innovative projects.
  • Initiatives focused on mental and physical well-being.

Together for Better ‚Äì Our values and commitment

Leadership, teamwork, respect every individual, continuous learning, transparency, commitment to the community and integrity. These are the KPMG values that create an environment that encourages the sharing of ideas and knowledge, so our professionals can achieve their full potential.

AAs a result of our commitment to fostering an inclusive work environment, our Network complies with the standards of the ISO 30415 requirements, on the Diversity and Inclusion Management System, and UNI PdR 125, relating to gender equality. Within our Impact Plan - Our Impact Plan (kpmg.com) - you will find summarised all the actions we are taking on environmental, social and governance (ESG) issues.

Join us!

Your data will be processed in full compliance with the provisions of Regulation (EU) no. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - ‚ÄúGDPR‚Äù), as amended. For more information, please see KPMG‚Äôs privacy policy.

KPMG Advisory S.p.A. is an equal opportunity employer.

Title: Automotive Data Analyst

La risorsa riporter√† al Project Manager del progetto e si occuper√† delle seguenti attivit√† primarie in modo autonomo e con un crescente grado di responsabilit√†:




Produzione della reportistica interna
Aggiornamento delle dashboard e di presentazioni per il Cliente committente
Acquisizione dei dati funzionali all‚Äôanalisi e al monitoraggio dei KPI‚Äôs, al fine di confrontare l‚Äôandamento delle performance

Partecipazione a meeting di follow-up con il Cliente committente ed il relativo HQ




La risorsa, da inserire in un contesto denso di obiettivi ambiziosi, con reali possibilit√† di crescita all‚Äôinterno e sviluppo trasversale, cooperer√† costruttivamente al raggiungimento del miglior risultato del progetto attivandosi proattivamente anche per la diffusione ed il rispetto dei valori aziendali.




REQUISITI MINIMI

Laurea in discipline tecniche o economiche

Conoscenza avanzata del Pacchetto Office, in particolare Excel e Power Point
Master DAX and M languages
Buona conoscenza di Power BI, Power automate e Power Query
Precisione, affidabilit√† e capacit√† organizzative
Orientamento ai risultati




REQUISITI PREFERENZIALI

Esperienza pregressa nel settore della mobilit√† presso Dealer, Case costruttrici o Societ√† di servizi

Title: Junior Data Science - SAS
HTML:
We let the future guide us. Join our next generation

Vuoi fare un lavoro che sia davvero significativo e di impatto? In KPMG avrai l‚Äôopportunit√† di aiutare i clienti, la societ√†, le colleghe e i colleghi ad affrontare e risolvere le sfide pi√π attuali e complesse. KPMG Advisory offre servizi di consulenza alle imprese per affiancarle nella trasformazione del business model, nel miglioramento e nella digitalizzazione dei processi, nell'analisi e nella gestione dei rischi, nonch√© supporto nelle operazioni di finanza straordinaria.

Nel particolare, entrerai a far parte del Team di Lighthouse di Roma.

La Lighthouse √® il centro di eccellenza di KPMG Advisory che offre soluzioni di Data & Analytics sul mercato.

Unendoti al team, svilupperai soluzioni innovative attingendo dalle nostre competenze globali. Combinerai informatica, matematica, statistica e business per creare analisi predittive, presentandole e comunicandole con professionalit√† e competenza. Opererai in un ambiente orientato all'innovazione tecnologica, occupandoti di Data Science, Advanced Analytics, Predictive Maintenance, Natural Language Processing e molto altro! Abbiamo ricevuto riconoscimenti internazionali per quanto riguarda la nostra capacit√† di interpretare e gestire i dati.

Nello specifico, ti occuperai di:

  • Integrazione dei dati: capire quali fonti di dati sono importanti e come devono essere trattate al fine di potenziare nuovi strumenti e metodologie Data Driven;
  • Modellazione: sviluppo di nuovi modelli di Machine Learning ad hoc per soddisfare le richieste e i requisiti aziendali;
  • Piattaforme di analisi avanzate: Sviluppo di pipeline ML complete, dall'ingestione dei dati alle applicazioni frontend.
  • Incontri ed eventi orientati al business: concentrandosi fortemente sulla condivisione con gli utenti aziendali dei dettagli del progetto, si costruisce la fiducia nello strumento e nella metodologia utilizzata per svilupparlo;

Come As You Are - Le tue competenze e caratteristiche

Questa opportunit√† √® perfetta per te se:

  • Possiedi una Laurea in Data Science, Informatica, Ingegneria Informatica, Ingegneria Matematica, Statistica o altra ritenuta attinente;
  • Hai una buona conoscenza dei principali linguaggi di programmazione come Python e SAS;
  • Hai competenze nella comprensione del ciclo di vita dei modelli: preparazione dei dati dell'ultimo miglio, sviluppo di modelli di intelligenza artificiale e distribuzione in un'infrastruttura cloud;
  • Hai una buona conoscenza di: Data Warehouse, estrazione, manipolazione e preparazione dei dati;
  • Hai competenze di base di Data Visualization, con soluzioni Enterprise (es. PowerBI) o soluzioni open-source come ggplot o plotly;
  • Hai competenze di base con le principali piattaforme cloud (Azure, AWS);
  • Hai una buona padronanza della lingua inglese, preferibilmente con esperienze di studio e/o lavoro all'estero;

Your Future With Us - Cosa troverai in KPMG

  • Un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, equo e che rispetta, incoraggia e valorizza le diversit√†
  • Un contesto stimolante e dinamico che incentiva la creativit√† e il lavoro di squadra
  • Modalit√† di lavoro ibrida, per promuovere un sano equilibrio tra vita lavorativa e personale
  • Programmi di formazione e sviluppo avanzati per rimanere sempre aggiornati
  • Mindset internazionale e progettualit√† innovative
  • Iniziative incentrate sul benessere psicofisico

Together for Better ‚Äì I nostri valori e il nostro impegno

Leadership, lavoro in team, rispetto di ogni individualit√†, approfondimento continuo, trasparenza, impegno verso la comunit√†, integrit√†: questi sono i Valori di KPMG che danno vita a un ambiente aperto allo scambio di idee e di conoscenza, che permette ai nostri professionisti di esprimere tutto il loro potenziale.

Grazie all‚Äôimpegno nel favorire un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, il nostro Network risulta conforme agli standard dei requisiti ISO 30415, sul Sistema di Gestione per la Diversit√† e l‚ÄôInclusione, e UNI PdR 125, relativa alla parit√† di genere. All‚Äôinterno del nostro Impact Plan - Our Impact Plan (kpmg.com) - trovi riassunte tutte le azioni che stiamo portando avanti su tematiche ambientali, sociali e di governance (ESG).

Unisciti a noi!

I tuoi dati saranno trattati nel pieno rispetto delle disposizioni del Regolamento (UE) n. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - "GDPR") e successive modifiche. Per ulteriori informazioni, consultare l'informativa sulla privacy di KPMG.

KPMG Advisory S.p.A. garantisce le pari opportunit√†.

We let the future guide us. Join our next generation

Do you want to do work that is truly meaningful and impactful? At KPMG you will have the opportunity to help clients, society, and colleagues address and solve the most current and complex challenges. KPMG Advisory provides consulting services to companies to assist them in business model transformation, process improvement and digitization, risk analysis and management, and support in extraordinary finance transactions.

Specifically, you will join the Lighthouse Team in Rome.

Lighthouse is KPMG Advisory's center of excellence offering Data & Analytics solutions in the market.

Joining the team, you will develop innovative solutions drawing on our global expertise. You will combine computer science, mathematics, statistics and business to create predictive analytics, presenting and communicating them with professionalism and expertise. You will work in a technology innovation-oriented environment, dealing with Data Science, Advanced Analytics, Predictive Maintenance, Natural Language Processing and more! We have received international recognition for our ability to interpret and manage data.

Specifically, you will be involved in:

  • Data Integration: understanding which data sources are important and how they should be treated in order to enhance new Data Driven tools and methodologies;
  • Modeling: developing new Machine Learning models ad hoc to meet business demands and requirements;
  • Advanced Analytics Platforms: Development of complete ML pipelines from data ingestion to frontend applications.
  • Business-oriented meetings and events: Strong focus on sharing project details with business users builds confidence in the tool and the methodology used to develop it;

Come As You Are - Your Skills And Characteristics.

This opportunity is perfect for you if:

  • You hold a Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Mathematical Engineering, Statistics or other deemed relevant;
  • You have a good understanding of major programming languages such as Python and SAS;
  • You have skills in understanding the model lifecycle: last mile data preparation, artificial intelligence model development and deployment in a cloud infrastructure;
  • You have a good understanding of: Data Warehouse, data extraction, manipulation and preparation;
  • You have basic skills in Data Visualization, with Enterprise solutions (e.g., PowerBI) or open-source solutions such as ggplot or plotly;
  • You have basic skills with major cloud platforms (Azure, AWS);
  • You have a good command of the English language, preferably with study and/or work experience abroad;

Your Future With Us - What you will find at KPMG.

  • An inclusive, equitable work environment that respects, encourages and values diversity
  • A stimulating and dynamic environment that encourages creativity and teamwork
  • Hybrid work mode to promote a healthy work-life balance
  • Advanced training and development programs to stay current
  • International mindset and innovative projects
  • Initiatives focused on mental and physical well-being

Together for Better - Our Values and Commitment

Leadership, teamwork, respect for each individuality, continuous deepening, transparency, commitment to the community, integrity: these are KPMG's Values that give rise to an environment open to the exchange of ideas and knowledge, enabling our professionals to reach their full potential.

As a result of our commitment to fostering an inclusive work environment, our Network complies with the standards of the ISO 30415 requirements, on the Diversity and Inclusion Management System, and UNI PdR 125, relating to gender equality. Within our Impact Plan - Our Impact Plan (kpmg.com) - you will find summarized all the actions we are taking on environmental, social and governance (ESG) issues.

Join us!

Your data will be processed in full compliance with the provisions of Regulation (EU) No. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - ‚ÄúGDPR‚Äù) as amended. For more information, please see KPMG's privacy policy.

KPMG Advisory S.p.A. guarantees equal opportunities.

Title: AML Data Analyst Intern
Description:
Job Description

AML Data Analyst Intern

AML Data Analyst Intern

Rome, Italy

This is Worldline

We are the innovators at the heart of the payments technology industry, shaping how the world pays and gets paid. The solutions our people build today power the growth of millions of businesses tomorrow. From your local coffee shop to unicorns and international banks. From San Francisco to Auckland. We are in every corner of the world, in every part of commerce. And just as we help our customers accelerate their business, we are committed to helping our people accelerate their careers. Together, we shape the evolution.

The Opportunity

Join a dynamic team dedicated to support the growth in full compliance with Worldline‚Äôs merchant risk policies safeguarding our financial forefront, where every day offers the chance to make an impact in the fight against money laundering and terrorism financing. We are seeking a AML Data Analyst Intern to join our team, reporting to the Head of First Line of Defense Risk and Compliance at Worldline Merchant Services Italia. Your role will play a crucial role in collecting, processing, and analyzing data to support business decision-making, to streamline operations and ensure compliance with the company's standards.

Day-to-Day Responsibilities


Reporting KYC: Gather data needed for AML KYC purposes from different business sources and prepare monthly reports detailing KYC information, ensuring weekly updates to reflect current review status in monthly committees;
Reporting Internal Committee: Compile data related to KYC, Credit, and Fraud activities into an annual report file including statistics and updates from involved departments (Compliance, Operations, AML) on periodic basis;
Reporting Business Information KPIs: Analyze Business Information KPIs in onboarding and ongoing merchant activities; Identify consumption trends or changes, highlighting concerns or improvement opportunities in relation to contractual consumption caps;
Preparation of Functional Analysis Files for IT Implementations: Support internal Project Managers in the collaboration with Compliance, Operations, Information Technology to collect and document business requirements for different IT Implementation.


Who Are We Looking For

We look for big thinkers. People who can drive positive change, step up and show what‚Äôs next ‚Äì people with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. In practice this means:


Master's degree in Economics, Management, or Law;
Familiarity with data analysis tools and software (e.g., Excel, SQL, Python, R);
Strong critical thinking, analytical, and organizational skills;
Excellent communication skills;
Basic knowledge of KYC and AML processes as a plus;
Good level of English in speaking and writing.


Perks & Benefits

At Worldline you‚Äôll get the chance to be at the heart of the global payments technology industry and shape how the world pays and gets paid. On top of that, you will also:


Be part of a company guided by a strong purpose to do good and recognized as top 1% of the most sustainable companies in all sectors worldwide.
Work with inspiring colleagues and be empowered to learn, grow and accelerate your career.
Enjoy remote work (50%).
Enjoy wide range of training through our eLearning platforms (LinkedIn Learning, Percipio, Speex, Cross Knowledge).


Shape the evolution

We are on an exciting journey towards the next frontiers of payments technology, and we look for big thinkers, people with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. Here you‚Äôll work with ambitious colleagues from around the world, take on unique challenges as a team, and make a real impact on the society. With an empowering culture, strong technology and extensive training opportunities, we help you accelerate your career - wherever you decide to go. Join our global team of 18,000 innovators and shape a tomorrow that is yours to own.

Learn more about life at Worldline at jobs.worldline.com

We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as an individual with a disability, or any applicable legally protected characteristics.

Title: Analytics & Insight Internship
HTML:
Job Location

ROME GENERAL OFFICE

Job Description

Do you have a passion to influence business strategy, product design, commercial vision and the media landscape? An ambition to drive the change through deep consumer understanding and advanced analytics is also what we are looking for!

If so, then this role is perfect for you!

In Analytics & Insights (A&I), we use our boundless curiosity to discover what consumers want, why they want it and how we can we influence them through immersive exploration and big data analytics. We uncover unexpected insights and innovate the way P&G runs business.

A career in A&I will build your ability to influence and think strategically, across a breadth of experiences on multiple P&G business.

As An Intern In Analytics And Insights, You Will

  • Act as a business strategy consultant, guiding decisions of P&G Top management in several business domains (consumer, customer, digital etc.);
  • Be part of a multi-functional business team, working closely with Marketing, Finance, Sales, R&D and others, constantly exploring new opportunities for business growth;
  • Combine analytical expertise and deep consumer understanding, to anticipate opportunities and answer critical business questions;
  • Grow your skills continuously, improving your mastery in big data analytics, as well as immersive in-depth researches. You will have the opportunity to explore new ways to learn and to connect with internal and external guides worldwide.

What We Offer You

  • Responsibilities as of Day 1 ‚Äì You will be given specific projects and responsibilities working on real and live business challenges, just like a true P&Ger;
  • Continuous coaching ‚Äì You will work with passionate people and receive both formal training as well as day-to-day mentoring from your manager;
  • Dynamic and respectful work environment ‚Äì Employees are at the core, we value every individual and encourage initiatives, promoting work/life balance;
  • Compensation & Benefits: you will receive a competitive internship salary as well as other benefits whilst you are with us.

How To Apply

  • Just apply online via clicking the button below;
  • Attach your CV in English;
  • Attach any documents you consider relevant: motivation letter, recommendations, certificates etc.

Job Qualifications

What we are looking for:

  • Master students or recent graduates with strong analytical skills and Integrative thinking;
  • Proven leadership and teamwork skills, with a ‚Äúcan-do‚Äù approach and an unusual skew to innovate;
  • Boundless curiosity and the passion to generate results;
  • Data Analytics background represents a plus;
  • Have creativity, innovation, initiative and follow-through with your goals, along with strong written and verbal communication skills;
  • Are fluent in Italian and have an excellent ability to communicate in English;
  • Are available for a minimum of 3 months, preferably 6 months internship.

At P&G #weseeequal

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate against individuals based on race, color, gender, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, citizenship, disability, veteran status, HIV/AIDS status, or any other legally protected factor.

At P&G we strive to build a culture where everyone feels welcome, included, and able to bring their full selves to work.

Our mission of Diversity and Inclusion is: ‚ÄúEveryone valued. Everyone included. Everyone performing at their peak‚Äù.

We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process. Please click here if you require an accommodation during the application process. Please make sure to wait to hear back from us regarding your accommodation before proceeding with the online assessment, we thank you in advance for your patience.

Full time

Job Number

R000119407

Job Segmentation

Internships (Job Segmentation)

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Entra nel nostro mondo.

Trasforma insieme a noi.

Business Intelligence Analyst



Quale sar√† la tua sfida?¬†

Supporterai la delivery tecnica ed applicativa dei progetti in ambito Business Intelligence, svolgendo attivit√† di analisi e sviluppo ed utilizzando¬†tecnologie di¬†Data Visualization, nell‚Äôambito di progettualit√† o in modalit√† a servizio presso i nostri clienti.

Sarai coinvolto in attivit√† di raccolta ed analisi dei business requirement, analizzando consistenza e accuratezza dei requisiti. Analizzerai le fonti dati implementando servizi di progettazione dati con competenza e metodologia in ambito¬†Data Modeling.

Svilupperai sistemi di analisi delle performance,¬†report interattivi¬†e
dashboard analitiche¬†con tecnologie come¬†QlikView,¬†QlikSense,¬†Tableau,¬†PowerBI,¬†SAP BO¬†per elaborare le analisi e rappresentare i risultati, implementando le metriche pi√π efficaci al fine di costruire validi strumenti di supporto alle decisioni di business.

Tra le tue responsabilit√† potranno anche esserci l‚Äôestrazione e rappresentazione sintetica di analisi complesse realizzate da altre figure professionali (es.¬†Data Scientist, Data Governance expert, Data Architect, Data Project Manager).

Ti sar√† richiesto, in modo commisurato alla tua seniority, di dimostrare ed evolvere le capacit√† di costruire relazioni con clienti, vendor di tecnologie, partner, assicurare il raggiungimento della migliore elaborazione dei risultati delle tue analisi comunicandoli efficacemente a colleghi e Clienti e, per finire, il coordinamento di analisti pi√π junior all‚Äôinterno di team articolati.

¬† Sei tu il nostro nuovo collega?

Requisiti Indispensabili:


Laurea Specialistica in Ingegneria Informatica, Ingegneria Matematica, Ingegneria delle Telecomunicazioni, Informatica, Statistica, Ingegneria Gestionale o discipline affini (STEM)
Esperienza pregressa in almeno una tecnologia di Data Visualization (e.g. QlikView, QlikSense, Tableau, PowerBI, SAP BO)
Conoscenza di tecnologie di data processing and extraction Big Data (Hive, Pig, Flume, Sqoop, Python basico)
Ottima conoscenza e competenza in ambito SQL
Conoscenza fluente di italiano e inglese


Plus:


Capacit√† di realizzare stored procedure e SQL function
MS Excel avanzato (VBA programming)
SAS Base/Guide, Python, R, Java, C++, Javascript/HTML, PHP


Soft Skills:


Standing consulenziale
Ottime doti relazionali e comunicative
Orientamento al cliente e al raggiungimento degli obiettivi
Buona attitudine a lavorare in team
Precisione e stress tolerance nel rispetto delle scadenze
Disponibilit√† per trasferte in Italia e all‚Äôestero
Perch√® Bip?

People at the center of our culture

Fiducia e collaborazione, imprenditorialit√† e coraggio, meritocrazia e sviluppo guidano la crescita delle nostre persone.

Lavorare in BIP √® un'esperienza sfidante, in cui il merito paga e l'innovazione avviene attraverso idee coraggiose, collaborazione e un rapporto di fiducia con i nostri clienti.¬†

Challenging yourself

Avrai la possibilit√† di metterti alla prova in contesti progettuali diversi in termini di ambito, natura delle attivit√† e stakeholders coinvolti. Vedrai valorizzato il tuo spirito di iniziativa, la tua passione, l‚Äôautonomia e la capacit√† di assumerti responsabilit√† e metterti in gioco.

Unlocking your potential

Potrai partecipare a + di 300 corsi formativi all‚Äôavanguardia per accrescere le tue competenze su tecnologie e temi di business emergenti.

Work-life Integration

Troverai una policy che supporta¬†lo smartworking¬†fino al 100% del proprio tempo e favorisce il work-life integration

Diversity & Inclusion

Valorizziamo l'unicit√† e ci impegniamo a garantire che tutti i dipendenti abbiano pari opportunit√† di dare un contributo ed esprimere al massimo il potenziale nell'ambiente di lavoro.¬†

Il nostro approccio alla¬†diversit√†¬†e all'inclusione¬†si fonda sui principi di etica e integrit√† e rappresenta il fattore determinante per lo sviluppo di orizzonti, di crescita personale e aziendale, pi√π ampi.

Promuoviamo l'inserimento e l'integrazione lavorativa delle persone appartenenti alle categorie protette - in base a quanto disciplinato dalla legge 68/99-.

¬† Next Steps

Una volta ricevuto il tuo cv ci prenderemo del tempo per valutarlo attentamente.

Se c‚Äô√® un match con questa o con altre posizioni aperte all‚Äôinterno del Gruppo, ti contatteremo per iniziare la nostra conoscenza reciproca.

L‚Äôiter di selezione comprende generalmente un colloquio con HR, un colloquio tecnico con un line manager ed un eventuale colloquio con un Partner.

L‚Äôordine e il numero delle interviste potrebbero variare a seconda delle esigenze di recruiting.

In alternativa, saremo felici di conservare il tuo CV nel nostro database per poterlo rivalutare per altre opportunit√† future.

Se dovessi identificare tu stesso ulteriori posizioni di tuo interesse ed in linea con il tuo profilo, aspettiamo la tua candidatura per poterla valutare nuovamente.

Su di Noi

Nati nel 2003, abbiamo raccolto e valorizzato l‚Äôesperienza storica della consulenza e abbiamo aggiunto due ingredienti chiave: l‚Äôinnovazione e la digitalizzazione.

Grazie a questo percorso siamo oggi oltre 4500 professionisti, presenti in 13 Paesi, con oltre 4500 progetti alle spalle e le conoscenze pi√π all‚Äôavanguardia nell'ambito della Digital Transformation, Data Science, Cybersecurity, Industry 4.0, IOT e di tutte le Disruptive Technologies che mettiamo a servizio di ogni settore di mercato.

dashboard analitiche con tecnologie come QlikView, QlikSense, Tableau, PowerBI, SAP BO per elaborare le analisi e rappresentare i risultati, implementando le metriche pi√π efficaci al fine di costruire validi strumenti di supporto alle decisioni di business.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
HTML:
CHI SIAMO:

iQera Italia S.p.A. √® una societ√† italiana leader nel settore del Recupero Crediti, Real Estate, Due Diligence e Outsourcing di processi aziendali.

Siamo attivi nel mercato italiano degli NPL (Non Performing Loans) e UTP (Unlikely to Pay) come branch locale di iQera Group e come Servicer specializzato nella gestione integrata del credito e dei beni immobiliari.

I servizi offerti da iQera si basano su una professionalit√† maturata in oltre 30 anni di esperienza, creando un modello integrato di supporto e gestione a 360¬∞ nel settore del Credito e del Real Estate, attraverso competenze, intelligenza relazionale e un ampio utilizzo della tecnologia e dell'intelligenza artificiale.

Cerchiamo, per la nostra sede di lavoro a Roma, un Senior Data Analyst da inserire all‚Äôinterno della divisione PORTFOLIO & DATA MANAGEMENT.


COSA FARAI:

  • Gestione progetti e attivit√† di analisi di portafogli NPL;
  • Attivit√† di Underwriting su singoli posizioni o su portafogli NPL;
  • Attivit√† di PMO nelle due Diligence e Business Plan su portafogli NPL;
  • Creazione, adattamento ed esecuzione di modelli statistici di interpretazione dei dati;
  • Creazione di report e documenti con i risultati delle analisi da presentare ai clienti interni ed esterni.


I TUOI REQUISITI:

  • Laurea magistrale in discipline tecniche, preferibilmente in Data Science, Ingegneria, Matematica, Fisica e Scienze Statistiche;
  • Esperienza di almeno 5 anni come Data Analyst;
  • Esperienza pregressa in attivit√† di Underwriting;
  • Ottima conoscenza in ambito statistico;
  • Buona capacit√† nella modellazione dei dati;
  • Ottima conoscenza di data visualization;
  • Ottima conoscenza dei metodi di analisi dei Big Data e dei tool di analisi (Excel, R, Phyton, Sas)
  • Buon team working e problem solving, ottimo orientamento al risultato;
  • Flessibilit√† e forte motivazione;
  • Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese.


Rappresenter√† un valore aggiunto l‚Äôesperienza maturata come Data Analyst nella valutazione di portafogli NPL



DA NOI TROVERAI:

  • ambiente di lavoro internazionale;
  • opportunit√† di crescita professionale;
  • formazione continua;
  • Contratto di lavoro subordinato, CCNL Commercio, da commisurare in base all‚Äôesperienza.


La ricerca √® rivolta a tutti i generi (L.903/77). Gli interessati possono inoltrare il proprio CV dando l'autorizzazione al trattamento dei dati personali, ai sensi D.Lgs.196/03.

Title: Junior Consultant Data Engineer (Intern)
HTML:
